Due to a low income of her husband, Asma and her husband couldn't purchase a T.V. This thing makes the family feels very inconvenienced from this condition. 

Asma doesn't have enough money to make the necessary improvement for the house. For this reason, she applied for a loan of 40,000 YER from AMB to buy a T.V. for the house.

Asma hopes to purchase other necessary home appliances such as a new washing machine and refrigerator for the house.

loans.use: To buy a T.V. for her house.

loans.name: Veronica Del Rocio

texts.es: Verónica es una señora de 44 años de edad,  es madre soltera y sus hijos tienen  14 y 16 años de edad, Verónica se dedica a la venta de ropa, juguetes y accesorios de cada temporada por ejemplo en diciembre accesorios de navidad, el crédito lo necesita para comprar ropa que la vende de manera ambulante, lo que Verónica aspira de este negocio es que se mejoren sus ventas para tener los ingresos y de ahí educar a sus hijos.
texts.en: Verónica is a 44-year-old lady, is a single mother and her children are 14 and 16 years old. Verónica works selling clothing, toys and accessories for each season. For example, in December the accessories are for Christmas. She needs the loan to purchase clothing that she sells as a street vendor. What Verónica wants from this business is that her sales increase to have income and from there educate her children.

loans.use: to purchase clothing.

loans.name: Cornelia

texts.en: Cornelia is engaged in retailing used clothes. She has spent five years doing this type of work. She earns roughly 4,000 PHP per month, which helps her to support her family's daily needs. She was very happy when she became a member of Paglaum MPC because it entrusted her with a loan and the ability to maintain good standing in her credit status. Cornelia has applied for a loan in the amount of 14,900 PHP, which she will use to buy a bulk of used clothes for retail in the nearest village. She hopes and prays that her business will be blessed and able to spread love to help other people.

loans.use: to buy a bulk of used clothes

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena is 29 years old, and she lives with her husband and two-year-old daughter in Kapan City of the Syunik region. She has a higher pedagogical education, and for several years she worked as a teacher of Armenian history at the school. 

Since her child is small and needs mother care, Elena gives paid private courses of Armenian history in her house, and in this way, prepares the pupils for the entrance examinations. Like many pedagogues in Kapan City, Elelna also lacks modern technologies.  

This loan will be of great use for her since she wants to buy a computer and also professional literature for her pedagogical activities.

loans.use: to buy a computer and also professional literature for her pedagogical activities

loans.name: Martha Cecilia

texts.es: Cecilia es una señora separada de su esposo, tiene  3 hijos  de los cuales 2 estan estudiando,  Cecilia  se dedica a trabajar de empleada domestica en un restaurante y sus días libres se dedica a vender ropa, el crédito lo va a invertir en la compra  de mercadería en ropa, la aspiración de Cecilia es de seguir trabajando y  sacar adelante a sus 2 hijos y a una nieta que vive con ella.
texts.en: Cecilia is a woman separated from her spouse. She has 3 children, of whom 2 are students. Cecilia works as a domestic employee in a restaurant and on her days off, she sells clothing. The loan will be invested in the purchase of clothing merchandise. Cecilia's aspiration is to continue working and get her two children and a granddaughter who lives with her ahead.

loans.use: to purchase clothing.

loans.name: Daniel Antonio

texts.es: Daniel de 47 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa y sus dos hijas, el trabaja en una empresa privada, con lo que obtiene de su trabajo logra solventar algunos gastos del hogar, el quiere mejorar su vivienda cambiando las puertas y ventanas en el lugar que muestra la fotografía, por esa razón solicita un crédito para la compra de puertas, balcones y vidrios para ventanas para que el y su familia puedan vivir mas seguros.
texts.en: Daniel, 47 years old, lives in his own house with his wife and their two daughters. He works for a private business; with what he earns from his work, he manages to pay some of the household expenses. He wants to improve his house, replacing the doors and windows in the place shown in the photograph. For this reason, he asks for a loan to purchase doors, bars, and glass for widows so that his and his family can live more securely.

loans.use: to purchase doors, bars and glass for windows.

loans.name: Antonia Teresa

texts.es: Antonia tiene 45 años de edad y gracias a su integridad muchas personas dan buenas referencias de su persona. Ella es una mujer muy trabajadora quien hace todo lo que este en sus manos para apoyar en la economía de su hogar, ella trabaja como empleada doméstica en casa particular. Antonia solicita este crédito a FUSAI dado que desea mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda. Con el monto solicitado comprará: dos ventanas, ladrillo, cemento, arena, hierro, lámina ladrillo de piso, etc. para proceder a finalizar su vivienda colocando sus respectivas ventanas, construir un corredor, y hacer divisiones. espera poder contar con dicho  financiamiento y así poder mejorar sus condiciones habitacionales y las de su familia.
texts.en:
Antonia is 45 years old, and thanks to her integrity, many people give good references about her. She is a hard-working woman who does everything within her reach to support the finances in her home. She works as a caretaker of a private home. 

Antonia is requesting this loan from FUSAI because she wants to improve her housing conditions. With the amount requested, she will buy: two windows, bricks, cement, sand, iron, floor tiles, etc. She can then proceed with finishing her home by setting the two windows, building a hallway and making rooms. She hopes to be able to count on this financing, and thus be able to improve her housing conditions and those of her family.

loans.use: to buy two windows, bricks, cement, sand, iron, floor tiles, etc. To finish her home.

loans.name: Murad

texts.en:
Murad is a 23-year-old young client. He is not married and lives with his parents. Murad's business is in planting, landing and growing onions. He looks after his plants very well. He has worked in this business for more than two years.

He sells his harvest in the zone where he lives, and that is how he makes an income to provide for his family. This brings him 180 AZN monthly, but he gets additional income working as a taxi driver in his free time.

Murad’s situation is very hard. He needs to raise onions and care for them, but the lack of water in the region makes a problem for him. Because of this problem, productivity has fallen, and he can’t cover his family’s needs.

He applied for a 600 AZN loan in order to be able to supply water to his garden weekly. This will increase productivity again, and his family’s income will rise.

loans.use: to supply water to his garden weekly

loans.name: María Angélica

texts.es: María es una mujer de 26 años de edad y madre de un hijo de 5 años, es residente de un barrio ubicado en el municipio de Soledad, está dedicada a la venta de ropa y artículos para el hogar, su idea de negocio inició motivada por un amigo que la convenció de empezar a vender diferente tipos de productos como edredones, juego de ollas, ropa para dama y caballeros, productos cárnicos y pasabocas.  Esta emprendedora mujer tiene dos años de haberse vinculado en el comercio y cuenta con una clientela fidelizada a quienes les ofrece facilidad de pago, su gran desafío ha sido el insuficiente capital, sin embargo sus compras las realiza de contado para obtener mejores utilidades.  En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará ropa y productos congelados (deditos de queso).  Esta inversión contribuirá a ofrecer accesibilidad al crédito a sus clientes. María desea a largo plazo tener su propio almacén, para ello trabaja muy comprometida y su principal motivación es lograr ofrecerle una excelente educación a su hijo.
texts.en: María is a 26 year old woman. She has a 5 year old son. She lives in a neighborhood located in the municipality of Soledad. She works selling clothes and household items. Her business idea started motivated by a friend who convinced her to start selling different types of products such as duvets, pot sets, women and men clothes, meat products and snacks. This enterprising woman has worked for two years in commerce and has loyal customers to whom she offers financing. Her greatest challenge has been insufficient capital. However, she buys with cash in order to have better earnings. Currently, she is requesting a credikiva, her first loan with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, with which she will buy clothes and frozen items (cheese sticks). This investment will help her offer credit to her customers. Long term, Maria wishes to have her own store. For this she works very committed and her main motivation is to give her son an excellent education.

loans.use: to buy clothing and frozen products (cheese sticks)

loans.name: Antonia Isabel

texts.es:
Antonia, vive con su compañero de vida y sus dos hijos en edades de 5 y un año, su negocio es la venta de ropa y administrar una tienda de productos básicos, en la temporada escolar atiende un chalet en el centro escolar y la venta de ropa la realiza los fines de semana en las zonas aledañas.
Ella utilizará el capital para invertir en faldas, camisas, pantalones, blusas y otras prendas de vestir, así como también golosinas, bebidas, boquitas, embutidos, etc., para surtir el chalet, le permitirá ampliar su negocio y tener mejores alternativas de compra para sus clientes, pretende mejorar su situación económica y cancelar sus deudas.
Su principal sueño es tener recursos económicos para brindar educación de calidad a sus hijos y que tengan un mejor futuro.
texts.en:
Antonia lives with her life partner and their two children, ages 5 and 1. Her business is selling clothing and running a store with staple products. During the school year, she has a kiosk at a school and she does the clothing sales on the weekends in nearby areas. 

She will use the capital to invest in skirts, shirts, pants, blouses and other clothing, and also in sweets, snacks, cold cuts, etc. to stock her kiosk. This will allow her to expand her business and have better options for her customers to purchase. She plans to improve her economic situation and pay off her debts. Her primary dream is to have the economic resources to offer a quality education to her children and that they have a better future.

loans.use: to invest in skirts, shirts, pants, blouses and other clothing, and also in sweets, snacks, cold cuts, etc. to stock her kiosk.

loans.name: Naser Eddin

texts.en:
Naser Eddin is a twenty-four-year-old single man from Khan Younis. He has a stall for selling home appliances to the local clients. He would like to improve his business and expand the stall in the future.

Naser took a USD Murabaha loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy new inventory for his stall. By taking this loan, Naser will be able to increase his sales and also his income. 

Naser appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy new inventory for his stall.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: la joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 25 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto riesgo se dedica  ala elaboración y venta de piñatas desde hace varios años, la joven vive en casa propia con sus do hijos, su madre y su compañero de vida, ella esta solicitando un credito para la compra de papel periódico, alambre, pegamento, papel de diferentes colores, etc. todo por mayor para poder continuar con su trabajo y asi tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Her face in the photo above is blurred because the young lady is 25 years old and she lives in a high risk zone.

She earns a living making and selling piñatas, which she's done for several years now. 

She lives in her own home with her two children, her mother, and her life partner.

She is requesting a loan to buy wholesale supplies including newspapers, wires, glue, and construction paper in different colors. This will allow her to continue with the work and generate more income.

loans.use: to buy wholesale supplies including newspapers, wire, glue, and construction paper in different colors.

loans.name: Shahboz

texts.en: Shahboz was born in 1993. He is very hardworking and smart. Since childhood, he has dreamed of gaining a higher education and working for the benefit of society. Now, he is studying in his fourth year at Tajikistan State University of Politics and Business. Shahboz is studying Finance and the Banking System. He studies well and reads a lot of books. Shahboz is single and lives with his parents. He must pay his tuition and with this aim he is asking for a loan of 600 USD for this purpose. He awaits your mercy.

loans.use: pay his university tuition fees

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna is 46 years old and lives in Guintomoyan, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is married with 5 children now of school age.
 
Edna earns income from agribusiness, particularly in coconut production activities. She’s been engaged in this business for more than 10 years already. At present, she is also an elected barangay (village) official. She earns approximately PHP 5,000 each month doing this type of business activity, and that amount is so helpful to support her family's needs. She has requested a loan to be used in purchasing 4 piglets and 4 sacks of booster feed for her hog fattening business.
 
Edna has been a member of PMPC for 4 years. In the future, Edna hopes to expand her hog fattening business by establishing an additional pig pen at her house.

loans.use: to buy 4 piglets and 4 sacks of booster feed

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: la joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 28 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto riesgo, se dedica a la venta de agua de coco su negocio esta ubicado cerca de su lugar de residencia, y tiene muchos clientes, la joven es madre soltera vive en casa propia con su hijo, ella esta solicitando un credito para la compra de cocos por mayor para poder seguir con sus ventas y asi tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en: The young woman, whose face has been pixelated because she is 28 years old and lives in a high risk zone, works selling coconut water. Her business is located near her home and she has many customers. She is a single mother and lives in her own house with her son. She is asking for a loan to purchase coconuts in bulk to be able to continue with her sales and in this way have better income.

loans.use: to purchase coconuts in bulk.

loans.name: Alish

texts.en: Alish is 45 years old. He is a widow and lives with his lovely children. His family members are IDPs (Internally Displaced Persons) from Fuzuli city for 22 years already. Now they are living in Fuzuli region. Alish has been in the taxi driving business for long years. Today he wants to repair his car. For this reason, he has applied to Komak company. Alish needs a loan in the amount of 800 AZN (Azerbaijan New Manat) to buy a new car motor. He is thankful for help from the Kiva and Komak organizations. In the future, he wants to change cars and increase business.

loans.use: to buy a new car motor and increase business.

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
49-year-old Imelda owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) store. She sells basic commodities, like sugar, biscuits, shampoo, toothpaste, noodles, canned goods, seasonings, and many other items. She is a married woman with one grown child. She lives in Mayorga, Leyte. Besides the sari-sari store, she also raises hogs to have an additional source of income.

Imelda is asking for a loan to buy assorted grocery items for the store, like canned goods, soft drinks, beverages, and toiletries. This variety of stocks will attract more customers to shop and purchase from her store. This will be her advantage with other small store owners since she could offer variety to meet customers' needs. With this loan, she would now be able to settle her obligations and other household expenses.

Imelda wants to be successful in both her businesses. Hopefully, this will provide her with stable sources of income and give her family better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy assorted grocery items for the store, like canned goods, soft drinks, beverages, and toiletries.

loans.name: Rosa Emilia

texts.es:
Rosa de 28 años de edad, está acompañada y tiene 2 hijos, estudió hasta bachillerato su pareja vive en el extranjero y la apoya económicamente, actualmente vive con su madre y hermanos.

Rosa es comerciante y trabaja con su madre en una tienda que ambas administran, también los días domingos vende en la cancha de futbol mientras las personas ven los encuentros futbolísticos. Solicita el préstamo para comprar producto como detergentes, jabón de baño, papel higiénico, granos básicos, bebidas y demás para abastecer su tienda y acaparar la clientela, ya que la tienda que estaba en la zona cerró por algún motivo y ve la oportunidad de tener un buen negocio. Espera contar siempre con el apoyo de CrediCampo para financiar los futuros proyectos que tenga.
texts.en:
Rosa, 28, is in a relationship and has two children.  She studied through high school.  Currently she lives with her mother and her siblings.  Her partner lives abroad and helps her financially.

Rosa, a merchant, works with her mother in a store they run together.  She also sells at the soccer field while spectators are watching the matches.

She's requesting the loan to buy detergents, bath soap, toilet paper, basic grains, beverages, and other products to supply her store and attract customers.  The previous store in the area closed for some reason and she sees an opportunity to have a good business.

Rosa hopes to always have the support of CrediCampo to finance any future projects.

loans.use: to buy detergent, bath soap, toilet paper, basic grains, beverages, and other products

loans.name: Gertrudis Elena

texts.es: Gertrudis, reside en un barrio del municipio de Barranquilla, esta mujer de 39 años de edad, hace dos años se dedica a la venta de productos por catálogo, ella encontró la forma de generar ingresos desde sus casa y su motivación se debió a que sus amigas también se dedican a esta misma actividad.  Ella ofrece a cómodas cuotas los artículos y productos que comercializa, así mismo dedica su tiempo libre en las horas de la tarde para ofrecer los productos y realizar sus cobros.  Gertrudis está muy feliz de estar vinculada a este estilo de trabajo, ella está muy motivada por las satisfactorias ganancias e incentivos por cumplimiento de pedidos.   Es por ello que está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará los articulos de unos pedidos que tiene pendiente por entregar a sus clientes como colonias, desodorantes, shampoo, cremas corporales, hidratantes faciales y demás artículos.  Gertrudis tiene como meta de prosperidad hacer crecer su negocio, para ello necesita vender más y tener más clientes. Ella es madre de dos hijos de 16 y 15 años a quines desea ofrecerles una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Gertrudis lives in a neighborhood of Barranquilla municipality. This woman, 39 years old, decided to sell catalog products two years ago. She found the means to generate income from her house and her motivation was due to her friends who also did this same work. She offers the items and products she sells at comfortable payments, and she also works in her free time during the afternoon hours to offer products and collect her payments.  Gertrudis is very happy to be involved in this type of work, she is very motivated by the satisfactory earnings and incentives for filling the orders. It is for this reason that she is applying for a Kiva loan, the first loan she has taken from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, with which she will purchase the items for some orders that she has waiting to be delivered to her customers such as colognes, deodorants, shampoo, body creams, facial moisturizers and other items. Gertrudis's prosperity goal is to grow her business. For this, she needs to sell more and have more customers. She is the mother of two children ages 16 and 15 to whom she wants to offer a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase items such as colognes, deodorants, shampoo, body creams, facial moisturizers, and other items.

loans.name: Carlos Alberto

texts.es: Carlos de 54 años de edad vive en casa propia con sus esposa, desde hace 13 años se dedica al cultivo de maíz, comercializa sus productos en las agencias de compra-venta de granos básicos, el esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes abonos, controles de plagas y mejorar el terreno que muestra en la fotografía para tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en: Carlos, who is 54 years old, lives in his own house with his wife. For 13 years he has worked in maize cultivation. He sells his products in agencies of purchase and sale of basic grains. He is asking for a loan to buy seeds, fertilizers, manure, pest control, and to improve the plot of land that he shows in the photograph, to have better income.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers, manure, pest control, and to improve his plot of land.

loans.name: Darwin Leonardo

texts.es: Leonardo es un joven de 22 años de edad, el es un padre muy responsable con su hija que tiene 2 años, la madre de su hija se dedica a  la crianza de animales menores y Leonardo se dedica a la jornal y a sembrar huertas de productos como papas, habas y demás productos propios de su provincia, el crédito lo va a utilizar para comprar chanchos ya que comenta que con este negocio se ayuda en sus ingresos y que su aspiración es formar un capital y cubrir todas las necesidades de su hija.
texts.en:
Leonardo is a young man, age 22, who is a very responsible father to his two-year-old daughter. His daughter's mother raises small animals, and Leonardo works for daily wages and grows garden vegetables such as potatoes, fava beans, and other produce that grows well in his province.  

He is going to use the loan to purchase pigs, because he says that this business will help his earnings.  His aspiration is to build up some savings and pay for all of his daughter’s needs.

loans.use: to purchase pigs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy energy-saving stoves

loans.name: Maha Group

texts.en:
Maha is the same group which applied for a first loan from Kiva Lenders. This group is consists of the same members without Lila who took out the first loan. They haven't yet fully repaid their first loan but have applied for a concurrent loan of 140,000 YER from Kiva lenders.

Zubydah is the leader of the group. She thanks Kiva lenders for their first loan, which helped her grow her business. In truth, she hasn't completely repaid the first loan but has applied for a concurrent loan of 60,000 YER from Kiva Lenders to purchase another amount of different ingredients to make traditional incense and resale. Zubydah hopes this loan will be funded, too.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients to make incense

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Wonderful Kiva lenders! Meet Lydia, a fifty-two-year-old mum who is so humble, honest and a very hardworking. Lydia is a mother who really adores her family and will always do anything good so that they never go to bed with hungry stomachs. Lydia hails from the Kerugoya area of Kenya. Lydia never got the opportunity to advance her education and get a white collar job but this did not kill her dream of wanting to succeed in life. Lydia started farming and has been doing farming for the past six years. Throughout those years, she has gathered so much experience and all the farming techniques are at her fingertips. Lydia practices mixed farming on her farm and through the profits, she has managed to take care of her family's needs and give her children a good education because she believes that education is the only “key to success”. 

Lydia is also very enterprising. She is seeking a loan of KES 30,000 to start horticulture farming on her farm. Because of favorable weather patterns, a good road network in her village, good soil and a ready market for horticulture products, Lydia wants to take advantage of that and reap more profits. 

Juhudi Kilimo is partnering with Kiva and Kiva lenders to help aspiring women like Lydia to make their farming dreams come to reality through training and loan financing. Lydia hopes that through the loan, she will improve her living conditions. Lydia’s dreams and projections are that by the end of the first year, she will not only be selling in the local market but will also be selling in international markets through exporting fruits and vegetables. Through this, she will be able to assure her children a secure future and uninterrupted learning because she will be able to pay tuition fees on time. Lydia is not a selfish woman and will also want to impact positively on society. That is why she will employ people to work for her on her horticulture farm, so that she can have an impact on society.

Her hope is that 2015 will bring her success and good sales in horticulture.

loans.use: To start horticulture farming

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase goats to raise and sell.

loans.name: Ada Luz

texts.es: ADA LUZ: Es una mujer indígena que pertenece a la etnia miskita, es originaria de Waspam, es alegre y emprendedora, tiene 34 años de edad, madre soltera de un hijo de 18 años de edad, que estudia su secundaria. Es una pequeña comerciante de ropa y calzado que tiene su tramo en el mercado municipal. Con las ganancias que le genera su negocio aporta económicamente en el hogar y contribuye para la educación de su hijo que estudia. Está solicitando su primer préstamo para incrementar su mercadería de ropa y calzado que comprará en Managua y Masaya; esto le permitirá vender a precios favorable a sus clientela en Waspam y asi incrementar sus ingresos. Sueña con llegar a tener un negocio grande y próspero.
texts.en:
Ada Luz is an indigenous woman who is of Miskita ethnicity. She is a native of Waspam and is cheerful and enterprising. She is a 34 year old single mother of an 18 year old son who is studying in Secondary school.

She is a small scale merchant of clothing and footwear who has a commercial space in the municipal market. She supports her household economically with the income that her business generates and contributes money so that her son can study.

She is requesting her first loan to increase her merchandise with clothing and footwear that she will buy in Managua and Masaya. This will allow her to sell at favorable prices to her clientele in Waspam and thus increase her income. She dreams of having a prosperous and large business.

loans.use: to increase her merchandise of clothing and footwear which she will buy in Managua and Masaya.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: bulbs, tubes, energy savers, switches, bulb holders and sockets

loans.name: Juana Irma

texts.es: Juana de 44 años de edad es madre soltera y habita en vivienda propia junto a su hijo y su hija ya mayores de edad que le apoyan con los gastos de su hogar. Ella se gana la vida elaborando prendas de vestir en una empresa cercana desde hace 5 años. Juana desea reparar el techo del corredor pero sobre todo tramitar la escritura de su vivienda, ya que poco a poco ha cancelado todas las cuotas para comprarla apoyada en su trabajo y sus hijos, para ello solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: lámina galvanizada, madera y clavos para cambiar el techo y tramitar la escritura su vivienda.
texts.en: Juana is 44 years old and a single mother. She lives in her own house with her son and daughter, both of whom are already of age and support her with household expenses. For the last 5 years, Juana has been making a living by sewing clothing for a neighboring business. She would like to repair the roof over the hallway but, above all, secure the deed to her house, which she has paid for little by little through her work and the support of her children. In order to do this, she is requesting a loan from FUSAI to purchase galvanized sheet metal, wood, and nails to replace her roof and to secure the deed to her house.

loans.use: to purchase galvanized sheet metal, wood, and nails to replace her roof and to secure the deed to her house.

loans.name: Ana Julia

texts.es: Ana tiene 43 años de edad y desde hace 5 años se gana la vida por medio de la venta de pescado salado. La venta la realiza en el mercado de su localidad, lugar donde ya cuenta con muchos clientes que cada día la prefieren más. Ana desea invertir en su negocio dado que desea aprovechar esta temporada que es cuando sus productos son más demandados. Por lo anterior solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de mayor cantidad de pescado salado que tanto demandan sus clientes. Espera poder mejorar sus ventas e ingresos y poder dar a su familia mejores condiciones.
texts.en: Ana is 43 years old and for the past 5 years has earned her living by selling salted fish. She makes her sales in the market in her locality, a place which has many customers who every day prefer her more. Ana wants to invest in her business since she wants to take advantage of this season which is when her products are most in demand. For this reason, she asks for a loan from FUSAI to invest in the purchase of a larger quantity of the salted fish that her customers demand so much. She hopes to be able to increase her sales and income and provide her family with better conditions.

loans.use: to purchase salted fish in bulk to sell.

loans.name: Las Violetas Y El Girasol Group

texts.es: “LAS VIOLETAS Y EL GIRASOL” es un grupo conformado por mujeres trabajadoras y responsables. Zoraida tiene 40 años de edad es casada con 02 hijos educando. Ella se dedica a la venta de ropas cosméticos a través de  catálogos.  De esta manera puede apoyar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar. El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de más cosméticos ropa para niños y adultos por campaña navideña. El grupo agradece a los inversionistas KIVA por el crédito brindado. Zoraida es la tercera del lado derecho.
texts.en: “LAS VIOLETAS Y EL GIRASOL” is a group made up of hard-working and responsible women. Zoraida is 40 years old, married, and raising 2 children. She works selling clothing and cosmetics from catalogs. In this way, she is able to help her husband with the household expenses. The loan will be invested in more cosmetics and clothing for children and adults for the Christmas season. The group is thankful to the Kiva investors for the offered loan. Zoraida is the third from the right.

loans.use: to purchase more cosmetics and clothing for children and adults.

loans.name: Wilmer Bayardo

texts.es: Bayardo es un joven soltero, trabaja en una finca donde cuida ganado y ordeña las vacas Bayardo viven con un hermano y los demás empleados de de la finca, el crédito lo necesita para compra terneros que los va a tener en los terrenos de propiedad de su patrón, Bayardo comenta que  esta trabajando y que sus cuotas las paga puntualmente y que aspira comprar mas terneros y asi reunír capital ya que esta pensando formar su hogar.
texts.en: Bayardo is a single young man. He works in a farm taking care of livestock and milking cows. Bayardo lives with a brother and the rest of the farm's employees. He is requesting a loan to purchase calves, which he will keep at his boss' property. Bayardo indicates that he is working, pays his bills on time, and aspires to purchase more calves to raise the money to make a home.

loans.use: to purchase calves.

loans.name: Artur

texts.en:
Artur lives in Kadjaran city in the Syunik region. Artur has a vocational education with a specialty in cooking, but he never worked in his specialty. Since 1999 he has worked at the Kadjaran combine as a driver.

Artur is married, and he has two beautiful daughters. His elder daughter is a student at a theatrical institute, and his smaller daughter is still school-aged. Artur’s wife works at the kindergarten.

Simultaneously with his work at the nearby village, Hamletavan, Artur established a cute farm where he is engaged in agricultural activities. His plot of land gives him a perfect harvest of potatoes, beans, onions and greens, and his colorful orchard is full of fruit trees, such as apple, pear, peach and nut trees. All the harvest he divides in two parts: one for his family's use and the other part for sale at the wholesale market, mainly through re-sellers.

Artur hopes to receive this loan because his vegetable and fruit garden’s piping is fully worn out and needs to be changed. He also wants to buy a water tank for storing water to irrigate his land.

loans.use: to buy new piping for his vegetable and fruit garden and a water tank for storing water.

loans.name: Edgar Sifredo

texts.es: Edgar de 42 años de edad vive en casa propia con sus cinco hijos, el se dedica al cultivo de caña de azúcar, yuca y granos básicos desde hace varios años, comercializa sus productos en los diferentes mercados que se encuentran cerca de su casa,el esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas y mejorar el terreno que muestra en a fotografía y así tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Edgar, 42, lives in his own house with his 5 children.  He has been growing sugar cane, yucca, and basic grains, for several years, selling his products in different markets that are located near his house.

He is requesting a loan for the purchase of fertilizer, compost, and pest control products, and for improving the land that is shown in the photograph.  In this way, he will improve his earnings.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, compost, and pest control products, and improve the land.

loans.name: María Teresa

texts.es: María, se destaca por la fortalece que dios le ha dado, de profesión maestra de educación primaria con 3 años de laborar, ya que para impartir sus clases tiene que viajar varios kilómetros de donde habita, es casada, con dos hijos a su cargo, esta señora se presento a Ceprodel para solicitar financiamiento y realizar el sueño de mejorar su vivienda, ya que el mismo lo utilizaría en la Compra de cemento, ladrillos, zinc, perlin, arena y mano de obra, con los que ampliaría el cuarto y darle mejores condiciones
texts.en:
Maria stands out because of the strength "God has given her." She works as an elementary school teacher, and has done so for 3 years. In order to teach her classes, she has to travel many kilometers from where she lives. She is married with two dependent children. 

She came to CEPRODEL to request a loan to realize her dream of improving her home. She will use the loan to pay for cement, bricks, tin roofing, purlin [roofing beams], sand and manual labor. With these, she will be able to expand a room, and provide better conditions.

loans.use: to pay for cement, bricks, tin roofing, purlin [roofing beams], sand and manual labor.

loans.name: Phem

texts.en: Phem is a thirty-six-year-old married factory worker with four children. She lives in the Takeo province in Cambodia. She has worked since 2012. Two of her children are also factory workers and one attends school. Her husband is forty-four years old. He cultivates rice and fattens animals. They can make approximately 19 USD a day. To improve her family finances, she would like to take a loan to buy more farmland for her husband to cultivate rice. In the future, she wants her daughter to run a tailoring shop at home.

loans.use: to buy more farmland to cultivate rice

loans.name: Hicran

texts.en:
Hicran is 45 year old and married with two kids. She lives with her husband and two children in a small house. Her family’s income is mainly from farming and husbandry. She was born into a family that worked the land, earning a living through honest work, and she inherited this business. Her husband also works in the field.

Hicran and her husband work side by side and have been through a lot together. Currently they are sowing onions. She already finished sowing and now needs to amend the soil with mineral fertilizer. She does not have enough money to purchase a sufficient amount of fertilizer, and she decided to apply for a loan with the hope of your support.

loans.use: to purchase a sufficient amount of fertilizer

loans.name: Adelante Cocachacra Group

texts.es: Nataly tiene 30 años de edad es soltera con tres  hijos educando. Ella implemento su bodega en su vivienda en el cual productos de primera necesidad frutas verduras. El crédito lo invirtió en la compra de panetones leche chocolates champagne por campaña navideña. Ser parte del grupo “LAS VIOLETAS Y EL GIRASOL” le a permitido obtener financiamiento para su bodega. El grupo agradece a los inversionistas KIVA por el crédito brindado. Nataly viste chompa naranja.
texts.en:
Nataly is 30 years old and single with 3 dependent children. She runs a general store out of her house in which she sells products like fruits and vegetables. 

This loan will be invested in the purchase of sweet bread, milk chocolate, and champagne for the holiday season. To be a part of the group "Las Violetas y el Girasol" ["The Violets and the Sunflower"] has allowed her to obtain funding for her store. 

The group thanks the Kiva investors for the loan they provide. Natalie is wearing the orange sweater.

loans.use: to purchase sweet bread, milk chocolate, and champagne.

loans.name: Jose Antonio

texts.es: Jose de 56 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa, el se dedica a la siembra de maíz y frijol desde hace varios años, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos del hogar, el esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizante, abonos, controles de plagas y mejorar el terreno que muestra la fotografía para continuar con sus siembras y tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en: Jose is 56 years old, he lives in his own home with his wife and makes a living planting corn and beans which he has done for the last few years. With the sale of his produce he achieves helping to pay for some of the household expenses.  He is requesting this loan to buy seeds, fertilizer, compost and products to control plagues and improve his land which is shown in the photograph.  He wishes to buy these things to be able to continue with his crops and improve his income.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer, compost and products to control plagues and improve his land

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy goods at low prices and resell them to the traders using his rickshaw.

loans.name: Bartolome

texts.es:
Bartolome, siente apoyo por parte de Padecomsm y Kiva, cuando solita créditos para su negocio, en esta oportunidad el capital que requiere será de utilidad para comprar piñones, grasa, aceite, llantas y otros repuestos varios para bicicletas, seguirá brindando un excelente servicio a sus clientes.
Con el financiamiento anterior tuvo oportunidad de mejorar la variedad de accesorios para bicicletas y el buen trato a sus clientes, su taller es más rentable, ha cancelado su deuda y su familia se encuentra gozando de buena salud.
texts.en: Bartolome has felt supported by PADECOMSM and Kiva when he has requested loans for his business. In this instance, he is requesting a loan that will help him to purchase gears, grease, oil, tires, and other spare parts for bicycles so that he may continue offering his clients excellent service. His previous loan helped him to improve the variety of bicycle spare parts and his good service towards his clients. His shop is now more profitable, he has paid his debt, and his family enjoys good health.

loans.use: to purchase gears, grease, oil, tires, and other spare parts for bicycles so that he may continue offering his clients excellent service.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy American clothing (used clothing).

loans.name: Dúo Fatima Group

texts.es:
Dúo Agua Viva
Ester es casada vive con su esposo, tuvo 7 hijos  de los cuales cinco viven y ya tiene su propia familia, ella inicio su negocio hace dos años ya que  tenia que buscar una manera de distraerse y no estar sola en casa entonces empezó vendiendo artículos por catalogo, luego compro ropa nueva y la revente en su comunidad, ella ahnela tener a su familia unida y con buena salud,en esta oportunidad ella esta solicitando este credito para la compra de ropa nueva para seguir con su negocio.
texts.en: The "Dúo Agua Viva" group. Ester is married and lives with her husband. They have 7 children, five of whom are still alive and have their own families. She started her business 2 years ago as she had to find a way to pass the time and not be alone in her house. So she started to sell things from catalogs and then she bought new clothing to re-sell in her community. She longs to keep her family united and in good health. At this time she is requesting a loan to buy new clothing to continue with her business.

loans.use: to buy new clothing to sell.

loans.name: Farzona

texts.en:
Farzona is a single girl. She is 20 years old. Farzona lives with her parents in the capital of Tajikistan. She is a very kind girl. 

Now, she is a student of the first course Medical College of Tajikistan. She studies full-time and she is a smart student. She has a dream to work in any hospital after graduating college. 

Farzona is asking for a loan of 450 USD to pay for tuition. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: To pay for tuition

loans.name: Khursandmo

texts.en:
Khursandmo was born in 1976. She lives with her parents in North Tajikistan. She is not married and does not have any children. 

Khursandmo has been busy with animal husbandry more than 10 years. She buys cattle, feeds for some months and sells in a local market. Khursandmo feeds cattle at her house where she has a cowshed. She is asking for a loan of 1,000 USD to buy cattle for increasing working capital. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: To buy cattle for increasing working capital

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: Agnes is a single mother and feeds her only child bravely.  She is a hard-working mother, engaged in farming for two years. She plants corn and peanuts.  She was happy to become a member of Paglaum MPC, because of the services and benefits offered to the members.  Agnes applied for a loan to pay for labor for harvesting the corn and for cultivation, as well as to buy peanut seedlings.  The profit she earns will be saved for emergencies and for the education of her child.

loans.use: to pay labor for cultivation and to buy seedlings

loans.name: Mely

texts.en: Mely, 53, is married to a farmer and blessed with three children. She has owned and managed a rice farming business in their village for almost 37 years and earns a net income (last harvest season) amounting to 40,000 PHP to purchase farm inputs such as fertilizers, seedlings, and insecticides. Due to insufficient capital, she would like to avail a loan amounting to 25,000 PHP to purchase farm inputs such as fertilizers, seedlings, and insecticides. She's hoping that her business will continue to grow and become more profitable.

loans.use: To purchase farm inputs such as fertilizers, seedlings, and insecticides.

loans.name: Merlita

texts.en: Merlita is 56, married, and blessed with four children. She has owned and managed a rice farming business in their village for almost 20 years and earned a net income last harvest season amounting to PHP 50,000. Her net income was spent on purchasing a hand tractor for her rice farm. Due to insufficient capital in this coming cropping season, she wanted to avail herself of a loan amounting to PHP 50,000 to purchase farm inputs such as fertilizers, seedlings and insecticides. She's hoping that her business will continue to grow profitably.

loans.use: To purchase farm inputs such as fertilizers, seedlings and insecticides.

loans.name: Nicholus's Group

texts.en:
Nicholus is a 72-year-old proud father of 10 children. He is a group leader, often described as a very hardworking individual, and is representing his group of 11 farmers in Kakamega South District. Since joining One Acre Fund in 2014, Nicholus has noticed that he has been able to consistently feed his family.

Nicholus described his harvest as very good last year, but believes he can have a better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. He is very excited to also be purchasing a solar light, apart from fertilizer and maize, because he will now be able to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money. With the profits from this season’s harvest, he plans to send his children to school.

With this loan, Nicholus’s Group will be able to plant a total of 7.25 acres of land and purchase a total of 5 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase cement and bricks to renovate the house

loans.name: Mary's Group

texts.en:
Mary, pictured above, has six children and is always described as a very friendly person, which is why she was selected to become the group leader of her group. Mary is representing her group of nine farmers in Matete District and is happy to be working with One Acre Fund for the first time this year.

Mary has been a farmer for fifteen years and, in order to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods, she decided to join the One Acre Fund program this season. Her loan will not only include farming inputs but also a solar light, which she is very happy to be getting as that means she will now reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money. With the profits from this coming season, Mary is planning to send her children to school.

A total of 3.75 acres will be planted by Mary's Group, and between them they will receive a total of seven solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, as well as a solar light.

loans.name: Elizabeth's Group

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a 60-year-old proud mother of 6 children. She is a group leader, often described as a very friendly person, and is representing her group of 14 farmers in Kakamega South District. Since joining One Acre Fund in 2013, Elizabeth has noticed that she has had more profits from each harvest.

Elizabeth described her harvest as excellent last year, but believes she can have a better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. She is very excited to also be purchasing a solar light, apart from fertilizer and maize, because she will now be able to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money. With the profits from this season’s harvest, she plans to send her children to school.

With this loan, Elizabeth’s Group will be able to plant a total of 6.75 acres of land and purchase a total of 6 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy additional poultry

loans.name: Placidah

texts.en:
The lady in the photo is Placidah, who is twenty eight years old, married, and a mother of three. Two of the children are in school. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in the year 2013.

She owns a shop as her main business. She has benefited much from Hand in Hand Eastern Africa's training on enterprise and financial management which has helped her in budgeting and record keeping. 

She is borrowing from Kiva to add more stock of household items such as sugar, salt, flour, and washing detergents in her shop, hence increasing her income. This will assist her in catering to basic family needs and the education of her children. 

She is grateful to Kiva and their lenders and promises to pay promptly.

loans.use: To buy stock of household items such as sugar, salt, flour, and washing detergents.

loans.name: Mwamko Mpya Community Group

texts.en:
The person raising her hand in the photograph is Elizabeth, a member of Mwamko Mpya Community Group. She is 66 years old and a mother of two children. She has been doing dairy and vegetable farming for the past three years.
 
Elizabeth joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in the year 2013, where she acquired skills and knowledge in business management which greatly assisted in increasing her farming income. 

Elizabeth plans to use the loan amount borrowed to purchase farm inputs, such as fertilizer and planting seeds, and also to start a poultry business. The anticipated income will assist in supporting her children's education. 
 
Elizabeth is grateful to Kiva and their lenders for the support and help.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs, such as fertilizer and planting seeds, and also to buy poultry.

loans.name: Adela

texts.es: ADELA: Es una señora originaria de Waspam; tiene 35 años de edad, casada con 4 hijos adolescentes que están estudiando su secundaria. Con gran esfuerzo y apoyo de su esposo poco a poco ha construido su vivienda de concreto, con el propósito de brindarle a su familia una vivienda digna y segura, pero que todavía necesita completar. Es por eso que solicitan un préstamo para terminar de construir su vivienda. Con el préstamo va comprar puertas, ventanas, cemento, hierro, arena, bloques y pagar la mano de obra. Ella y su marido sueñan con tener una casa bonita de cemento, con mejores condiciones y ambiente para toda su familia
texts.en: ADELA is a native of Waspam. She is 35 years old, married with 4 adolescent children who study in Secondary school. With great effort and the help of her husband she little by little has constructed her house made of concrete with the aim of providing her family with a safe and dignified house, which she still needs to complete. So she is requesting a loan to complete the construction of her house. She will buy doors, windows, cement, re-bar, sand, cider blocks and pay for labor with the loan. She and her husband dream of having a beautiful cement house with better living conditions and atmosphere for the whole family.

loans.use: to buy doors, windows, cement, re-bar, sand, cider blocks and to pay for labor.

loans.name: Evalyne

texts.en:
Evalyne is a  twenty-nine-year-old married woman with four children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in 2013.

She owns a vegetable kiosk and a small shop. She has benefited  from Hand in Hand Eastern Africa training on enterprise and financial management which has enabled her manage her business. She is borrowing from Kiva to expand her business by adding more stock of vegetables such as kale and spinach so that she can sell more and increase her income. This will assist her in meeting family's  needs for food, health care,  and education.
 
Evalyne is grateful to Kiva and their lenders and promises to pay promptly

loans.use: to buy kale and spinach to help improve  sales.

loans.name: Rafia's Group

texts.en: Rafia is 30 years old. She is a responsible mother of two sons and one daughter. She is a housewife and looks after her family, which is comprised of five persons. She is well-trained in cloth stitching. She provides stitching services to the people, at her own house. She needs to purchase a sewing machine and a variety of stitching materials for her work, including thread, needles, and cloth. This is very important for her to continue her work efficiently and professionally. However, due to the lack of money, she finds it difficult. So Rafia is requesting a loan from Kiva partner BRAC Pakistan. BRAC Pakistan issued her a loan, as she requested. Rafia is very thankful to Kiva's partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine and stitching material for her stitching work

loans.name: Maria De La Paz

texts.es:
María, de 71 años de edad, no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar, ya que la escuela le quedaba muy lejos de su casa y el nivel de pobreza era bastante alta.- María, está acompañada desde hace más de 50 años y con ellos solamente vive un hijo.

María, es dueña de vacas, los animales no son para comercio, solamente para el sustento de la familia. 

María, compra los animales, porque los vé como una fuente de ingreso.

Ella necesita el dinero para comprar un toro, ya que lo necesitan para que sus animales se reproduzcan. 

Ella tuvo 10 hijos, pero solamente uno vive en casa, los demás viven separados de ella y su sueño es  volver a tenerlos juntos.
texts.en:
María, 71, didn't have the opportunity to get an education because the school was very far from her house and her poverty level was very high.  She has lived with someone for more than 50 years.  She had 10 children, but only one lives at home.  The others live on their own, and her dream is to have them all together again.

María raises cows, not to sell but to support the family.  She buys the animals because she sees them as a source of income.

She needs the money to buy a bull so her animals will reproduce.

loans.use: to buy a bull

loans.name: Ma'rifati

texts.ru:
Маърифати проживает в городке под названием Куляб в Хатлонской области. Маърифати молодая мама одиночка. Она развелась с мужем и с двумя младенцами на руках. Старшей дочке 2 года, младшей 7 месяцев. Справляться с маленькими детьми Маърифату тяжело она старается. Она не считает себя матерью одиночкой, ведь у нее есть двое прекрасных детей. 
  Маърифати обеспечивает детей, предоставляя услуги портнихи у себя дома. Она принимает заказы на шитье женской одежды. Она шьет одно платье за 35 TJS. Маърифати просит кредит, чтобы отремонтировать дом и купить машинку оверлок. Пришли холода и чтобы уберечь своих дочек от мороза ей нужно отремонтировать дом и поставить стены вокруг дома. Так же ей необходимо купить машинку оверлок для обработки швов на одежде. Из-за нехватки денежных средств она обратилась за кредитом.
texts.en:
Ma'rifati lives in a small town by the name of Kulob in the Khatlon province. Ma'rifati is a young, single mother. She is divorced from her husband and has two small children to take care of. Her eldest daughter is 2 years old, her youngest is 7 months old. It is difficult for Ma'rifati to manage with two small children. She does not consider herself a single mother given that has two wonderful children.

Ma'rifati provides for her children by offering seamstress services out of her home. She takes orders for sewing women's clothing. She sews one dress for 35 Tajikistani Somoni (TJS). Ma'rifati is requesting a loan to repair her home and buy an overlock sewing machine. The cold has arrived and in order to protect her children from the freezing temperatures, she needs to repair her house and put walls up around her house. She also needs to buy an overlock sewing machine to create seams in her clothing. Because she does not have enough savings, she requested a loan.

loans.use: to repair her house and buy an overlock sewing machine.

loans.name: Andranik

texts.en:
Andranik is 42 years old and lives with his wife (who works as a saleswoman), son, and daughter in Kapan city of the Syunik region. Adranik has a specialty in house painting. He finished technical college for construction technology in Kapan city. After his college graduation, he worked in his field, renovating apartments, houses, and offices, and working as a handyman. He hurries to thank for his first Kiva loan, which he requested in order to buy a rock drill and grinding machine that greatly helped him in his occupation.

Near his house, Andranik has a plot of land on which he is now also engaged in agricultural activities. On his plot of land he cultivates potato, cabbage, radish, garlic and onion. Andranik says that since he already has experience with a Kiva partnership, and he knows that Nor Horizon’s main goal and mission is to support farmers and peasant families through the help of Kiva and its kind lenders, this time his aim is to develop his agriculture with the help of a Kiva loan.

This loan he wants to use for the purchase of potatoes, onion seedlings, and fertilizer for his land. He will also buy fences for his large vegetable garden to make it cute and safe.

loans.use: to buy potatoes, onion seedlings, fertilizer for his land, and fences for his large vegetable garden to make it cute and safe.

loans.name: Dedy

texts.en:
Dedy is 66 years old and married with four children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Dedy runs a general store in the Philippines and she has been in this business for 10 years. Dedy requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

In the future Dedy would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Zarik

texts.en:
Zarik lives in Vanadzor city of the Lori region. She has a higher education, and she is a pedagogue with 35 years of work experience in this field. For many years, she worked as a teacher of mathematics at the school; now, she is a deputy director at the same school who is greatly respected and beloved in the school where she has worked for many years. 

She also gives paid private courses of mathematics, preparing pupils for entrance examinations. As she says, a pedagogue must have unlimited patience and great love toward the children, otherwise she cannot work with them.  

Zarik lives with her son, who works with the police.

Zarik asks for a loan of 600,000 Armenian drams in order to buy a computer and several methodological books that contain innovations, as she wants to get aware of all that.

loans.use: to buy a computer and several methodological books

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es:
María, ejerce en su hogar el papel de madre y abuela, vive con sus hijos y sus nietos, como una manera de tener ingresos para suplir las necesidades de su familia se dedica a vender tortillas, en un horario de 9:00 a.m. a 2:00 p.m., esta actividad la aprendió dentro de su familia.
Utilizará el préstamo para comprar leña, cal, maíz y gas propano, son la materia prima para la elaboración de la venta de tortillas, así podrá aumentar la productividad, ventas y ganancias. Los riesgos son una mala administración del capital y la competencia que rodea su negocio.
Aspira a tener más clientes satisfechos, mejores ingresos y mantenerse trabajando.
texts.en:
María is both mother and grandmother in her household.  She lives with her children and her grandchildren.  She sells tortillas from 9 a.m. until 2 p.m. as a way to earn an income for her family's necessities.  She learned this job in her family.

She's going to use the loan to buy firewood, lime powder, corn, and propane gas: the raw materials she needs to make and sell tortillas.  That way she'll be able to increase productivity, sales, and profits.  The risks are poor administration of capital and the competition around her business.

María want to have more satisfied customers, earn a better income, and keep working.

loans.use: to buy firewood, lime powder, corn, and propane gas: the raw materials for making and selling tortillas

loans.name: Hector Antonio

texts.es:
Héctor, de 43 años de edad, estudió hasta octavo grado, no continuo estudiando porque decidió trabajar para ayudar a la economía de su familia, actualmente está casado y tiene un hijo, el ya no vive junto a ellos porque decidió viajar al extranjero.

Héctor, trabaja desde que estaba muy pequeño en la agricultura, ésta actividad fue enseñada por su padre, quien también es agricultor.- Actualmente, tiene dos hectáreas de cultivo de maíz y frijol, dichas tierras están a una distancia de tres kilómetros desde su residencia, también cabe mencionar que se dedica a la compra de ganado para engordarlo y luego venderlo.

El préstamo, será invertido para comprar una novilla, ya que tiene dos más y necesita hacer una buena inversión, para luego venderlas y con la ganancia, construir una vivienda de ladrillo.

El sueño que tiene Héctor es, llegar a tener una vivienda digna en donde puedan vivir de forma más segura junto a su esposa.
texts.en:
Hector, 43 years old, completed eight grade and then dropped out of school so that he could work to help the family's economy. He's now married, with a son who's no longer at home because he decided to go abroad.

Hector has worked in agriculture since very young, he learned from his father who's also a farmer. He currently has two hectares of corn and bean crops, these fields are located three kilometers away from his home. 

He also earns a living buying livestock that he fattens and then sells.

The loan is to buy a heifer, he already has two and he needs to make a good investment now. He will later sell them, and with the profit he plans to build a brick house.

Hector's dream is to own a decent home where he and his wife can live in greater safety.

loans.use: to buy a heifer.

loans.name: Galulolo

texts.en:
Galulolo is a 34 year old mother of 6 children. She runs a business selling taro and bananas in her village. She has been doing this for more than 5 years to earn a living.

Galulolo has requested a loan to buy taro roots, banana tubers, a wheelbarrow, rake, shovel, water tank and gloves to assist the business . She will expand her business in the future using her profits. She became a member of SPBD 2009.

loans.use: to buy taro roots, banana tubers, a wheelbarrow, rake, shovel, water tank and gloves.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a new machine for washing carpets.

loans.name: Yousef

texts.en:
Yousef is a 22-year-old single man from Khan Younis. 

Two years ago, he opened an electrical products store to sell lamps and wires to local clients. It is a good business that provides a good income. Yousef would like to expand his store in the future.

Yousef took a USD loan from FATEN to buy more electrical products to resell. Yousef will be able to increase his sales and income.

loans.use: to buy more electrical products.

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha does farming. She grows and sell rice. She is a 40-year-old married woman with eight children from Dulag, Leyte. She has been engaged in a bakery for five years now. Aside from that, she engages in a duck-raising business. These are her sources of income.

Editha is asking for a loan to buy fertilizers, rice seedlings and medicine. These are very important tools in toiling on her farm. She will grow more rice abundantly, and hopefully, she could gain more yield.

Her livelihood activity will be back to normal, and this will put her daily living at ease.


 Editha dreams to expand her both  business to make it productive and profitable and continue sending her children to school.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, rice seedlings and medicine

loans.name: Kukush

texts.en:
Kukush lives in Marmarashen village with her husband, son and daughter-in-law. Her elder son is a migrant worker in a neighboring country. Other family members help Kukush with running their farm. It includes livestock and land where potatoes, cabbages, wheat, and carrots are cultivated.
 
The family always has high quality products and sells them in a local market.

To be able to purchase potato seeds and fertilizer for land cultivation, Kukush has applied for this loan. This is Kukush’s first loan, and it has been approved within the framework of the joint initiative by Kiva and SEF. This first-chance loan program provides loans to people who have not had access to credit products because they have no credit history.

loans.use: to purchase potato seeds and fertilizer for land cultivation to enlarge her farming business

loans.name: Lucila

texts.en:
Lucila engages in a rice retail business. She sells rice to the people in her place. Aside from that, she also raises and sells hogs. She grows and sells hogs to have a supplemental income. She has been engaged in this kind of business since a year ago. She is a married woman with six grown children from Dulag, Leyte.

Due to financial a problem, Lucila is asking for a loan to buy an additional pig and several sacks of rice.

With these materials, her hog raising business will improve. She will now cater to more customers and sell more volume of rice. Slowly, her daily income will be augmented, and she will now be able to afford a healthy diet. These are essentials in her day-to-day living.

Lucila dreams of managing both her businesses to become more sustainable in the coming future.

loans.use: to buy an additional pig and several sacks of rice.

loans.name: Daina

texts.en:
Daina raises and sells hogs to earn a living.  She is a married woman with six children from Mayorga, Leyte. Her oldest child is 17, and the youngest is 5. To augment her income, she also caters massage therapy to the locals in her community. She has been engaged in this kind of business for two years already.
 
She has requested a loan in the amount of 15,000 PHP to purchase 10 piglets and materials for a pig pen renovation.  With these tools, she could now start to raise more healthy hogs. She could earn more and improve her sales. Thus providing her family with nutritious diets and better living conditions.


Daina dreams to expand her  business to make it productive, and to continue to support the education of her children for a brighter future.

loans.use: to purchase 10 piglets and materials for a pig pen renovation

loans.name: Ilqar

texts.en: Ilqar is a 21-year-old engineering student who lives in Agdas region. His father is a taxi driver, and his mother is a housekeepe. Since he is lacking finances, Ilqar would like to request a loan to pay his tuition fees for one year. This loan will help him graduate successfully and provide him with a skill to build his future. For his future job, he hopes to work in a company with a decent salary to improve his living.

loans.use: to pay his tuition fees for one year

loans.name: Santos Isabel

texts.es:
Santos de 48 años de edad, está acompañado y tiene dos hijos, es conocido es la comunidad por ser cumplidor y respetuoso, su compañera de vida es ama de casa pero también le apoya en los oficios agropecuarios, sus hijos también se involucra en las tareas que este realiza, solo su pareja y sus hijos viven con él.

Santos es agricultor y criador de ganado su padre desde muy pequeño lo encamino a que aprendiera estas dos actividades que se complementan una a la otra, fue entonces que le gusto manejar ganado y es su principal actividad y fuente de ingresos hasta el día de hoy. Solicita el préstamo para comprar un  toro que necesita para cargar las vacas que tiene en estos momentos y planificar la siguiente generación de ganado. Espera mejorar su hato ganadero con la comprar del toro para ver beneficiada su familia.
texts.en:
Santos, 48, is in a relationship and has two children.  He's known in his community for being trustworthy and respectful.  His life partner is a homemaker but she also helps with the farming tasks.  His children are involved in this work, too.  Only his partner and his children live with him.

Santiago's a farmer and he raises livestock.  His father guided him towards learning those two mutually complementary jobs.  Later he enjoyed working with livestock, which has been his main job and source of income ever since.

Santiago's requesting the loan to buy a bull he needs for breeding with his current cows and to plan the next generation of livestock.

He hopes to improve his livestock herd and benefit his family with the purchase of the bull.

loans.use: to buy a bull

loans.name: Nery

texts.es:
Nery, de 49 años de edad, estudió hasta noveno grado, está acompañada y su pareja es agricultor.- Nery, creció con sus padres, quienes le enseñaron las actividades de agricultura y ganadería.
 
Nery, se levanta a las 5:00 a.m. Junto a su esposo, para realizar sus actividades diarias, ella se dedica a trabajar en la agricultura, oficio que desempeña desde hace varios años junto a su esposo.- Durante la mañana, trabajan en las parcelas que siembran y en el transcurso de la tarde, se dedican a ordeñar las vacas, para vender la leche a sus vecinos. 

Nery, necesita el préstamo para comprar una vaca lechera, para poder producir más leche para venderla e incrementar sus ingresos.

Nery, desea comprar más vacas para incrementar su producción de leche y asegurar el bienestar de su familia.
texts.en:
Nery is 49 and has a ninth grade education. She is married, and her husband is a farmer. Nery grew up with her parents, who taught her the activities of farming and cattle raising.

Nery wakes up at 5:00 a.m. with her husband to perform the daily chores. She earns a living by working on the farm, a job that she has had for many years with her husband. In the morning they work on the plots they planted and by the afternoon they work on milking the cows to sell the milk to their neighbors.

Nery is requesting a loan to buy a dairy cow to produce more milk to sell, and increase her income. She wants to buy more cows to increase the milk production and ensure the well-being of her family.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow to produce more milk to sell, and increase her income.

loans.name: Moses

texts.en:
Moses is a 30-year-old man who is married to Regina.  She adds additional income to support their family and are blessed with two children.  Moses has been a farmer for three years and earns 8,000 at the end of every month.

Moses was introduced to VisionFund Kenya by a Credit Officer and requests his first loan of 30,000 KES  to buy cows and goats to sell to his customers.

Moses plans to use the anticipated income to pay his children's school fees  and hopes to become a successful business man with a bright future.

loans.use: to buy additional cows and goats.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is 57 years old. She is married and together with her spouse they support 10 individuals. Her spouse earns additional income, hence supporting the family.

Ruth runs a retail shop as well as a money transfer business commonly referred to as "M-pesa," which she has done for the last 14 years, earning a monthly income of KHS 30,000.

Ruth has requested her 1st loan with VisionFund Kenya of KHS 15,000, which she will use to add to her M-pesa float (credit). With the anticipated profits, Ruth will be able to increase stock for her retail shop.

Her hopes and dreams for the future are to have a family that is provided for.

loans.use: to add to her M-pesa float

loans.name: Gayane

texts.en:
Gayane, her two sons and husband live in Goris town of the Syuniq region. 

Gayane works at a local kindergarten as a teacher assistant, and together with her work, manages to run a farm. 

Gayane’s elder son is an army officer, and her husband and littlest son are eligible for the disability pension. This hardworking woman does her best to take care of her family members and run her farm successfully. 

To be able to purchase one more cow and 400 packages of forage for feeding the livestock, Gayane has applied for this loan. The loan will greatly assist Gayane’s farming business, and she will be able to improve her financial situation and give her family a better life.

loans.use: to purchase one more cow and 400 packages of forage for feeding the livestock

loans.name: Armine

texts.en:
Armine has been selling food and candy products for two years already. She rents a small store in one of the busy parts of the city, and her clients' demands are growing each day. 

She is willing to increase the assortment of goods in her shop, so has applied for this loan. This will give her an opportunity to purchase food supplies and develop her retail business further. 

Armine lives with her elderly retired father and mother, and is the main breadwinner of the family.

loans.use: to purchase food supplies and develop her retail business further

loans.name: Haykush

texts.en:
Haykush is experienced farmer from Tasik village, Syuniq region.  It has been seven years that Haykush has been involved in agribusiness. 
She keeps livestock of cows, calves, sheep, piglets and hens as well as cultivates wheat, emmer wheat, potatoes, and grass. Haykush lives with her husband and two school-aged children. 

To sustain her livestock during the winter season, Haykush needs to purchase forage. That’s the reason she has applied for this loan.
 
Haykush relies on lenders’ support, ensuring responsible payments of the loan.

loans.use: to purchase forage for feeding the livestock

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Hello lenders! Meet Irene, 32 years of age, and a very hard-working and self-driven farmer who is based in Muthea, a remote village in Kerugoya. This region has harsh weather patterns and poultry farming is the only profitable business venture that thrives. 

Irene is happily married and blessed with three children. For the past five years, she has been involved in mixed farming and her primary source of income has been selling milk and crop farming. 

Irene passionately loves poultry farming. When asked what is most enjoyable about farming, her reply was, “selling eggs.” Her biggest challenge is the lack of funds to increase her poultry farming. 

She is seeking a loan to buy additional poultry. Poultry farming is the only business that thrives in the Kerugoya area because of the harsh weather patterns, so she wants to take full advantage of the poultry business. 

Irene is a member of Gatei Self-help Group and, through the group, she has received training in financial management and saving money. Through the loan, she will sell eggs to the local market and to her neighbors, hence improving her living conditions and getting out of the poverty situation she is currently in. Profits from the loan will be used to repay the loan and increase her business.

Please support Irene with this loan and help improve her business.

loans.use: to buy additional poultry.

loans.name: Jemma

texts.en:
Jemma is an experienced farmer from Tsaghkavan village. 

Together with her husband, Jemma runs a farm. It includes piglets, hens, and she also cultivates wheat and corn. Near the house where they live, Jemma also owns an orchard where different fruit trees are grown (cherry, plum, quinces, nut, apple and pear trees). 

Jemma’s husband helps her to sell gathered harvest in local markets. To purchase two calves and forage for the livestock, Jemma applied for this loan.

loans.use: To purchase two calves and forage for the livestock

loans.name: Allah Rakhi

texts.en:
Allah Rakhi is  39 years old and lives in Lahore, with her husband and five children. Her husband has run a barber shop for many years and needs new equipment. He wants to buy new revolving chairs and plastic furniture for his shop but his finances do not allow him to buy items. Due to his low purchasing power, Allah Rakhi requested a loan so that her husband can  buy equipment for his salon. 

Allah Rakhi hopes that this loan will work and she would be able to some save money for household expenses. Allah Rakhi thanks Kiva and field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy revolving chairs and plastic furniture for her husband's barber shop.

loans.name: Farogat

texts.en:
Farogat is a maarried woamn with 2 sons and was born in 1973. She is a very kind and industrious woman. 

She started an animal husbandry  business 3 months ago and manages with her new business. Farogat’s husband is a migrant worker in Russia and Farogat is the provider for her family. 

She plans to increase her new business and maximize profit. She requests 5,000 TJS to buy cattle. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to buy cattle.

loans.name: Grishon

texts.en:
Grishon is fifty four years old and has three children, all attend school.

Grishon grows maize, beans and potatoes and is a photographer, also . The training he received from hand in hand on enterprise management enables him  to manage his business well. 

He requests a loan to purchase seed and fertilizer. He looks forward to a good harvest providing more income which he will use to meet the family's needs.

Grishon is very grateful and promises to promptly repay the loan.

loans.use: to buy seed and fertilizer..

loans.name: Cheson Women Group

texts.en:
The person raising her hand in the photograph is Angeline. She is married and blessed with seven children. She grows maize and potatoes. Training by Hand in Hand Eastern Africa on enterprise development and financial management has enabled her to manage her business well.  She needs a loan to increase her  maize and potatoes business by buying seed and pesticides. 

She hopes that the income will increase and improve her living standards, pay school fees for her children,  and purchase  good clothing and food.

She is very grateful to Kiva and their lenders for the help and support.

loans.use: to buy farm seeds and pesticides.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is a  married woman with nine children. She grows maize and potatoes. She received training from Hand in Hand Eastern Africa on enterprise development and financial management.  This has enabled her to manage her business.

She needs a loan to buy  hybrid seeds and fertilizer and hopes that the income  from her business will increase.  She plans  to improve her living standards,  paying school fees for her children, and afford good clothing and food.

She is very grateful to Kiva and their lenders for the help and support.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seed to improve productivity.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase paint to renovate her house from the inside because it was burnt a long time ago.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase a new TV for the house.

loans.name: Ilaha

texts.en:
Ilaha  is married, and lives in the Füzuli region with her family. They have been IDP (internally displaced persons) from Füzuli city for 22 years. Ilaha is a caring mother. Her son is 11 years old and the daughter is 9 years old. She has a few cows. She prepares dairy products (milk, cheese, yogurt, etc) and sells in a local bazaar to earn money. 

Today she needs 2,100 AZN to repair the cow's stall so there won't be a danger of it falling. 

Ilaha is thankful for Komak and Kiva for helping. She wants to buy a few cows and to increase her business in the future, so her monthly income will increase and she can help her son and daughter to have a good education in the future.

loans.use: to repair the stall

loans.name: Fatma

texts.en: Fatma is a 38-year-old married woman. Since 2010, she has been engaged in farm work -- raising livestock and growing produce. In addition, she takes in orders for sewing jobs. Fatma’s husband and children help her on the farm. At present, Fatma has two cows and five sheep. She also has a large orchard, where she grows peaches, cherries and apples. Her environmentally clean fruits are in great demand. She has applied to the Aqroinvest CU for a loan in the amount of 1,500 AZN to buy seeds and fertilizers to cultivate her soil, and obtain a good harvest next year. In addition, Fatma plans to buy a cow. She plans to use the resulting revenues to buy a new sewing machine. She is also saving up for her children’s education.

loans.use: to buy a cow.

loans.name: Anonymous
