texts.es: la joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por vivir en una zona de alto riesgo, se dedica a la confección de ropa desde hace 8 años, su negocio lo tiene ubicado en su lugar de residencia, tiene muchos clientes por su buen trabajo, la joven vive en casa propia con su esposo, ella esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de hilos, agujas, variedad de telas, elásticos, etc. todo por mayor para poder continuar con su trabajo y asi tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en: This young lady, who has her face blurred in the photo as she lives in a high risk zone, has made a living making clothes for the last 8 years.  Her business is located in the place of her residence.  She has a lot of clients as she does such good work. This young lady lives in her own home with her husband.  She is requesting this loan to buy thread, needles, varied fabrics, elastics, etc. in bulk to be able to continue with her work and that way better her income.

loans.use: to buy thread, needles, varied fabrics, elastics, etc. in bulk

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal LIDERANDO LAS PALMERAS, la socia sigue  con su negocio de venta de productos de maíz y de chuño, la socia se  compromete a cumplir con los pagos de sus cuotas con mucha responsabilidad, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, la socia desea que su negocio crezca, siendo de esta  manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el préstamo para la compra de maíz entre otros.
texts.en:
The member belongs to Liderando Las Palmeras Communal Bank.  She's a responsible and diligent person, and she promises to make her payments responsibly.

She still sells corn and chuño.  She wants her business to grow because it's the way she gets her family ahead.

The member's requesting the loan to buy corn and other products.

loans.use: to buy corn and other products

loans.name: Hilda

texts.es:
La socia Hilda pertenece al banco comunal LOS DIAMANTES, la socia sigue  dedicándose al negocio de comercialización de elementos de artesanía variada, la  socia se siente agradecida por el crédito y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas, la socia vende su mercadería a sus clientes que le solicitan como amistades, familiares, clientes entre otros, la socia desea que su negocio  cresca, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar chompas entre otros.
texts.en:
Hilda belongs to the communal bank Los Diamantes. She continues to earn a living in the business of selling various arts and crafts. She is very grateful for the loan, and promises to make the scheduled repayments. 

Hilda sells her merchandise to her customers that request them from her, such as friends, family, clients and others. She wants her business to grow, since in this way she can move her family forward. She is requesting a loan to buy sweaters and other items.

loans.use: to buy sweaters and other items.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es:
La socia Carmen  pertenece al banco comunal LOS DIAMANTES ,la socia continua dedicándose al negocio de  venta de productos de primera necesidad en su tienda de abarrotes, la socia se siente agradecida con el apoyo brindado y por el crédito otorgado  y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de las cuotas establecidas, la socia  vende sus productos a  sus  clientes que le solicitan cada día, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia Carmen solicita el préstamo para comprar aceite, arroz  entre otros.
texts.en:
Carmen is a member of Los Diamantes Communal Bank.  She still works in her business selling staple products in her grocery store.  She sells her products to her customers who order from her every day.  This is how she gets her family ahead.

Carmen's requesting the loan to buy oil, rice, and other products.

She's grateful for this support and the loan, and she promises to make her payments punctually.

loans.use: to buy oil, rice, and other products

loans.name: Vahram

texts.en:
Vahram, his two daughters and wife live in Vanadzor town, Lori region. To sustain his family’s living, Vahram runs a taxi using his own car. His elder daughter Eline is a student at university who specializes in the management department.

Vahram has applied for this loan to ask lenders to support him to cover Eline’s university tuition.

The loan will be a big support to this family, and Vahram hopes for lenders’ support.

loans.use: to pay for his daughter Eline's university tuition.

loans.name: Hasmik

texts.en:
This young woman in the photo is Hasmik, a farmer from Brnakot village of Syuniq region. She lives with her husband and two little kids.

Hasmik, together with her husband, runs their family farm. They keep livestock of cows, calves, sheep, and hens and also cultivate emmer wheat and potatoes. Hasmik’s husband sells the gathered harvest locally and earns income, which is very important for the family’s living.

To be able to purchase five more calves and forage for the livestock, Hasmik asks for this loan. She hopes to enlarge their farming business and plans to use the resulting revenue for further expansion of the farm.

loans.use: to purchase five more calves and forage for the livestock.

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
Josefina is a married woman with four children living in the town of Dulag, Leyte. She is a 47-year-old woman. Out of the four children, two are still attending school. She engages in a rice-farming business. She grows and sells hogs. To augment her income, she operates a motorcycle transport service. She has been engaged in this kind of business for eight years already.
 
She is asking for a loan to pay for the repair of the motorcycle and purchase farm supplies like fertilizers. These are very essential in the operation of her transportation service and to improve the yield of her farm. She will start to earn higher income and pay her obligations.

Josefina hopes that she will be productive in managing her livelihood to be freed from poverty and to be more sustainable in the future.

loans.use: to pay for the repair of the motorcycle and purchase farm supplies like fertilizers.

loans.name: Armine

texts.en:
Armine is involved in beekeeping. She currently owns 22 colonies of bees, from which she gets high quality and tasty honey. The honey is highly demanded among local people in the region.
 
To be able to purchase 14 more colonies of bees, Armine asks for this loan. Armine lives with her husband and 17-year-old son, who help her with running the beekeeping business. 

This is Armine’s first loan and it has been approved within the framework of the joint initiative by Kiva and SEF. This first-chance loan program provides loans to people who have not had access to credit products because they have no credit history.

loans.use: to purchase 14 more colonies of bees to enlarge honey production.

loans.name: Sreytho

texts.en:
Sreytho is a 19-year-old widowed factory worker with a child. She lives with her mother, who is a rice farmer, in Takeo province in Cambodia. Together, they can make $10 each day. 

Due to the fact that her present house is old, Sreytho has decided to apply for a loan to buy lumber to renovate her house. This loan will help her have a proper house to live in. 

To improve her family finances, she is going to save money to buy piglets for her mother to fatten.

loans.use: to buy lumber to renovate her house

loans.name: Emma

texts.en: Emma is 58 years old and lives in Sto. Niño, Pagadian City, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. She is married with five adult age children. Emma sells her own homemade "banana cue" at her place. She has had this business for one year. She has been a member of PMPC for one year. She requested a loan to buy kilos of bananas, oil, and sugar to make "banana cue" for sale. In the future, Emma wants to make food from a new recipe to sell.

loans.use: to buy kilos of bananas, oil and sugar in order to make "banana cue" for sale.

location.town: Pagadian-Sto. Nino, Pagadian City, Zamboanga Del S

loans.name: Renacer Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se formo en la ciudad de Caacupé, cada una de ellas está poniendo su mejor esfuerzo para poder crecer y mejorar en lo que cada una hace. Ellas son mujeres jefas de familia que decidieron apoyarse las unas a las otras por medio de su trabajo en conjunto.
Nidia es parte de este grupo, ella se dedica a la venta de comidas varias, que ella misma hace y que después sale a vender. Es una mujer muy trabajadora que todos los días empieza a trabajar desde muy temprano.
Ella pide este préstamo ya que quiere comprar insumos varios para sus comidas, como ser verduras, carne, condimentos, pollo, jamón y demás, de manera a seguir deleitando a sus clientes con lo que prepara.
texts.en:
This group was formed in the city of Caacupé.  Each one of the women is putting forth her best effort to be able to grow and to improve what she does.  They're heads of family who decided to mutually support each other by working together.

Nidia is part of this group.  She earns a living selling various dishes that she herself makes and goes out to sell.  She's a very hardworking woman who starts working very early every day.

Nidia's requesting this loan because she wants to buy vegetables, meat, condiments, chicken, ham, and other ingredients for her dishes.  That way she can continue to please her customers with what she prepares.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, meat, condiments, chicken, ham, and other products

loans.name: Vivien

texts.en: Vivien is driven by passion in selling. At the age of 55, she is a married woman living in Tuburan, Pagadian City. She runs a store that primarily supports the family. Every day, she never gets tired of tending to her store. Vivien is a full fledged member of PMPC and has taken several loans already. She religiously paid her obligations without record of default. Now, she has borrowed another loan to pay for inventories of sugar, milk, oil and noodles to sell at her store. Having enough inventory would mean income opportunities. In the future, she dreams of sustaining her store to continuously provide for her family.

loans.use: to pay for inventories of sugar, milk, oil and noodles to sell at her store.

location.town: Pagadian-Tuburan, Pagadian City Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Shahodat

texts.en:
Shahodat is caring mother of 5 children. Her husband is a woodworker. They try to provide good living conditions for their children which is why she has worked for 13 years in a local market. Shahodat buys dried fruit from local farmers and sells it in a store in a local market. 

Shahodat has regular customers due to  the high quality of her goods. She requests 10,000 TJS to buy dried fruit. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to buy dried fruits.

loans.name: La Fuerza De Carapongo Group

texts.es: “LA DUERZA DE  CARAPONGO” es un grupo conformado por socios dedicados al comercio minoristas. Alicia tiene 69 años de edad es viuda. Ella se dedica a la venta de productos belleza de diversas marcas hace 05 años. El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de mas productos de belleza que estén en ofertas joyas perfumes para damas y caballeros esmaltes y demás accesorios de belleza. Para expenderlos a un precio que le generen buenas ganancias. El grupo agradece a los inversionistas KIVA por el crédito brindado. Alicia es la que viste casaca color barney.
texts.en:
"La Fuerza de Carapongo” [The Strength of Carapongo] Group is composed of members who are in the retail business. 

Alicia is 69 years old, and she is a widow.  She has been selling different brands of beauty products for 5 years.  She will invest the loan in purchasing more beauty products that may be on sale,  jewelry, men’s and ladies’ perfume, nail polish, and other beauty accessories; in order to sell them at a price that will generate good earnings.

The group thanks the Kiva lenders for the loan.  Alicia is seen wearing the “Barney” [purple] colored jacket.

loans.use: to purchase more beauty products, perfume, and jewelry.

loans.name: Fidela

texts.en:
Fidela thought she was in the right place when she joined the microfinance group of Paglaum MPC. She decided to give it a try after she learned she can obtain financial assistance for her chosen business. Fidela has maintained her membership in good standing without record of default. She has taken several loans and all were paid in a timely manner. 

Recently, Fidela obtained a loan to purchase bags of feed and animal vitamins for her chosen business. Fidela wishes to continuously manage her business more effectively with the support of her family.

loans.use: to purchase bags of feed and animal vitamins for her pigs.

location.town: Pagadian - Balangasan District,  Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Thirty five-year-old Lucy does not boast of a university degree or even a certificate from an agricultural institute, but she is an accomplished farmer from the Kerugoya area of Kenya and commands a lot of respect. 

She is happily married and, together with her handsome husband, is blessed with 4 adorable children. For the past 6 years, she has been involved in mixed farming, and because of the immense knowledge she has on farming, farmers from their village and neighboring villages travel to her home to seek technical advice on the best farming techniques. Lucy is the breadwinner of her family, and this really pushes her to work hard so that her children will have a bright future and her parents will have a comfortable life. 

Lucy is seeking a loan to start horticulture farming so that she can use the excess space on her land. She dreams of buying more land and increasing her  farm. Accessing funds is very difficult for a woman in Africa, but through institutions such as Juhudi Kilimo and Kiva, Lucy is optimistic that her dream will be realized and her life will completely change. 

Lucy will use the income to assure her children a bright future and will be able to pay tuition fees for her siblings who depend on her. Through your loan, the promise of supporting small-scale farmers will be achieved.

By making a loan today, you can help Lucy improve her business and her life!

loans.use: to start a farm.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia, a 63-year-old mother of four, is married to a fisherman. Virginia personally sells the catch from their fishing boat in nearby municipalities.

A member in good standing of Paglaum MPC for almost three years, Virginia has requested a loan of Php 14,900.00 to purchase new nets. Good equipment is necessary to maximize the chances of obtaining good catches. Virginia already has floaters to help guard their fish cages, and she also wants to buy the catches of her neighbors in order to sell them to the nearby fish market, where they will fetch higher prices. 

In the future, Virginia dreams of purchasing a new fishing boat by setting aside some savings from the daily sales.  She wishes to see her children have stable jobs as well.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets

loans.name: Rukaiya

texts.en:
Rukaiya is 42 years old; she lives in Lahore, Pakistan and is a responsible mother of five children. Her son owns a wooden stall in which he sells pieces of wood for fuel. In his area, there is a cooking gas fuel shortage, so people like to use these pieces of firewood for cooking. He continues his business on the corner of the family's residence. 

Rukaiya's son wants to increase his current business because it is the major source of income. To buy more wood to stock for his business he does not have a sufficient amount of money. Therefore, Rukaiya requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner, BRAC Pakistan, so that her son would be able to continue his business smoothly. She is thankful to BRAC Pakistan and Kiva.

loans.use: to buy wood for her son's business.

loans.name: Eunice's Group

texts.en:
Eunice has 8 children and is described as a very friendly person. She is her group's  leader which is composed of 8 farmers in  the Matete District.  She is happy to be working with One Acre Fund for the first time this year.

Eunice has been a farmer for 9 years and, in order to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods, she decided to join the One Acre Fund program this season. Her loan will purchase farming supplies and a solar light.  The light  means that she will now reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save money.  Eunice plans to repair her home.

A total of 3.75 acres will be planted by Eunice's Group, and between them they will receive a total of 8 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed, fertilizer, and a solar light.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is married and blessed with one child. Jane is a skilled tailor and runs a boutique in her local shopping center. 

She joined Hand in Hand eastern Africa in December 2012.  She is grateful to HiH EA for developing her entrepreneurship spirit through training and mentorship. She will use the loan to purchase clothes and school uniforms. She hopes to capitalize on the demand for uniforms as parents take their children back to school in January 2015.  The additional income which will enable her to support her family's needs and educate her children.

Jane is grateful to Kiva and their lenders for their support. She promises to promptly repay the loan.

loans.use: to buy clothes and school uniforms.

loans.name: Ngeleno Women Group

texts.en:
Esther is the name of the lady raising her hand in the photograph. She is fifty years old, married and a 
mother of eight. 

Esther is a member of the Ngeleno  group. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa to benefit from training on enterprise development and financial management. This has helped her to acquire knowledge in business management. She grows maize and beans and requests a loan to purchase  fertilizer, manure, and hybrid seeds. This will enable her to increase her harvest and income. She will therefore be in a position to improve her family’s living standard  and better health care. 

Esther is grateful to Kiva and their lenders for the help and support.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, manure, and hybrid seeds.

loans.name: Blessed Mothers Group

texts.en:
The person raising her hand in the photo is Njeri, a 53-year-old married woman.  She has six children and is a very hardworking member of Blessed Mothers Group.  

The group members have been trained on good entrepreneurial skills and prudent financial management.

Njeri  buys vegetables from the local farmers and sells them in the city market. She will use the loan to purchase vegetables in her business which she has operated for 2 years. She has a good customers base.  She hopes that her business will support her children's education by buying them school uniform, writing materials, and paying school fees. She looks forward to a decent living. 

Njeri is happy for Kiva and their lenders for the great support.

loans.use: to buy vegetables.

loans.name: Bademman Lolo4 Group

texts.fr: Bademman Lolo est client de ACFIME depuis février 2013. Ce groupe de 3 femmes fait bien les remboursements et sont à leur 5ème contrat de prêt avec ACFIME. Safoura, responsable du groupe est mariée et mère de 3 enfants tous scolarisés. Cette brave fait le commerce des pagnes de diverses qualités, c'est pourquoi elle à besoin de ce prêt pour en acheter plus. le bénéfice de ses ventes lui permettront de continuer son activité.
texts.en: The Bademman Lolo group has been a client of ACFIME since February 2013. This group, consisting of three women, has been repaying its loans well and is now on its fifth loan agreement with ACFIME. Safoura, the group’s leader, is married and has three children, all of whom attend school. This resilient woman sells traditional colorful “pagnes” fabric of various quality grades. She needs a loan to restock her merchandise. The revenue from her sales will allow her to keep developing her business.

loans.use: to buy traditional fabric for resale.

loans.name: Norma

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal LIDERANDO LAS PALMERAS, la socia Norma, la socia tiene 48 años de edad es conviviente  y tiene 03 hijos, la socia se dedica a su negocio de venta de pabilos, la socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas, la socia vende sus productos a sus amistades, familiares, clientes entre otros, la socia desea que su negocio cresca, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicito el crédito para la compra de  pabilos.
texts.en:
Norma is 48 years old and she has a life partner and three children. She belongs to the communal bank "Liderando las Palmeras".

She earns a living selling wicks to friends, relatives, and other clients. She wants this business to grow since it is how she supports her family.

Norma is requesting the loan to buy wicks. She is grateful for the loan, and committed to making the payments on schedule.

loans.use: to buy wicks.

loans.name: Cinforosa

texts.es:
La socia Cinforosa  pertenece al banco comunal LOS DIAMANTES, la socia continua dedicándose a la venta de comida en uno de los mercados de la ciudad del Cusco, la socia Cinforosa se siente agradecida con el apoyo brindado y por el crédito otorgado  y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de las cuotas establecidas, la socia vede la comida que prepara a sus  clientes que le solicitan cada día, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicito el crédito para la compra de arroz, menestras entre otros.
texts.en: The member, Cinforosa, belongs to the “Los Diamantes” [The Diamonds] communal bank, and is still engaged in selling food at one of Cusco's markets.  Cinforosa feels grateful for the support provided through the granting of the loan, and promises to make the established payments.  She sells food, which she prepares to fulfill her customers’ daily orders.  In this way, Cinforosa gets her family ahead.  She is requesting the loan to purchase rice, vegetable stew, and other foods.

loans.use: to purchase rice, vegetable stew, and other foods.

loans.name: San Gregorio De Yucay Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “SAN GREGORIO DE YUCAY”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Yucay, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Nancy Juana ella es conviviente y tiene 51 años y tiene 3 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de tienda de abarrotes  , la socia vende productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azúcar, leche y aceite, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m, la socia ya tiene 5 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de tienda de abarrotes. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar leche, azúcar, aceite y arroz.
Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de comida, negocio de venta de ropa, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de restaurant.



La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
These are the members of the "San Gregorio de Yucay" communal bank.  This group is located in Yucay district, which is in the province of Urubamba and the department of Cusco.

Nancy Juana, a member of this group, lives with a partner and has 3 children.  She is 51 years old.  She works in her grocery store business where she sells consumer staples such as rice, sugar, milk, and cooking oil.  She works from 8am until 6pm, and she has 5 years of experience with this business, which is doing very well.  Nancy Juana's dream is to expand her grocery store business.  She is requesting a loan to buy milk, sugar, cooking oil, and rice.

The other members of this group have businesses including: selling food, selling clothing, selling groceries, and a restaurant business.

Nancy Juana thanks the lenders that are supporting her dreams through these loans, and she promises to comply with the payment terms of the loan.

loans.use: to buy groceries to sell

loans.name: Bertha

texts.es:
La socia Bertha pertenece al banco comunal LOS DIAMANTES, la socia  continua dedicándose al negocio de venta de  productos de primera necesidad en su tienda de abarrotes. La socia lleva años dedicándose a este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia desea que su negocio cresca, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
  La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar aceite, arroz,  entre otros.
texts.en:
Bertha's a member of Los Diamantes Communal Bank.  She still earns a living selling staple products in her grocery store.  She has had her business for years and it's going well for her thanks to the effort she puts into it every day.  She wants her business to grow because it's the way she gets her family ahead.

Bertha's requesting the loan to buy oil, rice, and other products.

loans.use: to buy oil, rice, and other products

loans.name: Matilde

texts.es:
La socia Matilde se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de frutas y verduras,por medio de este negocio la socia quiere salir adelante,la socia es un amujer emprendedora,el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de venta de frutas y verduras.La socia solicita el credito para comprar manzanas,naranjas,platanos,cebollas,zapallos y zanahorias.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: Matilde continues to work in fruit and vegetable sales. By means of this business, she hopes to get ahead. She is an enterprising woman who dreams of growing her fruit and vegetable business. Matilde requests this loan to purchase apples, oranges, bananas, onions, squash, and carrots. She is happy about the loan and promises to make her payments.

loans.use: to purchase apples, oranges, bananas, onions, squash, carrots, and tomatoes.

loans.name: Carlito

texts.en:
Carlito earns a living by operating a motorcycle transport service, locally known as habal-habal. He transports passengers from his barangay to remote areas in his municipality. In addition to that, he also does farming and is engaged in the hog raising business as well.

He is a married man with two young dependents, living in Mayorga, Leyte.

Carlito is asking for a loan to buy a side car, purchase materials for pig pen renovation and fertilizers for the farm. These will help his farming business improve and provide a comfortable pen for his pigs. He will also be able to cater for more passengers with the addition of a new side car.

He would like to manage his sources of livelihood properly to become successful and start to back to a normal way of living.

loans.use: to buy a side car, purchase materials for pig pen renovation and fertilizers for the farm.

loans.name: Sonia

texts.en:
Sonia raises and sells hogs. Aside from hog raising, she also engages in the tuba (coconut) wine vending business. During planting season, she also engages in farming. She grows and sells rice.

She is a married woman with six children from Mayorga, Leyte. Her youngest child is 9 months old.

Sonia has requested a loan to buy two additional pigs, tuba (coconut) wine and farm supplies like fertilizers. With the aid of these materials, She will start to optimize her sources of income. She would raise more pigs, sell more tuba, and hopefully improve the yield of her farm.

In the future, Sonia is trying her best to make her business successful and productive to support the needs of her growing children and also to become more sustainable.

loans.use: to buy two additional pigs, tuba (coconut) wine and farm supplies like fertilizers.

loans.name: Eminda

texts.en:
As a widower parent of three children, Eminda works hard to support her family. She has a buy-and-sell clothing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling jewellery.

Eminda is borrowing PHP 23,000 through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of clothes to sell for her buy-and-sell clothing business.

Eminda has been sustaining her business activities through her past loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of clothes to sell.

loans.name: Anahit

texts.en:
Anahit has been involved in agriculture for already 15 years. She lives with her husband and two minor children in Shaqe village, Syuniq region.

Anahit’s husband is an army officer, so the main work in the household lies with Anahit only. She keeps livestock of three cows, calves, sheep, and hens. Near the house, Anahit also owns a plot of land, where wheat, emmer wheat, and potatoes are cultivated.

To be able to purchase forage for the livestock and seeds for cultivation, Anahit has applied for this loan. Anahit will be able to use the gathered income for further development of her farm.

loans.use: to purchase forage for the livestock and seeds for cultivation.

loans.name: Astghik

texts.en:
Astghik is from Margara village, Armavir region, where she lives with her husband, mother-in-law, and two school-age children.

She is engaged in land cultivation. In the greenhouse near her house, Astghik cultivates tomatoes, greens, peppers, and potatoes.

Her husband helps to sell the gathered harvest in local markets, and this source of income is very important for their living.

Astghik has applied for this loan to purchase a polyethylene cover for the greenhouse, fertilizer, and seeds for cultivation.

loans.use: to purchase a polyethylene cover for the greenhouse, fertilizer, and seeds for cultivation.

loans.name: Evgine

texts.en:
Evgine is from Hovtashen village, Shirak region, where she lives with her husband, son, daughter-in-law and two little grandchildren. Evgine is an experienced farmer running a farm which includes big livestock (cows, calves, sheep, pigs, piglets and hens) and also cultivation of wheat, barley, potatoes and greens.

Her daughter-in-law and son help her realize the agricultural products in the local market, which is the main source of family's income. To continue running her agribusiness in a sustainable way, Evgine needs a loan of USD 3,000 to purchase necessary seeds for land cultivation and to buy fertilizers. She has already taken a loan from a local financial institution before, but unfortunately wasn't able to return it back. However, thanks to the hard work during the recent times, Evgine was able to run her agribusiness in a sustainable way, ensuring that she will be able to cover the monthly payments.

She has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The second-chance loan program provides loans to people who have a bad credit history and have no access to credit products. Evgine and her family will be thankful to all the lenders for helping them to maintain their agribusiness.

loans.use: to purchase necessary seeds for land cultivation and to buy fertilizers.

loans.name: Mosher Al- Oriki Al-Wadi Group

texts.en:
Mosher Al-Oriki Al-Wadi is a group of four women from Sana'a, Yemen. They applied for a loan of 180,000 YER from AMB.

Nadia is the leader of the group. She is a 35-year-old married woman with five children, living with her family in a very old house. The kitchen of the house is without a door and windows, which reflects a bad condition and lets insects enter easily into the kitchen. Nadia's husband doesn't have enough money to renovate the house. For this reason, she applied for a loan of 30,000 YER from AMB in order to buy an aluminum door and window for the kitchen.

Nadia hopes to send her children to a private school.

loans.use: to buy an aluminum door and window for the kitchen.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase new stylish flagstones for the bathroom of his house.

loans.name: Soledad

texts.es:
La socia Soledad pertenece al banco comunal LOS DIAMANTES, la socia  continua dedicándose a la docencia de educación inicial, y paralelamente continua elaborando prendas de vestir, la socia se siente agradecida por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día  a su negocio, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia Soledad solicita el préstamo para comprar lanas de diferentes colores entre otros.
texts.en: The member, Soledad, belongs to the “Los Diamantes” [The Diamonds] communal bank. Soledad is continuing to work as a pre-school teacher, and continues making clothing at the same time.  The member feels grateful for the loan, and promises to make her established payments.  Soledad spends a lot of time with her business, which is going well thanks to the effort she puts into it every day.  In this way, she gets her family ahead.  She is requesting the loan to purchase different colors of wool as well as other supplies.

loans.use: to purchase different colors of wool as well as other supplies.

loans.name: Cleofe Eufemia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal LOS DIAMANTES, la socia Cleofe continua  ayudando  a su esposo en la carpintería principalmente en la fabricación de ataúdes, la socia se siente agradecida por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día  a su negocio, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar materiales como madera, pinturas entre otros.
texts.en:
Cleofa belongs to the communal bank "Los Diamantes." She continues helping her husband with his carpentry, mainly the production of caskets. She feels very thankful for the loan and promises to make her payments. 

Cleofa has been working in this business for some time, and it has been going well thanks to the effort which she puts in every day, the business being her way of providing for her family. She requests this loan in order to purchase materials such as wood and paint, among others.

loans.use: to purchase materials such as wood, paint, etc.

loans.name: Yovanna

texts.es:
La socia Yovanna pertenece al banco comunal “LOS DIAMANTES” ,la socia continua dedicándose  al negocio de venta de artesanía, principalmente de elementos de joyería en plata como aretes, pulseras, collares entre otros, la socia se siente agradecida por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día  a su negocio, la socia vende su mercadería a sus clientes que le solicitan, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicito el crédito para la compra de artes y collares.
texts.en:
Yovanna is a member of Los Diamantes Communal Bank.  She still works in her business selling arts and crafts, mainly silver jewelry such as earrings, bracelets, and necklaces.  She has had her business for some time and it's going well for her because of the effort she puts into it every day.  She sells her merchandise to her customers who request it from her because this is how she gets her family ahead.

Yvonna requested the loan to buy art and necklaces.

She's grateful for the loan and promises to make her payments punctually.

loans.use: to buy art and necklaces

loans.name: Dina

texts.en:
Dina earns a living by engaging in a food-vending business. She makes and sells homemade burgers and pansit (made with extremely thin rice noodles, soy sauce, citrus, sliced meats, and vegetables.) She is a 43-year-old married woman with four dependents. Two are still attending school. In addition to that, she engages in a hog-raising business.

She is asking for a loan to buy more supplies for food vending like meat, vegetables, seasonings, and pig feed. These ingredients will be used in her food vending and she will sell it in her local community. She could now raise healthy pigs in the coming months. In this way, her income will improve so she can set aside some savings. She can now provide proper foods to the whole family.

Dina is hoping that this is the start of her recovery and she is determined to expand her business to become sustainable and to continue financing the schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy more supplies for food vending like  meat, vegetables, seasonings, and pig feed.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for spare parts and pay for maintenance of her tricycle unit.

loans.name: Rizza

texts.en:
Rizza lives in the town of Mayorga, Leyte. She is a 29 year old married woman with two children ages 8 and 1 year old. She sells various kinds of vegetables and dressed chicken. She displays her goods at a stall located inside the market in her community.

She is asking for a loan to buy additional supplies of dressed chicken and vegetables. These will attract more buyers and she would also cater to her customers needs in terms of vegetable varieties.

Rizza would earn a higher income and start to pay her obligations and other household expenses.

In the future, Rizza dreams of raising her livelihood status and becoming more productive for the welfare of her child.

loans.use: to buy additional supplies of dressed chicken  and vegetables

loans.name: Roxanne

texts.en:
Roxanne has two children ages 3 and 8 year old. She is engaged in the hog raising business. She grows and sells hogs. She has been engaged in the hog raising business for 3 years now. Her husband earns a living by being a chainsaw operator.

Roxanne has requested a loan in the amount of 20,000 PHP to buy additional pigs and materials for pig pen renovation like steel bars, hollow blocks and cement. With these materials, she can now start to construct a more durable pig pen and eventually raise and sells healthy pigs in a few months. She will be earning more and be able to purchase good food and live in suitable shelter.

She would like to expand her current business to improve her livelihood status and have a stable source of income in the coming future.

loans.use: to buy additional pigs and materials for pig pen renovation like steel bars, hollow blocks and cement.

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia is a 58 year old married woman from Mayorga, Leyte. She has four young dependants living with her.

Delia runs a sari-sari (variety store), selling various merchandise ranging from powdered milk, eggs, noodles, catsup, toothpaste, canned goods to soap and seasonings. To augment her income, she also engages in the hog raising business. She grows and sells hogs.

She is asking for a loan to buy additional stocks for the store and purchase pig feed and vitamins. With the help of these tools, Delia will sell more variety of goods in her store, creating more customers to shop and buy. She will raise healthy pig in a few months, thus augmenting her income. She will be able to provide nutritious diets to the whole family.

In the future, Delia hopes to improve and expand both her businesses to be sustainable and continue to finance the education of her young dependants.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks for her store and purchase pig feed and vitamins.

loans.name: Nilda

texts.en:
Her name is Nilda. She is 46, single, and a resident of Tanza, Cavite, Philippines. She is a hardworking woman and has two types of business. She works hard to support herself and her aging parents.

Nilda operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a general store is basically a small convenience store which sells fresh, dry, and packaged commodities directly to consumers. Almost all products are essential household items and food. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a 5-pesos-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by buying supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. She also sells electronic pre-paid load for cellular mobile subscribers. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum net income of 2,500 PHP a day. 

To help her continue operations of her general store business, she is requesting a 20,000 PHP loan that she will use to buy grocery items such as fresh meat, sacks of rice, charcoal, soda and other grocery stuff. With part of the loan, she will also pay for electronic load from leading telecommunication companies to sell at a retail price. She expects a higher demand for groceries and electronic load, especially this Christmas season. She is thanking God and you in advance for the financial aid that will be given her, for it will surely help meet her everyday personal and household needs.

Nilda hopes to maintain and grow her business to sustain their needs. She wants to start saving for her old age. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week, and this is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, beverages and toiletries to sell.

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma is 61 years old and married with three children. She works very hard to provide for them. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items like snack goods, canned goods, coffee, sugar, beer, candies, etc. to sell.

Norma has been in this business for nine years and sells a variety of such items. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like snack goods, canned goods, coffee, sugar, beer, candies, etc.

loans.name: Anahit

texts.en:
The nice woman in the photo is Anahit, who is an experienced farmer from Lukashin village, Armavir region. She lives there with her husband and 22-year-old son, and both of them have a job (her husband is a bus driver, and her son works at a stone-processing factory.) 

Anahit runs a family farm. She keeps livestock of cows, calves, sheep and pig, as well as cultivating potatoes and cabbage. The greenhouse where Anahit organizes land cultivation is very old and needs to be renovated. That’s the reason she has applied for this loan to pay for renovation of the greenhouse, purchase polyethylene cover for the greenhouse, fertilizer, and two oxen.

Anahit will be very thankful for the lenders’ support and plans to develop further her farm.

loans.use: to pay for renovation of the greenhouse, purchase polyethylene cover for the greenhouse, fertilizer, and two oxen.

loans.name: Janeth

texts.en:
Janeth is 31 years old, married, and has two children, one of whom is currently in school.

Janeth is in the agricultural business, farming squash in the Philippines. Janeth requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy seeds, fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Janeth has been farming squash for five years now, and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Janeth would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Ep Bayago Group

texts.fr: Madame MBILA est vice-présidente de l'association de credit EP BAYAGO. Agée de 71 ans, mère de 8 enfants tous écoliers est enseignante et mariée à un activiste de droit de l’homme. Elle vient de solliciter un prêt pour lui permettre d’améliorer sa maison. Elle remercie HEKIMA pour avoir songé à un produit qui aide les enseignants à modiques rémunérations.
texts.en: Madame Mbila is the vice-president of the loan association EP Bayago. At 71 years of age, she is the mother of eight children, all schooled, a teacher and married to a human rights activist. She has just requested a loan to allow her to improve her house. She thanks Hekima for having thought of a banking product that helps teachers who have modest remuneration.

loans.use: to improve her house.

loans.name: Shaarkan

texts.ru: Шааркан, 49 лет, замужем, есть 3 детей. У Шааркан - среднее образование. В качестве дополнительного дохода для своей семьи, она занимается животноводством и полеводством, стартовав в 1996 году, с покупки скота на 5,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорному труду Шааркан, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 1 корова, 1 лошадь и 10 овец, а также имеет земельный надел размером 1,92 ГА, на котором Шааркан ежегодно выращивает фасоль, картофель и многолетние травы под внутрихозяйственное потребление и реализацию. В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, она обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 4 бычков. Шааркан является лидером группы "Кызыл-Туу", в которой кроме нее состоят еще 2 человека, всего их трое. Шааркан приумножить скот, чтобы иметь возможность накопить средства на аренду дополнительного земельного участка для полеводческих нужд.
texts.en: Shaarkan is 49 years old, married, and has three children. Shaarkan has a secondary education. As an additional source of income for her family, she practices livestock breeding and crop farming. She started this business in 1996 with an initial purchase of cattle in the amount of 5,000 som (KGS). Thanks to Shaarkan's hard work, she currently has 1 cow, 1 horse and 10 sheep on her farm. She also has a 1.92 hectare plot of land on which she annually grows beans, potatoes and perennial grasses for personal consumption and sale. For the further development of her business, she turned to Microfinance Bank "Bai Tushum." She is requesting a loan for 100,000 som (KGS) to buy four bull calves. Shaarkan is the leader of the loan group "Kyzyl-Tuu," which has two members besides herself - three members in total. Shaarkan is increasing her number of cattle so that she can have the chance to save money to rent an additional plot of land for her crop farming needs.

loans.use: to purchase four bull calves for fattening up and reselling.

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es:
Isabel es una señora de 43 años, vive en una comunidad de Solola, convive junto a su esposo  donde procrearon 8 hijos dos de sus hijos ya están casados, aun tienen seis hijos bajo la responsabilidad de sus padres. 

Isabel es una mujer muy dedicada a su familia y muy comprometida, en ayudar a su esposo para  generar ingresos y así contribuir en los gastos de la casa ,  para poder sacar adelante a su familia, Isabel desde muy pequeña creció y trabajo al lado de su mamá y heredo el oficio con que su mamá apoyaba a su familia, ella ahora se dedica a la elaboración de  güipiles típicos de la región donde vive . 

Ella desde hace varios años, cuenta con una vivienda pero el anhelo de Isabel es conseguir  un préstamo, para ayudar a su esposo en remodelar su casa, y tener un lugar más digno para sus hijos. Y con las ganancias que genera su  pequeño negocio ella estaría pagando el préstamo. Isabel es una mujer muy trabajadora y ella tiene las esperanzas de conseguir  el préstamo y su sueño es  ver su casa con otra perspectiva.
texts.en:
Isabel is a 43-year-old woman, and lives in the city of Solola. She lives together with her husband and they have 8 children, two of which are already married. They still have six children that are dependent on them.

Isabel is a woman that is very dedicated to her family, and very committed to helping her husband generate an income and contribute towards the housing expenses in order to move her family forward. From the time she was little, Isabel grew up and worked alongside her mother and inherited the role her mother had in supporting her family. She earns a living making traditional blouses typical of the region where she lives.

For many years she has had a home, but it is her desire to get a loan to help her husband remodel their house and have a more dignified place for their children. With the income she generates from her small business she would be repaying the loan. Isabel is a hard-working woman, and she hopes to receive the loan. Her dream is to see her house from another perspective.

loans.use: to remodel her home.

loans.name: Dilnoza

texts.ru: Дилноза работает продащицей в магазине. Ей 22 года. Она уже замужем и имеет годовалую дочь. Ее муж является мастером раскрасок. Они живут в районе Б.Гафурова города Худжанд. Дилноза в течение 3 лет работает в магазине, где занимается продажей детских игрушек и одежды. Она считает свою работу интересной и приятной. Однако добираться до работы на общественном трарнспорте ей очень трудно, поэтому она решила приобрести автомобиль. Для реализации данной покупки ей не хватает 2000 долларов США и в связи с этим Дилноза обратилась за кредитом. Она надеется на вашу финансовую поддержку, так как без него она не сможет осуществить свою цель.
texts.en: Dilnoza works as a saleswoman in a shop. She is 22 years old. She is already married and has a year-old daughter. Her husband is painting contractor. They live in the city of Khujand in the B. Gafurov district. For the past three years, Dilnoza has been working in a shop where she sells children's toys and clothing. She considers her work interesting and pleasant. However, it is difficult for her to get to her work using public transportation which is why she decided to buy a car. She does not have the 2000 USD needed to complete this purchase which is why she requested a loan. She relies on your financial support as she will not be able to fulfill her goal without it.

loans.use: to buy a car.

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en:
Marissa runs a sari-sari (general) store, selling goods, soft drinks, cooking oil, noodles, soap, sugar, coffee, powdered milk and seasonings. She is married with six children. Four of her children are still attending school. To have an additional source of income, she engages in a food vending business. She sells snack foods like bread with hot dog filling and banana cue (a popular snack food in the Philippines of deep fried bananas coated in caramelized brown sugar). 

Marissa has requested a loan to buy assorted groceries for the store. With the presence of a variety of merchandise, it could surely attract more buyers to come. In this way, Marissa will gain more earnings and be able to roll back her capital.

Marissa is determined to handle both businesses successfully for the welfare of her growing children.

loans.use: to buy assorted groceries for the store.

loans.name: Rolando

texts.es:
El socio Rolando  se dedica al negocio de venta de ferreteria,el socio vende clavos, pinturas y alambres, el socio por medio de este negocio quiere que sus hijos terminen de estudiar, el sueño del socio es abrir otro negocio de ferreteria.El socio solicita el crédito para comprar clavos, alambres,fierros y pinturas.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Rolando makes his living by selling hardware. He sells nails, paint, and wire. By means of this business, he hopes his children can finish their studies. Rolando's dream is to open another hardware store. 

Rolando requests this loan to purchase nails, wire, metal, and paint. He is happy about the loan and promises to make his payments.

loans.use: to purchase nails, wire, paint, and metal.

loans.name: Shahnoza

texts.en:
Shahnoza is a kind woman. She lives in the capital of Tajikistan. Shahnoza is a seamstress and during some years she has been busy with offering sewing services to local people. Shahnoza sews fashionable clothes for local people and she has regular customers, thanks to her high quality service. 

Shahnoza is going to buy a new sewing machine in order to improve the quality of her products. She is asking for a loan to a buy sewing machine for increasing working capital. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine in order to improve the quality of her products.

loans.name: Genita

texts.en:
Genita runs a sari-sari(variety) store to sell cooking oil, noodles, canned goods, biscuits, sugar, soap, shampoo and toothpaste. She is a 47-year-old married woman with two children from Mayorga, Leyte. One child attends school. Her husband earns a living as a laborer.

Genita requests a loan to purchase seasonings, powdered milk, soap and other goods.  These stock items will attract customers and augment her income and start to pay her daily expenses. Genita will be able to save some of her profit for the education of her  youngest child.

She is hoping to be successful and productive. She will do her best to support the needs of her children by providing  better living conditions and quality education for a better future.

loans.use: to purchase seasonings, powdered milk, soap and other goods.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles is 30 years old, married to Belinda and blessed with three school-going children. He has been farming for the last two years and earns a monthly income of 10,000 KES (Kenyan shillings). 

He has applied for his first loan of 20,000 KES from VisionFund Kenya and intends to use the loan to buy more seedlings and fertilizer for use on his farm. 

He will use the anticipated profits to provide for his family's basic needs. Charles hopes to grow his business and venture into large-scale farming.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs such as seedlings and fertilizer.

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en: Lorna is 55 years old and lives in Naga, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She is separated with three adult children. Lorna earns a living from food vending particularly snacks and food items at the school canteen. She has been engaged in this business for more than five years. Lorna earns approximately 3,000 PHP each month doing this type of business activity. She has requested a loan to be used for purchasing additional varieties of snacks and food items for her business. Lorna has been a member of PMPC for four years. In the future, Lorna hopes to establish her own food stall near the school area.

loans.use: to purchase additional varieties of snacks and food items.

loans.name: Chona

texts.en: Chona has started a sari-sari store (a small convenience store). Every day she has good sales because she has the only store in her barangay (village). Recently she approached Paglaum (Kiva's partner) for a loan to restock her store with basic supplies and consumable items. In the future, she hopes to see all her children finish their studies and secure their own jobs. Chona wishes to build a concrete house for the entire family and live happily with them.

loans.use: to restock her store with basic supplies and consumable items.

location.town: Sindangan - Dapaon, Sindangan, Zamboanga del Norte

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal MINIBANK, la socia continua dedicándose  al negocio de artesania, la socia realiza trabajos de bordados, La socia se siente agradecida  con el crédito y se compromete a cumplir los pagos de su cuota, la socia lleva años dedicándose a este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para comprar palitos de tejer y lanas.
texts.en:
The member belongs to Minibank Communal Bank.  She still earns a living in arts and crafts doing embroidery work.  She has been in this business for years and it's going well for her because of the effort she puts into it every day.  She wants to keep on working so she can keep supporting her family.

She's requesting the loan to buy knitting needles and yarn.

She's grateful for the loan and promises to make her payments punctually.

loans.use: to buy knitting needles and yarn

loans.name: Mao

texts.en:
Mao is 37 years old and has two children. She is a villager in Kampong Cham province. To support her family, she grows rice on three hectares. She works for others for a fee to earn extra income. She earns about 37,500 KHR per day. 

Mao requested her first loan from VisionFund, which she will use to buy buffalo to transport her rice and to pay the harvesting fee. She hopes that she can earn more income to improve her farming.

loans.use: to purchase a buffalo and pay the harvesting fee.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Kheap

texts.en:
Kheap, 33, is a farmer living in Kampong Cham province who is a mother of one kid. 

To tackle her family’s hardship, she grows rice on an area of one and a half hectares. Moreover, she is a chef and she has been involved in this business for ages. 

This is her first time with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She will spend her entire loan portion to buy more land to support her farmland. She hopes that she can get higher yields so she can ensure that her family has better conditions.

loans.use: To buy more land to support her farmland.

loans.name: Yun

texts.en:
Residing in Kampong Cham province, Yun is 51 years old and is a mother of four children. For her living, she grows cassava on an area of three hectares. 

This is the second loan cycle for Yun with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She has fully repaid her past loan wisely to improve her living conditions at a gradual pace. 

She will spend her loan portion to buy fertilizer and pesticides, and to pay for plowing and other labor costs. She hopes that she can get higher yields than last year.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pesticides, and to pay for plowing and other labor costs.

loans.name: Salome's Group

texts.en:
Salome is 35 years old and has 6 children. She is a group leader and is representing her 12-member group  from the Matete District, Kenya. 

Salome has been farming with One Acre Fund for years and joined the program in 2011. This decision was largely a result of her desire to get the best quality fertilizer and hybrid seeds and, although she described her last harvest as excellent, she believes she could have a better one this year by continuing to work alongside One Acre Fund. 

Salome also decided to purchase a solar light as part of her loan, which she is very excited about, as it will allow her to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save money.

Obtaining this loan means that Salome's Group will be able to receive a total of 10 solar lights, as well as farming supplies to plant a total of 6 acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light, hybrid seeds, and fertilizer.

loans.name: Vannourn's Group

texts.en: Vannourn, 37, lives in Kampong Cham province and is a mother of two children. To tackle her family’s hardship, she grows cassava on two hectares. Moreover, she earns income via working for others for a fee. For Vannourn, this is her first time with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She leads a group of two members to get a new loan. As the group leader, she will spend her portion to buy fertilizer and pay a harvesting fee. She hopes that she can get larger yields than before.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pay harvesting fee.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Marvin De Jesus

texts.es:
Marvin, es casado, no tiene hijos, vive en casa de su madre, su negocio es ofrecer el servicio de transporte, repara celulares y además vende accesorios para los mismos, en tiempos libres también práctica la peluquería, es así como logra tener recursos económicos para lograr cubrir las necesidades básicas de su familia, su horario de trabajo es de 6:00 a.m. a 6:00 p.m., su negocio nació hace 2 años, su mayor ventaja es que cuenta con un equipo de trabajo adecuado para desempeñar sus actividades. 
Invertirá el préstamo en la compra de rines, llantas nuevas y pintará la carrocería de su unidad transporte, mantendrá en buenas condiciones el camión para optimizar el servicio y brindar seguridad a sus clientes, espera que las solicitudes de su servicio aumente para tener mayores ingresos.
Sus sueños son tener un local en el centro de la ciudad, cancelar sus deudas y seguir costeando los gastos familiares.
texts.en:
Marvin is married, has no children and lives in the house of his mother. His business is providing transportation services, repairing cellphones, and selling accessories for them too. In his spare time he also cuts hair. So in this way he manages to have the economic resources he needs to cover the basic necessities of his family. His work timetable is from 6am until 6 pm and he started his business two years ago. His main advantage is that he has an adequate vehicle to carry out his activities.

He will invest the loan in buying rims, new tires and paint the body of his vehicle, maintaining his truck in good condition to maximize his service and offer security to his clients. He hopes that his requests for service increase so he has more income. His dream is to have a store in the center of the city, pay off his debt and continue to pay the family expenses.

loans.use: to invest the loan in buying rims, new tires and paint the body of his transportation unit, keeping his truck in good condition.

loans.name: Upendo Tumaini Group

texts.en:
In 2014, Upendo Tumaini Group joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa to be trained on financial management, enterprise development and savings mobilization to help improve on their livelihoods. 

The person raising his hand in the photograph is Stephen, a member of this group. He is 32 years old, married, and lives with his wife and three children. He operates a small grocery to sell onions, tomatoes, kale, and cabbages. 

He has applied for a loan to increase his stock. He hopes this will enable him to meet the rising demand for vegetables in his locality and earn  more income. This will enable him pay school fees for his children.  

He is  happy with this loan and grateful to Kiva and their lenders for their help and support.

loans.use: to buy onions, tomatoes, kale, and cabbages.

loans.name: Timothy

texts.en:
Timothy is married and blessed with five children.  He grows maize and potatoes and received training from Hand in Hand Eastern Africa on enterprise development and financial management.  This has enabled him to manage his business well. 

He needs a loan to improve his farm and but fertilizer, seed, and pesticide.  He hopes that the income will increase and improve his living standards.  He will  pay his children's school fees and purchase  good clothing and food.

Timothy is very grateful to Kiva and their lenders for the help and support.

loans.use: to buy  fertilizer, seeds, and pesticide to help improve his crop yield.

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en:
Nasreen is a 48-year-old woman with seven children. They live  in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband is a  grocer by profession, and has sold fresh vegetables in a nearby town for many years. Her husband offers seasonal and fresh vegetables to his customers. He has been feeding his family through the generated income from this vegetable shop. 

The needs of his family suddenly increased and he does not have other income sources to cope with these needs. So he decided to expand his current business. He wants to increase his stock to maximize sales out of the vegetable. Therefore, Nasreen requests a loan so that her husband would be able to buy more vegetables for selling.

Nasreen is very thankful to Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy fresh and seasonal vegetables for her husband's grocery business.

loans.name: Al- Hanouf Group

texts.en:
Al- Hanouf is a group of four women who work hard to improve the living conditions of their families. They asked for a loan of 80,000 YER (Yemeni Rails) from AL-Amal Microfinance Bank.
One of these members is Zahra, who is 52 years old and very dynamic. She has lived with her family in very miserable conditions. To provide her family with more suitable living conditions, she decided to sell women clothes door to door in her area. The income from her business is small but she strives strongly to improve it. To do that, she applied for a loan of 20,000 YER from AMB to buy stylish women clothes for resale. One of Zahra's dreams is opening her own place of business to sell all kinds of stylish women clothes

loans.use: To buy stylish women's clothes for resale

loans.name: Madai Gabina

texts.es:
La socia Madai Gabina se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de granos secos como maiz, trigo y quinua, la socia es una mijer emprendedora y trabajadora que por medio de su pequeño negocio quiere salir adelante, el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender los  granos. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar maiz, cebada y trigo.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Madai Gabina continues to work in the sale of dry grains such as corn, wheat, and quinoa. She a hardworking and enterprising woman who hopes to get ahead by means of this business. Her dream is to have a shop where she can sell her grains. 

She requests this loan to purchase corn, barley, and wheat. She is happy about the loan and promises to make her payments.

loans.use: to purchase corn, barley, and wheat

loans.name: Norberta

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal MINIBANK ,la socia continua dedicándose al negocio de transporte  alquilando sus carros a los diferentes clientes que le solicitan, la socia se siente agradecida  con el crédito y se compromete a cumplir los pagos de su cuota, la socia lleva años dedicándose a este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicito el crédito para comprar llantas.
texts.en:
The member belongs to Minibank Communal Bank.  She still earns a living in transportation, renting her cars to different customers.  She has worked in this business for years and it's going well for her thanks to the effort she puts into it every day.  She wants to be able to keep on working and supporting her family.

She requested the loan to buy tires.

She's grateful for the loan and promises to make her payments punctually.

loans.use: to buy tires

loans.name: Shandy Rocio

texts.es:
La socia Shandy Rocio se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de granos secos como maiz, trigo y quinua, la socia por medio de este negocio quiere salir adelante, la socia es una mujer luchadora y trabajadora. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar maiz, cebada y trigo.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: Shandy Rocio continues working in the sale of dry grains such as corn, wheat, and quinoa. She hopes to get ahead by means of this business. She is a very hardworking and determined woman. She requests this loan to purchase corn, barley, and wheat. She is happy about the loan and promises to make her payments.

loans.use: to purchase corn, barley, and wheat

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for grocery items, beverages and toiletries to sell.

loans.name: Chona

texts.en:
Chona is 34 years old and married with two children.

Chona works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell in her general store.

Chona has borrowed and paid six loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for three years and also earns an income from electronic mobile load retailing.

Chona aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
As a married parent of seven children, Letecia works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from selling soft drinks and beverages. Letecia is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to purchase ingredients like meat, vegetables, fish, spices, etc., for her food vending business.

Letecia has been sustaining her business activities through her past two loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients like meat, vegetables, fish, spices, etc. for her food production business

loans.name: Rozalinda

texts.en:
Rozalinda is 49 years old, married, and has nine children, six of whom are in school.

Rozalinda is in the agriculture business, farming vegetables in the Philippines. Rozalinda requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy seeds, fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Rozalinda has been farming vegetables for nine years now, and has borrowed six times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Rozalinda would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Alicia is 57 years old and married with four children. She is in the agricultural business of pig fattening in the Philippines. Alicia has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

She has been in pig fattening for eight years now, and has borrowed 12 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it. In the future, Alicia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Alodia

texts.en:
Alodia works hard to support her family. Alodia is married and has a general store business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 10 years now.

Alodia requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

In the future, Alodia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma is 44 years old and married with two children. Vilma works very hard to provide for them.

Vilma runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 27.000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock of items like detergent, soap, shampoo, fabric conditioner, cereals, salt, vinegar, noodles, etc. to sell.

Vilma has been in this business for 20 years and sells a variety of items such as detergent soap, shampoo, fabric conditioner, cereals, salt, vinegar, noodles, etc.

Vilma would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of items like detergent, soap, shampoo, fabric conditioner, cereals, salt, vinegar, noodles, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Crisologa

texts.en:
Crisologa works hard to support her family. She is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients and items for her business.

Crisologa has been in this business for 20 years now. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients and items for her business.

loans.name: Ahmmed

texts.en:
Ahmmed is a 36-year-old married man and a father of nine children. He is living with his large family in a small house in Haja city, Yemen. He is an uneducated man and works with an unfixed income. Ahmmed is the sole breadwinner of the family and strives strongly to provide his family with a better future. 

The house where he lives consists of a few rooms that are not enough for all the members of the family; the kitchen is very small, as well. Ahmmed doesn't have enough money to expand it. For this reason, he applied for a loan of 300,000 YER from AMB in order to purchase construction materials to build an extra room, as well as to expand the kitchen.

Ahmmed hopes to build another new house and rent it with a monthly salary.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials to build an extra room, as well as to expand the kitchen

loans.name: Mujembere Group

texts.fr: Madame BAHATI est mère de 6 enfants tous écoliers et présidente du groupe MUJEMBERE. Epouse d’un enseignant, elle s’occupe de la vente des produits alimentaires divers à son domicile depuis 2007. Avec le prêt sollicité, elle compte acheter 25kg de farine, 5 litres d’huile, ½ sac de braise, 3 kg de sucre et les ingrédients de cuisine. Le revenu de son activité lui servira à payer les frais scolaires de ses enfants et renforcer sa capacité d’épargne. A cet effet, elle remercie HEKIMA pour son soutien.
texts.en: Madame Bahati is the mother of six children, all schooling, and president of the group called Mujembere. The wife of a teacher, she has been selling various foodstuffs out of her home since 2007. With the loan she is requesting, she intends to buy 25 kg of flour, 5 liters of oil, half a sack of charcoal, 3 kilos of sugar and cooking ingredients. The income from her business will allow her to pay her children's school fees  and reinforce her capacity to set aside savings. In this regard, she thanks Hekima for its support.

loans.use: to buy 25 kg of flour, 5 liters of oil, half a sack of charcoal, 3 kilos of sugar and cooking ingredients

loans.name: Carmen

texts.en:
Carmen is a married woman with five children. Carmen is 45 years old and has three children who are currently in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Carmen has a general store business in the Philippines and has been in this business for 10 years.

Carmen requested a PHP 11,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

In the future, Carmen would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Carolina

texts.en:
Carolina is a married woman with five children. She is 67 years old and has one child who is still in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Carolina has a fishing business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 13,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional materials like fishing nets, fish containers, etc. for her business.

Carolina has been in this business for 20 years. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials like fishing nets, fish containers, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Charisa

texts.en:
Charisa works hard to support her family. Charisa is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 5 years now.

Charisa requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional materials and gear for her business.

Charisa would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional materials and gear for her fishing business.

loans.name: Virginia Antonia

texts.es: Virginia es una señora que labora como maestra de educación secundaria en un instituto de la zona donde vive, desde hace seis años, soltera, con un hijo a su cargo, actualmente esta presentando una necesidad de mejorar su vivienda, por lo que visito a Ceprodel  para solicitar financiamiento el que utilizaría en  Compra de cemento, arena, hierro y mano de obra, el que le ayudaría a realizar las mejoras de su cuarto, el que le vendría a mejorar las condiciones y nivel de vida
texts.en:
Virginia's a woman who has worked for six years as a teacher in a secondary school in the area where she lives.  She's single and has one child in her care.

Currently she needs to improve her home, so she went to CEPRODEL to request financing.  She's going to buy cement, sand, and rebar, as well as pay for labor to help her make improvements on her room and improve her living conditions and standard of living.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, and rebar, and to pay for labor

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es:
La socia Elizabeth pertenece al banco comunal LOS DIAMANTES, la socia  continua dedicándose a  la venta de artesanía,  la socia se siente agradecida por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día  a su negocio, la socia vende su mercadería a sus clientes que le solicitan, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de chompas, polos entre otros.
texts.en:
Elizabeth is a member of the Los Diamantes Communal Bank. She continues selling handcrafts. She feels thankful for the loan and she promises to make her payments on time. 
 
She has had her business for quite some time, and it is going well for her, thanks to the hard work that she puts into it every day. She sells her merchandise to her customers on request, and this is how she provides for her family. 

She is requesting the loan for the purchase of sweaters and polo shirts, among other items.

loans.use: to purchase sweaters and polo shirts, among other items.

loans.name: Los Progresistas Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “LOS PROGRESISTAS”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Giuliana Annabella ella es soltera y tiene 40 años y tiene 3 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de venta de ropa , la socia vende chompas,pantalones,polos y blusas, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m llevando a diferentes lugares como instituciones o sus amigos, la socia ya tiene 5 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es tener un atienda donde pueda vender la ropa. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar chompas, polos pantalones y blusas.
Las socias que estan pegadas a la foto grupal se les tomo despues la foto porque pideron permiso por motivos de trabajo.

La socia que esta tapada con un circulo su cara ya no pertenece al banco comunal Los progresistas.
 
Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de peluches, negocio de venta de golosinas, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de agencia de viajes.
texts.en:
Our members belong to the LOS PROGRESISTAS community bank in Cusco.

Sra. Giuliana Annabella 40, is single and has 3 children.  She operates a business buying and selling clothes for men and women.  She works from 8:00am to 7:00pm, going from street to street and place to place to meet her customers.  She has operated the business for 5 years and says that it is successful.  For the future, she would like to move the business to a fixed space so that she needn't sell her merchandise from door to door.  Giuliana is applying for a loan that she will use to stock her business with clothing that she will resell.

The smaller photos in the corners of the larger photo include members who had to work on the day the group picture was scheduled.  The woman in the group picture whose face has been obscured is no longer a member of the community bank.  The other members of the group operate a range of businesses from toy sales to grocery sales to tourist services.

loans.use: to stock her clothes sales business.

loans.name: Eva

texts.en:
Eva is a 43-year-old  married woman with a 20-year-old daughter. She engages in a RTW (ready to wear) business, selling various clothing and footwear items like sandals and shoes for both genders. She has been engaged in this kind of business for seven years now. She lives in Mayorga, Leyte.
