She has requested a loan to purchase more RTW, like clothing and footwear. These stocks are very essential in attracting more buyers to come and purchase. These will also help improve Eva's earnings. She can now provide nutritious diets to the whole family.

Eva is hoping that her livelihood will prosper and that this could lead to faster recovery and sustainability in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase more RTW (ready to wear) clothing and footwear

loans.name: Elecita

texts.en:
Elecita is 41 years old and married with four children. She works hard to provide for her family.  She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items like canned goods, snack foods, soft drinks, milk, juice, bread, biscuits, etc. to sell.

She has been running the general store for four years and also earns an income from electronic mobile load retailing. Elecita aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell like canned goods, snack foods, soft drinks, milk, juice, bread, biscuits, etc.

loans.name: Anecita

texts.en:
Anecita is 52 years old and married with five children. With three of her children currently in school, Anecita works very hard to provide for them.

Anecita runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell in her general store.

She has been in this business for nine years and sells a variety of items such as noodles, detergent soap, shampoo, cereals, chocolate drinks, seasonings, juice, etc.

In the future, Anecita would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Marta Julia

texts.es:
Marta, de 58 años de edad, no tiene ningun grado académico, debido a que sus padres no tenian los recursos económicos para que estudiara.- Está acompañada y su pareja se dedica a la agricultura, es madre de 6 hijos pero todos tienen sus propias familias.

Marta, se dedica a la venta de tamales y pasteles desde hace 40 años, decidio dedicarse a preparar estos alimentos para vender, debido a la situación económica de su familia, de ésta manera ella podia aportar para los gastos de la casa.-

Ella sale a vender sus productos, cerca de su casa, en el horario de 8:00 A.M. a 5:00 P.M. y su hija mayor le ayuda.

Marta, desea involucrarse en un nuevo negocio, es por eso que necesita el crédito para comprar dos vacas, de esta manera ella podrá aprovechar la leche de las vacas y venderla, así tendrá un nuevo ingreso para el sustento de su familia.
 
Marta, sueña con hacerle algunos arreglos a su casa y poder comprar alguna propiedad para dejarselas a sus hijos como herencia.
texts.en:
Marta, 58, is uneducated as her parents lacked the financial resources for her to go to school. She is accompanied by her partner who is a farmer. She is the mother of six children who all have their own families.

Marta sells tamales and pastries for 40 years now. She decided to sell her prepared foods because of the financial situation her family was in and that way she could contribute to the household expenses.

She goes out to sell her products, near her house, from 8am to 5pm, and her oldest daughter helps her.

Marta wants to open a new business and that's why she is requesting a loan to buy two cows. That way she can sell the cow's milk and generate a new source of income to maintain her family.

Marta dreams of making a few repairs to her home and being able to buy property so she can leave it to her children as an inheritance.

loans.use: buy two cows.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy young fish to diversify agricultural production.

loans.name: Jonifer

texts.en:
Jonifer is an industrious married man. He earns a living by operating a pedicab, locally known as pot-pot or (bicycle with sidecar). He transports passengers from one place to another like churches, markets and other places in his community.  He has three children, ages 16, 13 and 11. He has been engaged in the transportation business for more than 10 years now. 

He is asking for a loan to purchase stock for a start-up store like noodles, canned goods, beverages and toiletries. These grocery items will be helpful in opening his sari-sari-(variety) store. These will help augment his daily income. With this loan, he could now settle his obligations and other household expenses and could now start to save some for the college education of his child.
 
 In the future, Jonifer dreams to expand both businesses to make them productive and profitable for the improvement of his livelihood status.

loans.use: to purchase stock for the store like noodles, canned goods, beverages and toiletries.

loans.name: Conchita

texts.en:
Conchita is a 65-year-old married mother of 6 grown children. She lives with her family in Isabel, Leyte in the Philippines. 

Conchita has been engaged in her hog-raising business for more than 30 years now. This business has provided her the income that she needs to support her family. 

Today, Conchita wishes to take a loan to buy more piglets to raise. This loan will help Conchita improve her business’s sustainability and productivity.

loans.use: to buy more piglets to raise.

loans.name: Carmen Marina

texts.es: La señora Carmen, es una microempresaria emprendedora de 42 años, casada y dedicada a la comercialización de ropa nueva y cosméticos de la Victoria Secret´s, este negocio lo impulsó hace veintidós años y es primer ciclo que solicita en ADIM el financiamiento para su negocio e invertir en prendas de acero (chapas, anillos, gargantillas, pulseras, cadenas), sandalias para niñas, sandalias bajas, cremas corporales, body, etc., debido a que estos productos son los que mayor demanda tienen, una de sus metas es aumentar la clientela.
texts.en:
Ms. Carmen is an enterprising 42 year-old married woman and a micro-entrepreneur. 

She makes a living selling new clothes and Victoria's Secret cosmetics. She set up her business 22 years ago and this is the first time she applies for an ADIM loan.

She will use this loan to buy steel jewellery (rings, bracelets, necklaces, chokers), sandals for girls, flat sandals, body lotion, etc. since these are the products most widely sold. One of her goals is to increase her customer base.

loans.use: To buy cosmetics and clothing to restock her business

loans.name: Anastacia

texts.es:
La socia Anastacia se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de granos secos como maiz, trigo entre otros, la socia es una mujer emprendedora que quiere sacar adelante a sus hijos, el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender de granos. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar maiz, cebada y trigo.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Our member, Anastacia, has long made a living selling grain products: maize, wheat, etc.  She is an enterprising woman who is working hard to secure a better future for her children.  She hopes to have a store of her own one day where she would sell her grain products.  Anastacia is applying for a loan that she will use to stock her business with supplies of maize, barley, wheat, etc.

Anastacia is grateful for your help and committed to repaying your loan in the agreed-upon time.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her food sales business.

loans.name: Meang's Group

texts.en:
A local farmer living in Kampong Cham province in Cambodia, Meang is 36 years old and a mother of 3 schoolchildren. 

Nowadays, Meang earns income to support her family by growing rice on four hectares of land. In addition, she raises pigs and makes wine to earn extra income. 

In a group of two, Meang is her group leader. This is her third loan cycle with Kiva's partner VisionFund; she has successfully repaid all of her previous loans. 

Meang plans to spend her loan portion on both the fees to harvest her rice and the purchase of more piglets. She hopes that she can earn enough income to buy more land.

loans.use: to pay for the fees to harvest rice and the purchase of more piglets.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel is 35 years and is married to Judy.

Daniel runs a retail shop, a business he has operated for the last three years, earning him a monthly income of KES 49,500.

Daniel has requested his second loan from VisionFund Kenya of KES 30,000 to add to his stock of retail goods. He successfully repaid his previous loan. 

With the anticipated profits, Daniel will be able to repay his loan.

His hopes and dreams for the future are to expand his business further as well as meet his family's needs.

loans.use: to add to his stock of retail goods

loans.name: Noeung's Group

texts.en:
Noeung, 31, lives with family members in a rural village of the Kampong Cham province. She is a mother of two children, one of whom is in school and other one is too young for school. 

Noeung grows cassava and rice as the main source of income. Moreover, she works for others for a fee to supplement her income. She has been involved in this business for ages and she earns about KHR 30,600 per day. 

This is Noeung's second cycle with VisionFund Cambodia (Kiva’s partner) and she successfully repaid her past loan. 

She leads a group of four to get a new loan. As the group leader, Noeung will spend her loan portion to pay for labor fees to grow her cassava. She hopes that she can improve her family's condition.

loans.use: to pay for labor fees to grow her cassava.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Tou's Group

texts.en: A farmer from Moung Russey district of Battambang province, Tou is 31 years old and a mother of two children. To earn a living, she grows rice as the single source of her income. This is the second loan for Tou from VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she has fully repaid her first loan completely. In a group of two, she is the group leader. She will spend her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer and rice seed to support her rice farm. She hopes that she can improve her rice farm to get more yield than before.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and rice seed to support her rice farm.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy iron sheets, windows and metal doors to complete building her rental house.

loans.name: Andrea Marisa

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de compra y venta de ropa, la socia vende pantalones, blusas y chompas, la socia por medio de este negocio quiere sacar adelante a sus hijos, la socia es una mujer emprendedora, el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender la ropa. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar pantalones, blusas y chompas.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Our member has long had a business buying and selling clothing.  She sells pants, blouses and sweaters.  She is an enterprising woman and is working hard to secure a better future for her children.  She would like to have a store one day where she would sell her merchandise.  She is applying for a loan that she will use to stock her business with clothing that she will resell.

Our member is grateful for your help and committed to repaying your loans in the agreed-upon time.

loans.use: to stock her clothing sales business.

loans.name: Min Hla Village Group 1

texts.en:
This community is located in Min Hla Village, Myanmar Ayeyarwaddy Delta region. In this community, five CBO (Community Based Organization) members oversee a group of 26 village customers. This loan will help some group members buy high-quality feed for ducks (costing $30 to feed 100 ducks for six days) and help other members to rebuild the duck farm (costing $40 for hundreds of ducks). Min Hla Village has over 600 villagers and most of the men are farmers. For additional income, some households also plant seasonal foods and raise pigs, ducks and chickens. Some young villagers go to other villages or towns as daily workers. 
Pictured above are the CBO members from Min Hla Village Group 1: U Win, U Tin, U Kyaw, U Kyaw M and U Hla. Included in the picture, U Win (top left)  is 47 years old and divorced. He lives with his four children. two who are working in the city and two who are students. He takes care of his 170 ducks and two pigs. His main income is from ducks. The Proximity Designs loan would enable him to repair the duck farm as well as buy high-quality feed for them.

loans.use: To help the villagers buy ducks and rebuild the duck farm.

loans.name: Zawadi Self Help Group

texts.en:
Miriam, whose hand is raised in the photo, is the leader of Zawadi Self Help Group. She is 46 years old, married and blessed with four children.
She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in 2014 to benefit from training on enterprise development and financial management. This improved her knowledge of business management. She does both dairy farming and tailoring to earn a living. Miriam has been able to advance her business by keeping proper records with prudent financial management. With the improved income from the business, she is able to educate her children and also provide them with enough food and clothing. Miriam is borrowing a Kiva loan to purchase more textile fabric with an aim of keeping up with customers' rising demands. She hopes to make more profit to continue supporting her family. 
Miriam appreciates Kiva for the support and promises to repay the loan promptly.

loans.use: To buy textile fabric to help meet customers' demand.

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma is a married woman with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 46 years old, and one of her children is still in school.

Gemma has a rug making business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more materials for her business.

Gemma has been in this business for ten years. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more materials for her business.

loans.name: Elma

texts.en:
Elma is 31 years old and has three children. She is married and has one child who is currently in school. She is in the agricultural business, farming banana in the Philippines. Elma has requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

She has been farming banana for eight years now, and has borrowed seven times in the past from NWTF to sustain it. Elma would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Elma

texts.en:
Elma is 43 years old and married with five children. Three children currently attend school.  Elma works very hard to provide for them.

Elma runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13000 loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell in her general store.

Elma has been in this business for 15 years and sells a variety of items such as soft-drinks, noodles, shampoo, sanitary pads, snack foods, etc. 

In the future, Elma would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa, age 31, is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur who has two children who attend school.

Elsa has a fishing business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 12500 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional materials for her fishing business.

Elsa has been in this business for five years. In the future, Elsa would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials for her fishing business.

loans.name: Gayane

texts.en:
Gayane is a teacher by profession working in Artik town’s secondary school. Besides her work in the school, Gayane runs her own business, which is a grocery store. Her husband greatly helps her with running the store successfully.

Gayane has had this business for two years, and it is the income source with which she has been able to support her family. To be able to enlarge the assortment of goods she sells to attract more customers to her convenience store, Gayane has applied for this loan. She asks lenders to support her loan to be funded, ensuring responsible payments.

loans.use: to enlarge the assortment of goods to attract more customers to her convenience store.

loans.name: Svetlana

texts.en:
Svetlana, her husband and son are involved in a manufacturing business. They make furniture in the small garage near their house and due to the high quality work they provide, customers’ demand increases gradually. To be able to enlarge their production and meet clients’ demand, Svetlana asks for this loan to purchase materials for making furniture. 

Svetlana has taken a loan from a local financial institution before, but unfortunately wasn't able to return it back. However, thanks to the hard work during recent times, she was able to run her manufacturing business in a sustainable way, ensuring that she will be able to cover the monthly payments. So, she has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The second-chance loan program provides loans to people who have a bad credit history and have no access to credit products. Svetlana and her family will be thankful to all the lenders for helping them to maintain their business.

loans.use: to purchase materials for making furniture.

loans.name: Anna

texts.en:
Anna has been involved in pig breeding for many years. She currently owns 10 mother pigs and 45 piglets. Anna’s family consists of her husband, parents-in-law, and two children. Her family members help her in running the farm, as agriculture is the only source of their income. 

To be able to feed pigs during the winter season, Anna needs financial support. She has applied for this loan of USD 3,000 and asks for lenders' support with her pig-breeding business. She plans to purchase special forage for pigs and piglets, and highly relies on lenders’ goodwill.

loans.use: to purchase special forage for pigs and piglets.

loans.name: Mary-An

texts.en:
Mary-an works hard to support her family. She is married and has a general store business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 19,500 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

Mary-an has been in this business for five years now. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma works hard to support her family. She is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Emma requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell. She has been in this business for 30 years.

Emma would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy groceries to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Emma is 45 years old and has one child who is currently in school.

Emma has a general store business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 29000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional stocks to sell in her store.

Emma has been in this business for 10 years. She would like to expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase stocks to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Bibigul

texts.ru: На фотографии запечатлена Бибигул. Ей 63 года. Она проживает вместе с семьей в городке Куляб в Хатлонской области. У нее большая семья, состоящая из ее любимого мужа, двое сыновей, невестки и двое внуков. Сыновьям 28 и 23 года. Они занимаются ремонтом домов. Невестка домохозяйка, она следит за порядком дома и за детьми. Сама Бибигул работает уборщицей, также дома занимается выращиванием крупнорогатого скота. Она хочет расширить животноводческую деятельность, путем увеличения поголовья скота. Для совершения данной операции ей необходимо определенная сумма денег. Так как у нее не хватает денег, она обратилась за кредитом. Так же на оставшуюся часть денег она потратить на покупки стройматериалов, чтобы отремонтировать дом.
texts.en: The woman in this photograph is Bibigul. She is 63 years old. She lives with her family in the small town of Kulob in the Khatlon District. She has a large family consisting of her beloved husband, two sons, daughter-in-law and two grandchildren. Her sons are 28 and 23 years old. They work in the field of home repair. Her daughter-in-law is a homemaker; she looks after the children and keeps the house in order. Bibigul works as a janitor and also raises cattle. She wants to expand her livestock breeding business by increasing the size of her herd. To fulfill this goal, she does not have the necessary amount of money. As she does not have enough money, she applied for a loan. With the remainder of the loan, she will spend it on construction materials to repair her house.

loans.use: to buy a cow and construction materials.

loans.name: Margot Bonifacia

texts.es:
La socia Margot Bonifacia se sigue dedicando al negocio de tienda de abarrotes y restaurant, la socia vende productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azucar, leche y galletas, la socia por medio de est negocio quiere salir adelnate,la socia es una mujer emprendedora y trabajadora, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de tienda de abarrotes. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar arroz, azucar, leche y galletas.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Our member, Margot Bonifacia, has long owned a restaurant and grocery.  She sells merchandise that her customers need from day to day: rice, sugar, milk, snacks, etc. She is a hard-working, enterprising woman and the business is her means of making her way in the world.  For the future, she hopes to expand the grocery.  Margot Bonifacia is applying for a loan that she will use to stock her grocery.

Margot Bonifacia is grateful for your help and committed to repaying your loans in the agreed-upon time.

loans.use: to stock her corner grocery.

loans.name: Barbara Hilda

texts.es:
La socia Barbara Hilda se sigue dedicando al negocio de tienda de abarrotes y restaurant, la socia vende productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azucar, leche y galletas, la socia por medio de est negocio quiere salir adelante, la socia es una mujer emprendedora y trabajadora, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de tienda de abarrotes. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar arroz, azucar, leche y galletas,

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Our member, Barbara Hilda, has long had a restaurant and grocery business.  She sells merchandise that her customers need from day to day: rice, sugar, milk, snacks, etc.  She is a hard-working, enterprising woman and the business is her means of making her way in the world.  For the future, she hopes to expand her grocery.  Barbara is applying for a loan that she will use to stock her grocery business.

Barbara is grateful for your help and committed to repaying your loans in the agreed-upon time.

loans.use: to stock her corner grocery.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is a married woman with six children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.  Erlinda is 44 years old and has two children who attend school.

Erlinda has a fish and shells vending business in the Philippines.  She requested a PHP 20000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more fish and shells to sell to her customers.

Erlinda has been in this business for 20 years. In the future, Erlinda would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more fish and shells to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is a married woman with nine children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Erlinda is 51 years old and has three children who attend school.

Erlinda has a fishing business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 18000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional tools to maintain her fishing boat.

Erlinda has been in this business for 30 years. In the future, Erlinda would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy tools to maintain her fishing boat.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 41 years old and married with five children. With two children currently in school, Elizabeth works very hard to provide for them.

Elizabeth runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13000 loan through NWTF to buy additional groceries to sell in her general store.

Elizabeth has been in this business for two years and sells a variety of items such as detergent soap, milk, juice, noodles, eggs, bread, shampoo, hair conditioners, etc. 

In the future, Elizabeth would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional groceries to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Florida

texts.en:
Florida is 46 years old and has seven children. She is married and has two children who attend school.

Florida has a pig fattening business in the Philippines. Florida requested a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Florida has been in pig fattening for five years, and has borrowed seven times in the past from NWTF to help sustain it.

In the future, Florida would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Inelen

texts.en:
Inelen is 30 years old and married with three children who are currently in school. Inelen works very hard to provide for them.

Inelen runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional groceries like canned goods, soft-drinks, sugar, coffee, detergent soap, beers, etc. to sell.

Inelen has been in this business for 2 years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, soft drinks, sugar, coffee, detergent soap, beers, etc. 

In the future, Inelen would like to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional groceries like canned goods, soft drinks, sugar, coffee, detergent soap, beers, etc. to sell

loans.name: Isabel

texts.en:
Isabel is 59 years old and married with six children. 

Isabel is in the agricultural business, farming corn in the Philippines. Isabel requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Isabel has been farming corn for 4 years now, and has borrowed from NWTF 7 times in the past sustain it.

In the future, Isabel would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Jeralyn

texts.en:
Jeralyn works hard to support her family. Jeralyn is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines. Jeralyn has been in this business for 5 years now.

Jeralyn requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy an additional fishing net for her business.

Jeralyn would like to build and expand her business in order to secure her family's future.

loans.use: to buy an additional fishing net for her business

loans.name: Estela

texts.en:
Estela is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Estela is 52 years old and has two children who attend school.

Estela has a fishing business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 18000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional materials like a fishing net, etc. for her business.

Estela has been in this business for 30 years. In the future, Estela would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase materials like a fishing net, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Geghecik

texts.en:
Geghecik is an experienced agronomist from Lori region. She lives with her husband and they work hard to be able to earn a living. It has been more than 15 years since Geghecik became engaged in cattle breeding, in aviculture, in breeding a livestock of cows, and in cultivation of several vegetables (wheat, potatoes.)

With the help of her husband, she realizes the agricultural products in the local market, which is a very important source of their income. To continue running her agribusiness in a sustainable way, Geghecik needs a loan of USD 2,000 to purchase 10 piglets and potatoes needed for the farm. She has already taken a loan from a local financial institution before, but unfortunately wasn't able to return it back. However, thanks to the hard work during the recent times, Geghecik was able to run her agribusiness in a sustainable way, ensuring that she will be able to cover the monthly payments. So, she has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The second-chance loan program provides loans to people who have a bad credit history and have no access to credit products. Geghecik and her family will be thankful to all the lenders for helping them to maintain their agribusiness.

loans.use: to purchase 10 piglets and potatoes needed for her farm.

loans.name: Melinda

texts.en:
Melinda is 60 years old and married with four children. With one child still in school, Melinda works very hard to provide for them. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell in her general store.

Melinda has been in this business for four years and sells a variety of items such as snack foods, coffee, noodles, eggs, sanitary pads, cereals, cooking oil, etc. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Paz

texts.en:
Paz is a 40-year-old, married woman with two children who are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.  Paz has a general store business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 20,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional stock to sell in her general store.

Paz has been in this business for 20 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional stock to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en:
Ibrahim is 28 years old and single. He is from Rafah and works as an employee in a local firm where he earns a low income. Ibrahim wants to improve his living conditions and find an extra job so he decided to buy a rickshaw to transfer goods on it.

Ibrahim requested a loan from FATEN, which he will use to buy a rickshaw. With this loan, he will be able to increase his income and improve his living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase a rickshaw

loans.name: Mohirakhon

texts.en:
Mohirakhon is a kind woman and she lives in her own house with her family. 

She makes clothes for a living and she works from home. She makes a variety of different items of clothing and sells them at very affordable prices. Her work is of a good quality, which is why many people come to her. She has worked in this field for six years and has a lot of experience as well as loyal customers who keep coming back to her. 

Mohirakhon has decided to request a loan from CSC MDO "IMON International" in order to invest in her small business and buy a new sewing machine to make clothing and to generate more income.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine to make clothing.

loans.name: Fotima

texts.en: Fotima is 26 years old and is a student at Tajikistan State University of Politics and Business. She studies law and is a good student. Fotima is a repeat client of IMON and has a good credit history. She is asking for a loan to pay for her tuition. She awaits your support and in advance thanks you.

loans.use: To pay for tuition

loans.name: Amelita

texts.en: Amelita is a 52-year-old married mother of two children from Isabel, Leyte.  She runs a small sari-sari (variety) store business selling various goods and items to the people in her community. Amelita has been in the business for more than four years now. Amelita is requesting a loan to buy more stock to sell like canned goods, noodles, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries, condiments, biscuits and snack foods.  This loan will help her improve her stock, thus allowing her to sell more  to her customers. In the future, Amelita hopes of making her business a success.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell like canned goods, noodles, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries, condiments, biscuits and snack foods

loans.name: Lutfiniso

texts.en: Lutfiniso was born in 1973, is married and is the mother of a son. Her husband is a master of repairing houses. Lutfiniso sews a variety of women clothes. Lutfiniso has been busy with this business more than seven years. She is very hard-working woman. Now, she is ill and she must treat herself but she lacks money to buy medicine. She is asking for a loan of 2000 TJS to buy medicine. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy medicine to treat herself

loans.name: Nan

texts.en:
Nan, who is 30 years old, is residing in Kampong Cham Province of Cambodia. She has two children who are currently in school. To make a living and support her family, she manages and operates a farming business in a small rice farmland, which is located in her community. So far, she has been in this type of business for six years. 

Currently, she would like to request a Kiva loan via HKL to buy a motorbike. This loan will allow her to have a personal vehicle, so that she can experience a convenient way of travelling. She would like to thank all lenders for the financial support. She is awaiting your kindness.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike.

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en:
Corazon is a 54 year old married woman and a mother of four grown up children from Isabel, Leyte.

Corazon has been engaged in the hog raising business for more than 20 years now. She wants to expand her business but she lacks the capital for it.

Corazon would like to take a loan to buy more piglets to raise and animal feed. A loan is what Corazon needs in order to improve her hog raising business.

In the future, Corazon dreams of improving her livelihood.

loans.use: to buy animal feed and more piglets to raise.

loans.name: Clarita

texts.en: Clarita is a 59-year-old married mother of three children from Isabel, Leyte.  She is engaged in pig raising. Clarita has raised pigs for more than two years now. She earns additional income through her small Internet café service. Clarita is asking for a loan to buy more piglets to raise and a new computer. This loan will help her improve her businesses, thus augmenting her income and profit. Clarita hopes of making her business more sustainable and productive.

loans.use: to buy more piglets to raise and a new computer

loans.name: Joseline Patricia

texts.es:
Joseline, utilizo el financiamiento anterior en mercadería nueva y variada para mantener un negocio estable, entre sus cambios positivos menciona que está más avanzada en sus estudios y tiene estabilidad económica.
Se ha decidido por un nuevo préstamo para comprar enchape, cosméticos, ropa nueva y usada, mejorara el inventario de su negocio para cubrir las nuevas demandas de sus clientes, aspira a seguir trabajando para tener buenos resultados como con el crédito anterior.
texts.en:
Joseline used the previous loan to buy new and varied goods to keep her business stable. Among the positive changes, she mentions that she is moving forward with her studies and that she has economic stability.

She decided to request a new loan to buy jewellery, cosmetics, new and used clothing to restock her business and thus meet her customers' new demands.

She wants to keep working to obtain good results like she did with the previous loan.

loans.use: to buy jewellery, cosmetics, new and used clothing to restock her business and thus meet her customers' new demands.

loans.name: Maria Francisca

texts.es:
María, de 44 años de edad, no estudio porque sus padres vivían en extrema pobreza, está casada y junto con su esposo tiene 3 hijos de 23, 21 y 15 años de edad.

Su esposo y sus tres hijos se dedican a la agricultura, mientras que María, se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras, a la crianza de pollos y a la siembra de hortalizas desde hace muchos años, dicho trabajo lo aprendió de su madre, quien siempre se dedico a este tipo de negocio.

Para llegar a su trabajo María, viaja en bus 6 kilómetros, trabaja en el horario de 5:00 a.m. a 4:00 p.m. todos los días.

El préstamo que está solicitando en la institución, es para comprar frutas, verduras y pollos de engorde, así mejorará su negocio y podrá obtener un poco más de ingresos, para darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.

El sueño de María, es comprar un medio de transporte para ya no viajar en bus hacia su negocio y que sus hijos sigan estudiando para que puedan sacar una carrera universitaria.
texts.en:
Maria, who is 44 years old, did not go to school because her parents lived in extreme poverty. She is married, and with her husband, she has 3 children, who are 23, 21, and 15 years old. Her husband and three children work in agriculture, while Maria’s occupation is the sale of fruits and vegetables, breeding chickens, and planting leafy vegetables. Many years ago, she learned this work from her mother, who always worked in this type of business. 
To get to work, Maria travels 6 kilometers by bus, she works from 5:00 a.m. until 4:00 p.m. every day.
The loan she is asking from this institution is to buy fruits, vegetables, and chickens for fattening. This way she will improve her business and will obtain a bit more income, to give her family a better quality of life. 
Maria’s dream is to buy a vehicle so she doesn’t have to travel by bus to her business, and that her children keep studying, so they can have a university degree.

loans.use: to buy fruits, vegetables, and chickens for fattening.

loans.name: Carmelina

texts.en:
Carmelina works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

Carmelina requested a PHP 18000 loan through NWTF to purchase materials for her fishing business.  She has been in this business for 30 years.

In the future, Carmelina would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase materials for her fishing business.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine, a member of NWTF, supports her family through her business raising livestock in the Philippines. Her sister Maeclare is 18 years old and is the youngest of the seven children in their family. 

Maeclare is studying for a Bachelor of Science degree in Elementary Education and is currently in her first year of this four-year program. Maeclare plans to graduate and help her family in the future.

Josephine is borrowing PHP 13,000 to pay her sister Maecalre's tuition fees for the second semester of the 2014-15 school year.

loans.use: to pay her sister's tuition fees

loans.name: Pedjilyn

texts.en:
Pedjilyn is 25 years old, married, and has two children who are in school. She is in the agricultural business of pig fattening in the Philippines. Pedjilyn has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase piglets, vaccines and vitamins for her business.

Pedjilyn has been in pig fattening for five years now, and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain it. In the future, Pedjilyn would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase piglets, vaccines and vitamins for her business.

loans.name: Ruby Ann

texts.en:
Ruby Ann is 24 years old, married, and has 2 children. With one child currently in school, Ruby Ann works very hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 3 years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, eggs, noodles, bath soap, detergent soap, rice, etc. 

Ruby Ann has requested a 15,000 PHP loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation in order to buy more items to sell in her general store.

Ruby Ann would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Gloria Del Carmen

texts.es:
Gloria, está decidida a continuar ampliando su negocio pero necesita capital para poder hacerlo, esto hace que solicite un nuevo préstamo para comprar granos básicos, aceite, detergentes, pan, etc., tendrá los recursos económicos necesarios para tener un inventario más surtido.
El préstamo anterior ha sido de mucha ayuda para Gloria, actualmente el número de clientes que visitan su tienda es mayor, los ingresos son mejores y su grupo familiar tiene condiciones de vida más dignas.
texts.en:
Gloria is determined to continue expanding her business but needs capital to do it. This has led her to request  a new loan in order to buy basic grains, cooking oil, detergents, bread, etc. She will have the necessary financial resources to have a better stocked inventory. 

The previous loan has been a big help to Gloria, and currently the number of customers who visit her store is greater. Revenues are better and her family has more adequate living conditions.

loans.use: To buy basic grains, cooking oil, detergents, bread, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Moisés Arturo

texts.es:
Moisés, de 36 años de edad, estudió hasta bachillerato, está casado y tiene cuatro hijos.-  Moisés, creció con sus padres, quienes le enseñaron a trabajar en la agricultura y la ganadería.

Moisés, se levanta a las 4:00 a.m. junto a su esposa, para realizar las actividades agrícolas.- El alquila terrenos para poder sembrar; además, realiza viajes en su viejo vehículo, para ganar ingresos adicionales; Moisés, también tiene más de 10 años de dedicarse a la albañilería, pero esta actividad, por el momento solo la realiza ocasionalmente.

Moisés, necesita el préstamo para comprar repuestos y poder arreglar el vehículo con el cual trabaja, ya que por el momento lo tiene dañado y es una de las principales herramientas para realizar sus actividades diarias. 

Moisés, sueña con comprar vacas para iniciar el negocio de venta de leche, ya que desde hace tiempo desea realizar.
texts.en:
Moisés, 36, studied through high school. He is married and has four children. Moisés was raised by his parents who taught him agriculture and to raise livestock. 

Moisés gets up at 4 am with his wife to perform agricultural tasks. They rent the land they plant. He also makes trips in his old vehicle to earn additional income. Moisés has been a mason for more than 10 years too but he only does this activity occasionally. 

Moisés needs a loan to buy spare parts and fix the vehicle he uses for work. It has been damaged and it is one of his main tools to perform his daily work.

Moisés dreams of buying cows to start the business of selling milk. He has wanted this for a long time.

loans.use: to purchase parts to repair the vehicle he uses on the farm

loans.name: Ketevan

texts.en: Ketevan is 36 years old and lives in Zugdidi district with her husband and 15-year-old son. Ketevan sells used clothes from home. Ketevan and her husband own a commercial space where they are going to open a food market. The start-up program, which is a joint initiative of Kiva and Credo, enables her to get a loan of 6,500 GEL to open a food market. She already has purchased refrigerators and some equipment and with the received credit she will purchase food stock. Ketevan will be a sales lady in her market. Ketevan is very hard-working woman and very motivated to generate a stable income. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to open a food market

loans.name: Oun's Group

texts.en:
A mother of 5 dependent children living in Kampong Cham province in Cambodia, Oun is 47 years old. 

To make her living, Oun grows rice as her main source of income. However, she also earns extra income by making and selling Khmer cake, which is a cake made with rice cooked in bamboo tubes.  

This is her first loan with Kiva's field partner VisionFund. In a group of 3, Oun is the group leader. She will spend her loan portion on both farm labor fees and bamboo for making her Khmer cakes. 

Oun hopes that she can earn more income so she can improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to pay the cost of farm labor and buy more bamboo for making Khmer cake.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Kang Meas District

loans.name: Eng's Group

texts.en: Eng is a local resident living in Moung Russey district of Battambang province. She is 57 years old and a mother of seven children. She earns income to support her family by rice cropping. She has been involved this business for ages and earns about 28,900 KHR per day. For Eng, this is her sixth loan from VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She has fully repaid her past loans to improve her living conditions gradually. She leads a group of two to get this new loan. As the group leader, she will spend her loan portion to buy fertilizer and rice seed to support her rice farm. She hopes that she can earn more income to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and rice seed to support her rice farm.

loans.name: Amada

texts.es: AMADA: Es una joven  alegre y luchadora, miskita, originaria de Waspam,  tiene 35 años de edad, es casada con tres hijos: Dos adolescentes que estudian su primaria y un pequeño de dos años de edad. Es una pequeña microempresaria que desde hace 11 años estableció una pequeña tienda de ropa, calzado y venta de verduras, frutas y bastimentos en un tramo en el mercado municipal. Está solicitando financiamiento para incrementar su mercadería de ropa y calzado que comprará en Managua y Masaya; esto le permitirá vender a precios favorable a sus clientela en Waspam y también incrementar sus ingresos. Su sueño es llegar a tener un negocio grande y próspero.
texts.en: Amada: a lively and hardworking woman from the Miskito ethnic group. She is originally from Waspam. She is a young 35-year-old. She is married with three children. Two are adolescents studying in primary school and one is a little two-year-old boy. She has had a small business for 11 years. She established a small store selling clothing, footwear, fruits, vegetables, and general supplies in a section of the municipal market. She is requesting a loan to increase her stock of clothing and footwear. She will buy them in Managua and Masaya which will allow her to sell them at favorable prices to her customers in Waspam and increase revenue. Her dream is to have a large and prosperous business.

loans.use: to purchase clothing and footwear in the capital city to sell locally at better prices

loans.name: Bunpav

texts.en:
Bunpav is a 23-year-old student from Tbong Khmum Province, Cambodia. His parents own a rubber tree plantation in the province. Currently, he is in his fourth year studying medicine at a university in the city. 

Because Bunpav is short of finances to pay the 4 years of university fees, he has decided to take a loan. With this loan, he will successfully earn his bachelor’s degree with skills for his future. 

After graduation, Bunpav wishes to run a clinic at his house.

loans.use: to pay his university fees.

loans.name: Gs. Estrellas Brillantes  1 Group

texts.en:
Ramon a member of the Estrellas Brillantes "Brilliant stars" one group. He runs a butcher shop. 

The area in which the borrowers live is a rural, surrounded by mountains and rivers.  Ramon lives alone as a single man.  His fellow borrowers recommended him as a hard working man; and they all live in the beautiful town of El Seibo. He says his most important challenge has been to develop his business.

Ramon is receiving her fifth loan with Esperanza International Dominican Republic, having repaid all her previous loans. After almost four years of investments, Esperanza's business is growing and he is serving more people. 

Ramon will use this loan to purchase beef, pork and chicken to sell them in his butcher shop to customer. Neighbors in his community always buy all the meat they need to Ramon. He always reinvests his profits in his business and provide for his family. Ramon thanks you all for your support!

loans.use: to buy meat like chicken, beef and pork to sell.

loans.name: Ith

texts.en:
Ith, 49, is a married woman from Kampong Cham Province. She has three children in total, one is single and lives under her support while the other two are married and live independently. To make a living, she manages and operates a farming business, growing rice and selling the crops to the local dealers. So far, she has been involved in this career for 30 years. She is able to make an income of USD 2.00 per day, on average.  

Recently, some parts of her house have deteriorated and they need to be fixed to provide a suitable living for the household. Due to the lack of funds, she has applied for a Kiva loan via HKL to pay for her house renovation. She and her family will be thankful to the lenders for helping them with the loan funded to improve their living standard.

loans.use: to pay for her house renovation

loans.name: Luzminda

texts.en:
Luzminda is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Luzminda is 42 years old and has two children who are currently in school.

Luzminda has a fishing business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional materials and gears for her business.

Luzminda has been in this business for 6 years. In the future, Luzminda would like to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials and gears for her business

loans.name: Teodora

texts.en:
Teodora is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Teodora is 42 years old and has two children who attend school.

Teodora has a food vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 13000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Teodora has been in this business for five years. In the future, Teodora would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is 46 years old and married. She works very hard to provide for her family.

Teresita runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 14000 loan through NWTF to purchase snack foods, bread, coffee, sugar, cereals, juice, soft-drinks, etc. to sell.  Teresita has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items to customers. 

Teresita would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more items like snack foods, bread, coffee, sugar, cereals, juice, soft-drinks, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Jose Raul

texts.es:
José, es propietario de un molino nixtamal, es casado, vive con su esposa de 50 años de edad, y sus hijos de 35 y 15 años de edad, todos los miembros de su familia trabajan en el negocio, tiene más de 20 años de ofrecer sus servicios a los vecinos de su colonia, hasta la fecha no representa ninguna dificultad familiar ni en su negocio.
Le será de mucha ayuda el financiamiento para comprar discos, grasa, fajas y tolvas nuevas, mantendrá en buenas condiciones el molino nixtamal para continuar trabajando, espera brindar una buena atención a sus clientes y mejorar su situación económica.
Su visión es mantener su negocio siempre en actividad para generar ingresos y cubrir las necesidades familiares.
texts.en:
José is the proprietor of a nixtamal [corn] mill. He is married and lives with his wife, age 50, and his children, ages 35 and 15. All the members of the family work in the business. They have offered their services to the neighbors in their town for more than 20 years. Up to now, they have not been faced with any difficulties in the family or in their business.

Financing will be a great help to him so that he can buy discs, grease, belts, and a new chute. He will maintain the nixtamal mill in good condition in order to continue working. He hopes to offer good service to his customers and to improve his economic situation.

His vision is to always keep his business running in order to generate income and cover the family necessities.

loans.use: to buy disks, grease, belts, and a new chute to keep his nixtamal mill in good condition and continue working

loans.name: Maria Jessica

texts.en:
Maria Jessica is a widowed woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 44 years old and has two children who are currently in school.

Maria Jessica has a food vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients like spices, noodles, fish, meat, etc. for her food production business.

Maria Jessica has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like spices, noodles, fish, meat, etc. for her food production business.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia is 51 years old and married with two children. 

Lydia is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Lydia requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional piglets, feeds and vitamins for her business.

Lydia has been in pig fattening for 5 years now, and has borrowed 3 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

Lydia would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional piglets, feeds and vitamins for her business

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es:
Ana, de 57 años de edad, estudió hasta segundo grado, debido a que la escuela estaba muy lejos de su casa, está casada, su esposo trabaja como comerciante, es madre de ocho hijos, pero solo tres viven con ella, los demás ya tienen sus propias familias.

Ana, se dedica al destazo de cerdos, negocio que realiza desde que tenia 23 años de edad, decidio realizar éste tipo de trabajo, para apoyar economicamente a su familia a salir adelante.

Anteriormente, tenia una panadería, pero tuvo que cerrarla porque no generaba ganancia.- El negocio de destazo lo realiza en su casa, con ayuda de su esposo y sus hijos, desde las 4:00 A.M. hasta las 11:00 A.M.

Ana, está solicitando el crédito a Credicampo, para comprar dos vacas.

Ana, sueña con poder remodelar su casa y poder darles a sus hijos la ayuda que necesiten para culminar una carrera universitaria para que sean profecionales de éxito.
texts.en:
Ana, 57, studied until second grade, because the school was very far from her house.  She is married, and her husband works as a merchant.  She is the mother of eight children, but only three of them live with her—the rest already have families of their own. 

Ana butchers pigs, a business that she has carried out since she was 23 years old.  She decided to do this type of work in order to help her family get ahead economically.

She had a bakery before, but she had to close it because it wasn’t making a profit.  She runs her butcher business at her house, with the help of her husband and children, working from 4:00 A.M. until 11:00 A.M.

Ana is requesting the loan from CrediCampo in order to purchase two cows.

Ana dreams of being able to remodel her house and of being able to give her children the help that they need to complete a university degree, so that they may be successful professionals.

loans.use: to purchase two cows.

loans.name: Charita

texts.en: Charita is a 54-year-old married mother of three children from Isabel, Leyte. She makes a living by raising pigs. Her husband works as a carpenter. Charita has raised pigs for several years now. Charita is requesting a loan to buy more piglets to raise and animal feed. This loan will enable Charita to improve her piggery, thus augmenting her income and profit. In the future, Charita hopes of making her business more sustainable and productive.

loans.use: to buy more piglets to raise and animal feed

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en:
Cristina is a 32-year-old married woman from Isabel, Leyte. She used to operate a sari-sari, or convenience, store but decided to stop after her store was ruined by the typhoon more than a year ago. 

Cristina now wants to open it again and this is why she decided to take a loan.  Cristina wants to buy more stock to sell like canned goods, rice, noodles, bread and biscuits, soap and toiletries, condiments and others things.  

Cristina will be able to improve her store’s inventory through the help of this loan, thus allowing her to attract more buyers. In the future, Cristina dreams of making her business more sustainable and productive.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell like canned goods, rice, noodles, bread and biscuits, soap and toiletries, and condiments.

loans.name: Vuthy

texts.en: Vuthy is a 19-year-old university student from Kampot province in Cambodia. He studies mathematics in the first year at university in a city. His parents are rice farmers. Because Vuthy doesn’t have enough finances to pay his tuition fees for four years so he has decided to request a loan. This loan will help him graduate successfully and get skills for his future job. For his future dream, he wants to be a mathematics lecturer.

loans.use: to pay his tuition fees

loans.name: Marath

texts.en: Marath is a 20-year-old student who is studying medicine in the first year at a university in a city. She is from Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. Her father is a doctor and her mother is a grocer. Because she doesn’t have enough money to pay her tuition fees for four years, Marath would like to request a loan. This loan will help her graduate and provide her with skills for her future job. After graduation, she is going to run a clinic and then save money to build a house.

loans.use: to pay her tuition fees

loans.name: San

texts.en:
San is a 49-year-old woman who lives in a remote area of Prey Veng province in Cambodia. She is a lovely mother of three children who are currently in school.

To earn a living, she manages and operates a farming business on rice farm land which is located near her house. So far, she has been involved in this business for twenty years. On average, she is able to earn USD $2.00 per day.

San wants to gain access to household energy at a reduced monthly rate by purchasing a solar energy home system. Since she has inadequate capital for this, she has requested a Kiva loan through its partner, HKL. After this initial investment, she hopes to have clean energy to power her household lights, TV and radio.

San is very happy and thankful because, with this loan, HKL has provided her with a special interest rate lower than its typical loan rates. She awaits your kindness and relies on your generosity.

loans.use: to pay for a solar home energy system

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is 61 years old, married to Kevin and together they have been blessed with three children. Florence supports six people in her family.

Florence sells second-hand clothes, a business she has run for the last 20 years earning a monthly income of KES 15,000.

Florence has requested her second loan from VisionFund Kenya of KES 30,000 to buy more bales of second-hand clothes. Florence successfully repaid her previous loan.

With the anticipated profits, Florence will be able to increase her stock.

Her dream for the future is to continually expand her business with new stock.

loans.use: to buy bales of second-hand clothes

loans.name: Saklin

texts.en:
Saklin, 20 year old, lives in a rural area of Kampong Chan Province, Cambodia. He has one little child. 

To make a living and support his family, Saklin manages and operated a farming business and primarily grows rice.  He sells his agricultural product to local dealers and customer at the market. Saklin has been in business for four years. On average, Saklin is able to make $2.00 a day. 

Currently, Saklin requests a KIVA loan via HKL to buy a motorbike. This loan will allow him to have a personal vehicle for traveling. 

Saklin is thankful to all lenders for the financial support. He is awaiting your kindness.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike.

loans.name: Maria Yessenia

texts.es: María tiene 37 años de e edad y es una mujer ejemplar quien se caracteriza por ser muy trabajadora y responsable. María se gana la vida por medio de un pequeña tienda que con mucho esfuerzo ha logrado establecer en su hogar de habitación. Además, se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza por catalogo desde hace mucho tiempo. De esta forma es como lleva el sustento  a su hogar y junto a su esposo mantienen la economía del hogar. Con el deseo de mejorar sus ventas e ingresos ha tomado la decisión de solicitar este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de variedad de productos de tienda y productos de belleza (cereales, detergente, aceite, golosinas, lociones, maquillaje, cremas, etc.)
texts.en: Maria is 37 years old, and she is an exemplary woman who is characterized by being very hard-working and responsible. Maria makes a living with a small shop which, with a lot of effort, she has managed to establish in her home. Also, she has worked in the sale of beauty products by catalog for a long time. This is the way in which she brings sustenance to her home, and together with her husband, they support their home economy. With the desire to improve her sales and income, she has made the decision to ask for this loan to FUSAI, to invest in the purchase of a variety of grocery store items and beauty products (cereals, detergents, oil, candy, lotions, makeup, creams, etc.)

loans.use: to buy: grocery store items and beauty products (cereals, detergents, oil, candy, lotions, makeup, creams, etc.) to put on sale.

loans.name: Ana Griselda

texts.es: Ana tiene 45 años de edad y se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza por catalogo y a la venta de comida. Ana es una mujer visionaria quien desde hace mucho tiempo se dedica a sus negocios y es como apoya en la economía de su hogar. Ana desea mejorar sus condiciones de vida por lo que ha tomado la decisión de solicitar este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en  sus negocios. Con el monto solicitado comprará: variedad de productos de belleza y los insumos necesarios para preparar los ricos platillos que tanto gustan a sus clientes. Espera poder contar con este apoyo y así poder mejorar sus ventas y sus ingresos y de esta forma mejorar sus condiciones de vida y las de su familia.
texts.en: Ana is 45 years old and sells beauty products by catalog and also sells food. Ana is a visionary woman who has had her business for quite a while and they are how she supports her home. Ana wishes to improve her living conditions so she has made the decision to seek a loan from FUSAI to invest in her businesses. With the loan she will buy a variety of beauty products and ingredients necessary to prepare delicious dishes that her clients like. She hopes to be able to count on this support and in this way be able to improve her sales and income, and in this way improve her living conditions and those of her family.

loans.use: to buy a variety of beauty products (creams, lotions, makeup) and ingredients for the food that she sells (vegetables, meat, fruits, etc.)

loans.name: Duncan

texts.en:
Duncan is 25 years old. He is married to Rose. 

Duncan for the last 2 years has been running a money transfer business commonly referred to as "M-pesa", earning a monthly income of Kshs. 68,000.

Duncan has requested for his first loan with VisionFund Kenya for Kshs. 20,000, which he will use to add M-pesa float.

With the anticipated profits, Duncan will be able to plough back into his business to increase income.

His hopes and dreams for the future are to continually expand his business with additional float and expand to other new areas.

loans.use: to add M-pesa float

loans.name: Tabitha

texts.en: Hello lenders, meet Tabitha. She is a 62-year-old smallholder farmer based in Kerugoya, which is a small rural town in central Kenya. Tabitha and her husband are blessed to have a beautiful family. Tabitha has been a mixed-farmer for more than four years. She keeps poultry for eggs and grows maize and vegetables for sale. She also holds a day job and engages in small businesses on the side whenever an opportunity crosses her path. Despite the rapid fluctuation of prices in the market, Tabitha is very passionate and optimistic about the future of horticultural farming in Kenya. Tabitha is seeking a loan to expand her horticultural farm. This move is quite a big deal for her. With your loan, Tabitha seeks to continue growing different varieties of crops but on a greater scale. The demand for vegetables and other greens in Kerugoya and other parts of the country is very high. Income from this venture will negate the high farming expenses she has to deal with currently. In the long run, with increased income, she will finally be able to satisfy her family’s basic needs. She stated, “In the future, I will be able to provide food for my family and also educate my siblings and large family.”

loans.use: To grow her horticulture business

loans.name: Marta Damaris

texts.es:
Marta, vive con su familia, ella trabaja de manera independiente desde hace 4 años en la crianza de cerdos, lo aprendió de sus padres, no tiene un horario establecido, tiene mucha experiencia por lo que su negocio está creciendo poco a poco.
Comprará cerdos y concentrado para alimentarlos, aumentará su porqueriza y luego podrá   venderlos a un mejor precio y obtener ganancias útiles para cumplir con sus obligaciones.
Marta sueña con hacerle mejoras a su vivienda, ampliar su negocio y tener recursos económicos para darles a sus hijos la oportunidad de estudiar una carrera universitaria.
texts.en:
Marta, who lives with her family, has worked independently for 4 years, raising pigs. She learnt it from her parents. She doesn't have a steady schedule, but she has a lot of experience, so her business is growing slowly.

She'll buy pigs and concentrated food to feed them. She'll increase the size of her pigpen, and she'll be able to sell them at a better price to make a profit so she can fulfill her obligations.

Marta dreams of improving her home, expanding her business, and having the necessary financial resources to give her children the opportunity to go to college.

loans.use: to buy pigs and concentrated food to feed them. She'll increase the size of her pigpen and then she'll sell them at a better price.

loans.name: Mangale

texts.en:
Mangale is a married man who owns a  house that neither has electricity nor piped water. His main monthly expense is household consumables
He has operated a retail shop business for the past six years, selling goat meat to the community. He faces a major challenge of competition and diseases in his business
With the loan of 50,000 KES he is requesting, he wants to purchase more goats for resale. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: to purchase more goats for resale

loans.name: L'avenir Group

texts.fr:
Madame AÏSSATA est la représentante du groupe L'AVENIR. Mariée, elle est mère de 04 enfants. Le plus âgé a 14 ans et le moins âgé a 01an11mois. 03 vont à l’école. Elle a 09 personnes en charge. 
Madame est coiffeuse et vend en annexe des pagnes, des objets plastiques depuis 13 ans. Elle s’approvisionne dans les marchés en ville. 
Elle veut s’acheter 10complets pagnes, 30complets habits pour bébé, 20plats plastiques.
Madame compte utiliser ses bénéfices pour agrandir son activité. Elle ambitionne scolariser ses enfants dans des écoles supérieurs.
texts.en:
Ms. AÏSSATA is the representative of the group L'AVENIR. A married woman, she is the mother of four children. The oldest is 14 years old, and the youngest is a year and 11 months old. Three go to school. She has nine persons to support.

Ms. AÏSSATA is a hairdresser and has been selling on the side 'pagnes' (the colorful cloth of western Africa) clothing and plastic goods for thirteen years. She gets her supplies from the markets in town. She wants to purchase 10  'pagne' outfits , 30 baby outfits, and 20 plastic dishes. She plans on using her profits to expand her business. Her ambition is to provide higher education for her children.

loans.use: to purchase 10  'pagne' outfits , 30 baby outfits, and 20 plastic dishes

loans.name: Mnyazi

texts.en:
Mnyazi is widowed and has three children, who attend school. For over three years, she has operated an open air food selling business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of business. 

Mnyazi requested a loan from Yehu for 40,000 KES, which she will use to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and household consumables.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat

loans.name: Wendlasongda Samira Group

texts.fr:
Mme BINTOU est responsable du groupe WENDLASONGDA SAMIRA. Célibataire, elle n'a pas d'enfant. Elle a une personne en charge.
Mme est commerçante d'habits prêt à porter. Elle s'approvisionne au marché de son quartier.
Elle veut s'acheter 10 chemises, 20jupes, etc.
Avec ses bénéfices, elle veut accroitre son activité. elle ambitionne ouvrir sa propre boutique et s'occuper de sa famille (parents, frère et sœur).
NB: sur la photo, la marchandise exposée appartient à une membre du groupe.
texts.en: Ms. BINTOU is the official of the group WENDLASONGDA SAMIRA. An unmarried woman, she has no children. She has one person to support. Ms. BINTOU is a merchant of ready-to-wear clothing. She gets her supplies from the market in her district. She wants to purchase 10 shirts, 20 skirts, etc. With her profits, she wants to grow her business. Her ambition is to open her own shop and take care of her family (parents, brother, and sister). Note: In the photo, the merchandise displayed belongs to a group member.

loans.use: to purchase 10  shirts, 20 skirts, etc.

loans.name: La Bass Group

texts.fr:
Mme RIHANATA est responsable du groupe LA BASS. Veuve, elle est mère de 05enfants. Le plus âgé a 39ans et le moins âgé a 20ans. 01 va à l'école et elle a 04personnes en charge.
Mme vend des jus depuis 30ans. Elle s'approvisionne dans les village environnants.
Elle veut s'acheter 06sacs de bisaps pour la préparation du jus.
Avec ses bénéfices, elle veut préparer l'avenir de ses enfants. Elle ambitionne accroitre son activité en ouvrant une boutique.
texts.en: Ms. RIHANATA is the official of the group LA BASS. A widow, she is the mother of five children. The oldest is 39 years old, and the youngest is 20. One goes to school. Ms. RIHANATA has four persons to support. She has been selling juice drinks for thirty years. She gets her supplies from nearby villages. She wants to purchase 6 sacks of dried hibiscus flowers to make a drink. With her profits. she wants to ready her children’s future by opening a shop.

loans.use: to purchase 6 sacks of dried hibiscus flowers to make a drink

loans.name: Chenda

texts.en: Chenda is 41 years old and a mother of five children. She lives with family members in a rural village of the Kampong Chhnang province. She is a carpenter and earns additional income by selling lumber. For Chenda, this is her first loan with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She will spend her entire loan portion to buy a solar panel. She hopes that she can update her house with enough electricity to use.

loans.use: To buy a solar panel.

location.town: Kampong Chhnang province, Tek Phos district

loans.name: Lynn

texts.en:
Lyn is a married woman with six children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Lyn is 38 years old and has one child who is currently in school.

Lyn has a fishing business in the Philippines. Lyn requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional materials and gear for her fishing business.

Lyn has been in this business for 15 years. Lyn would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional materials and gear for her fishing business

loans.name: Lorn

texts.en: Lorn, 54, lives with family members in a rural village of the Kampong Chhnang province. She is village chief. Lorn grows rice and earns about $5.86 (USD) per day. This is her first loan from VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She will spend her entire loan portion to buy a solar panel. She hopes that she can improve her house with electricity to use.

loans.use: To buy a solar panel.

location.town: Kampong Chhnang province, Tek Phos district

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is 41 years old and married with six children.

Evelyn works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell, such as candies, biscuits, soft-drinks, canned goods, coffee, sugar, detergent soap, etc.

Evelyn has borrowed and paid 4 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 1 year and also earns an income from buying and selling charcoal.

Evelyn aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy candies, biscuits, soft-drinks, canned goods, coffee, sugar, detergent soap, and other items to sell.

loans.name: Florame

texts.en:
Florame is a married woman with nine children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Florame is 39 years old and has four children who are currently in school.

Florame has a basket weaving business in the Philippines. Florame requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional raw materials for her business.

Florame has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Florame would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase raw material for her basket weaving business.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is 32 years old and married with five children, three of whom are currently in school.

Helen is in the agricultural business, specifically pig fattening in the Philippines. Helen requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Helen has been in pig fattening for 7 years now, and has borrowed 7 times in the past from NWTF to sustain the business.

In the future, Helen would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Taingory's Group

texts.en:
Taingory is 54 years old and has six children. She lives in a rural area in Kampong Cham province. She earns an income growing various kinds of vegetables. 

Taingory leads a group of two members and requested her first loan from VisionFund, which she will use to buy fertilizer to support her vegetable farm. She hopes that she can earn more income to expand her vegetable farm and renovate her house.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Kang Meas District

loans.name: Bartolo

texts.es:
Bartolo, de 61 años de edad, estudió hasta sexto grado, está casado, desde que estaba muy pequeño, sus padres le enseñaron la agricultura y ganadería y desde entonces se dedica a la producción de granos básicos y a la ganadería como sus principales fuentes de ingresos para su familia.

Bartolo, trabaja en sus parcelas junto a algunos de sus hijos que le ayudan durante la mañana y su esposa se dedica a los oficios domésticos y en la tarde él cuida y ordeña las vacas que tiene.

Bartolo,  necesita el préstamo para comprar  dos vacas que le venden en buen precio, con esta adquisición podrá incrementar la producción de leche, que su esposa ocupa para elaborar productos lácteos, para el consumo familiar y para vender entre sus vecinos. 

Bartolo, sueña con comprar un vehículo, para realizar viajes en los alrededor y obtener ingresos adicionales.
texts.en:
Bartolo, age 61, went to school through the sixth grade.  He is married.  When he was very little he parents taught him about farming and working with livestock.  Ever since then he has worked at producing basic grains, and he has worked with livestock as his main sources of income for his family.

Bartolo works on his land together with some of his children, who help him in the morning.  His wife devotes herself to the household chores, and in the afternoon she takes care of and milks the cows that they have.

Bartolo needs the loan to buy two cows, which they will sell him for a good price.  With this acquisition he will be able to increase the milk production, which his wife uses to make dairy products for the family consumption and to sell to their neighbors.

Bartolo dreams of buying a vehicle to make trips to surrounding areas and getting additional earnings.

loans.use: to buy two cows.

loans.name: Celerina

texts.en:
Celerina is 43 years old and married with two children.

Celerina works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items like canned goods, snack foods, diapers, bath soap, sanitary pads, shampoo, detergent soap, coffee, etc. to sell.

Celerina has borrowed and repaid three loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 19 years and earns additional income from raising livestock.

Celerina aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items like canned goods, snack foods, diapers, bath soap, sanitary pads, shampoo, detergent soap, coffee, etc. to sell

loans.name: Thary

texts.en: Thary, 35, is a mother of four children from Kampong Speu province. She earns income teaching in school, selling grocery items, growing rice and raising pigs. For Thary, this is her fifth loan from VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she has fully repaid her past loans successfully. She will spend her entire loan portion to pay tuition for her son, who wants to pursue a bachelor's degree. She hopes that her son can get a good job after graduation.

loans.use: To pay tuition for her son, who wants to pursue a bachelor's degree.

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
Josefina works hard to support her family. Josefina is married and has a pig fattening business in the Philippines.

Josefina requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Josefina has been in this business for 3 years now.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

In the future, Josefina would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Joselinda

texts.en:
Joselinda is 51 years old and has four children. Joselinda is married and has one child who is still in school.

Joselinda is in the agricultural business, fattening pigs in the Philippines. Joselinda requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase feed and other supplies for her business and earns additional income from weaving.
