Joselinda has been in pig fattening for 5 years now, and has borrowed 6 times in the past from NWTF to sustain this livelihood.

She successfully paid back her previous loans and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Joselinda would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase feed and other supplies for her pig-raising business.

loans.name: Eli

texts.fr: Eli est un agent dans une entreprise commerciale d’énergie. Il est parent des 3 étudiants à l’université. Il a été informé des nouvelles opportunités de financement de frais d’éducation supérieures par l’IMF Hekima. Ainsi, ce nouveau prêt lui servira de payer les frais académiques pour ses étudiants en fin qu’ils ne soient plus exclus de cours durant toute l’année académique 2014-2015. Ce parent rêve voir ses enfants devenir ingénieur architecte, ingénieur en génie civil, chef d’entreprise. Il remercie l’IMF Hekima pour son nouveau produit innovant dédié à l’éducation de leurs enfants en leur donnant de crédit d’impact social.
texts.en:
Eli is an agent working for a commercial energy company. He is the parent of three children who are studying at university. He heard about the new opportunities for financing higher education costs through MFI Hekima. In fact, this new loan will help him to pay academic expenses for his children at university so that they will not be excluded from classes during the academic year 2015-2015. 

This parent dreams of having his children become architectural engineers, public works engineers, or head of a company. He thanks MFI Hekima for its new and innovative banking product dedicated to the education of clients' children by giving them social impact loans.

loans.use: to pay higher education costs for his children who are at university

loans.name: Edis Ana Paula

texts.es:
Edis, de 56 años de edad, no estudió, estuvo casada pero su esposo murió hace 7 años, tuvieron 4 hijos, de los cuales solamente dos  viven con ella, los demás tienen sus hogares.  


Edis, se dedica a los oficios domésticos del hogar y también a la agricultura, se dedica a estas actividades desde hace  muchos años.- Cuanto estaba joven sus padres le enseñaron a sembrar maíz, frijol, maicillo y otros cultivos, no tiene otro tipo de ingresos.- Su lugar de trabajo está a 3 kilómetros de su casa y su horario de trabajo es de 5 horas al día, su hijo es el único que le ayuda.


Edis, necesita el préstamo para pagar el alquiler de la tierra en la cual sembrará ésta temporada y para comprar una vaca, para engordarla con los residuos del maíz y de frijol que queden de la cosecha. 


Los sueños de Edis, son seguir trabajando fuerte para sacar adelante a su familia, sueña con tener su propio negocio y su propio terreno donde cultivar los granos.
texts.en: Edis is 56 years old, didn’t go to school, and was married but her husband died  7 years ago. They had 4 children of which 2 live with her; the others have their own homes. Edis is a housewife and also farms. She has done this work for many years. When she was young her parents taught her how to grow corn, bean, and other crops. She doesn’t have any other source of income. Her place of work is located 3 kilometers from her home and she works 5 days a week and her son is the only help she has. Edis needs a loan to pay the rent on the land she will plant this season and to buy a cow to fatten with the extra left over from the corn and bean harvest. Edis dreams of continue to work strongly in order to support her family. She dreams of having her own business and her own land where she can grow grains.

loans.use: to pay the rent on the land which she will plant this season and to buy a cow.

loans.name: Kamel

texts.en:
Kamel is a 45-year-old married father of five children and a Palestinian refugee who lives in a Palestinian refugee camp. He has been working in farming for twenty-five years to cover the needs and expenses of his family.

Kamel is a hard worker who is trying desperately to develop his business, thus today he is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to buy zucchini seeds in an attempt to diverse his production. This loan will increase Kamel's income and satisfy his customers.

Kamel hopes to expand his business more in the future to stay capable of providing his family with better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy zucchini seeds in an attempt to diversify his production

loans.name: Maria Esperanza

texts.es: María tiene 61 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su grupo familiar. Ella es una mujer increíble quien desde hace mucho tiempo se dedica a la venta de ricas pupusas. Dicho negocio es el que le permite apoyar en la economía de su hogar. María desea mejorar sus ingresos a través de su negocio. Por lo anterior ha tomado la decisión de solicitar este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de los insumos necesarios como: maíz, queso, tomates, verduras, aceite, etc. de esta forma espera poder mejorar sus ventas e ingresos y de esta forma dar a su familia mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en: Maria is 61 years old. She lives in her own home with her family. She is an incredible woman who has sold delicious pupusas for many years. The business allows her to support the household's expenses. Maria wants to improve her income through her business. She decided to request this loan from FUSAI to invest in the purchase of necessary supplies like corn, cheese, tomatoes, vegetables, oil, etc. She can improve her sales and then give her family better living conditions.

loans.use: purchase corn, cheese, tomatoes and other ingredients for her pupusa business.

loans.name: Marcos Tulio

texts.es:
Don Marcos Tulio de 47 años de edad es Guarda de Seguridad, es casado, su hijo tiene la edad de 20 años y estudia en la Universidad;  desde hace 20 años labora para el Hospital del Rama siendo ésta su única fuente de ingresos, su esposa es ama de casa y está al cuido de su hijo,  en la zona del Rama donde habita don Marcos el agua es escasa y llega limitadamente careciendo del vital liquido. 

Don Marcos ha invertido sus créditos en mejorar su vivienda que ahora está muy bonita, anteriormente realizó un dormitorio para su hijo ahora tiene mayor espacio y privacidad, teniendo en cuenta que su vivienda aun necesita otras mejoras por hacer: poner cerámica, acondicionar servicio higiénico, poner verjas entre otras que con el tiempo hará si Dios se lo permite.

Por ahora su mayor necesidad es comprar un tanque plástico que le permitirá almacenar mayor cantidad de agua limpia y elaborar otra letrina pues la que tiene esta en mal estado,  espera poder hacer esta mejora con este Crédito que solicita a Kiva, ya que solo así puede ver su sueño hecho realidad.

Su próximo proyecto es poner cerámica en su Vivienda si Dios le da Salud y trabajo para continuar con su meta para brindar mayor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Marcos Tulio is 47 years old, married, and has a 20 year old son who studies at the University. He has worked as a security guard in the Hospital del Rama for 20 years, and this is his only source of income. His spouse is a housewife and takes care of their son. They live in the Rama area, and where their house is located water is scares and very limited in this vital liquid’s arrival to their home. Marcos has used his loans to improve his house that is now very pretty. Previously he built a bedroom for his son who now has more space for privacy, keeping in mind that his home still needs other improvements: installing tile, conditioning the hygienic services, putting security bars and other improvements as God permits.

For now his greatest necessity is to buy a plastic tank that will enable him to store a greater supply of clean water and make another latrine because the one he has is in poor condition. He hopes to do these improvements with this loan through Kiva, as this is the only way to make his dream reality. His next project is to install ceramic tile in his home if God gives him health and work to continue with his goal to provide a better quality of life for this family.

loans.use: to build a latrine and to buy a plastic tank in order to have better hygiene in his home.

loans.name: Subhy

texts.en:
Subhy comes from Tajikistan. She lives with her family in a rural area. Subhy is married and her children are adults. 

Subhy has had an agriculture business for 10 years. She has 2 hectares of land where she grows wheat and potatoes. She sells the harvest in a local market. She has additional income from animal husbandry. She raises cows and sells them in a local market. 

Subhy works hard every day to earn a living and provide her family with a good living standard. She plans to renovate her house from the profit of her business. She is asking for a loan of 10,000 Somoni to buy cattle to increase her working capital. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to buy cattle in order to increase her working capital

loans.name: Muhammadjon

texts.en:
Muhammadjon is a teacher.  He is single, lives with his parents and was born in 1990. He lives in the north part of Tajikistan. 

Muhammadjon has a pedagogical education and has worked in a school for more than three years. He always tries to improve his knowledge and to widen his worldview. He is also a student. Muhammadjon is a hardworking and smart. 

Muhammadjon is asking for a loan to pay for tuition. He awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to pay for tuition .

loans.name: Iris

texts.en:
Iris is 34 years old and married with two children.

Iris works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell in her general store.

Iris has borrowed and repaid two loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and earns additional income from direct selling Avon products.

Iris aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Macrina

texts.en:
Macrina is a married woman with seven children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Macrina is 58 years old and has one child still in school.

Macrina has a fishing business in the Philippines. Macrina has been in this business for eight years. She requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional materials and gears for her business.

In the future, Macrina would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional materials and gears for her business

loans.name: Lyn

texts.en:
Lyn is 35 years old and married with two children.

She earns a living by having a pig fattening business in the Philippines. Lyn is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF to buy vaccine, feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Lyn has been in pig fattening for 5 years and also earns additional income from selling soft drinks.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy vaccines, feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Marifel

texts.en:
Marifel is a very hard-working entrepreneur. She is 40 years old and married with seven children, four of whom are currently in school.

Marifel has a firewood vending business in the Philippines. Marifel requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional inventory of firewood to sell to her customers.

Marifel has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Marifel would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional firewood to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Melecia

texts.en:
Melecia works hard to support her family. Melecia is married and has a bicycle transport business in the Philippines.

Melecia requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase an additional bicycle for her business.

Melecia has been in this business for 6 years now.

In the future, Melecia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase an additional bicycle for her business

loans.name: Roselyn

texts.en:
Roselyn is single and earns money selling firewood in the Philippines.

Roselyn requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more firewood to sell.

Roselyn has been in this business for 3 years now.

In the future, Roselyn would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more firewood to sell.

loans.name: Santiaga

texts.en:
Santiaga is a married woman with five children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Santiaga is 43 years old and has one child who is still in school.

Santiaga has a pig-fattening business in the Philippines. Santiaga has requested a 15,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

She has successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Santiaga has been in this business for 4 years. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en:
Violeta is 51 years old and is married with four children.  

Violeta is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Violeta has requested a 28,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Violeta has been raising pigs for 5 years now, and she has borrowed 13 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

Violeta would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is a married woman with five children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Virginia is 50 years old and has three children who are still in school.

Virginia has an abaca weaving business in the Philippines. Virginia has requested a 12,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more raw materials for her abaca weaving business.

Virginia has been in this business for 5 years. In the future, Virginia would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more raw materials for her abaca weaving business

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
Zenaida works hard to support her family. She is married and has a basket weaving business in the Philippines.

Zenaida requested a PHP 13000 loan through NWTF to buy raw materials for her business. She has been in this business for five years.

Zenaida would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for her weaving business.

loans.name: Cresencia

texts.en:
Cresencia is 60 years old and married with four children.  She works hard to provide for her family. 

Cresencia runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 29000 loan through NWTF to purchase groceries to sell in her general store. She has run her store for 20 years and also earns an income from ice cream vending. Cresencia has borrowed and paid 19 loans from NWTF before this loan. 

Cresencia aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase groceries to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Beatriz Meladi

texts.es:
Beatriz, de 64 años de edad, es ama de casa y su nivel de estudio fue hasta el cuarto grado, esta acompañada y junto con su compañero de vida tienen 3 hijos, pero en su casa solo vive uno de sus hijos, una nieta y su esposo.

Beatriz, se dedica a atender una pequeña tienda, que tiene en su casa desde hace un año, decidio colocar esta tienda, para ayudarle a su esposo en los gastos del hogar.

El crédito que está solicitando en la institución, es para comprar más productos como golosinas, jabones, detergente, etc. Todo esto para ofrecer más productos a los clientes, lograr obtener un poco más de ingresos para su hogar.

El sueño de Beatriz es, ampliar mucho más su tienda y que su nieta estudie mucho para que en un futuro tenga mejores oportunidades de trabajo.
texts.en:
Beatriz, 64, is a homemaker.  She studied up to fourth grade.  She's in a relationship, and she and her life partner have three children, although only her husband, one of her children, and a granddaughter live in her house.

Beatriz earns a living tending a small store she has had in her house for a year.  She decided to start the store to help her husband with the household expenses.

The loan she's requesting is to buy snacks, soap, detergent, and other products.  That way she can sell more products to her customers and manage to earn a bit more income for her household.

Beatriz's dreams is to expand her store significantly and for her granddaughter to study a lot so she has better employment opportunities in the future.

loans.use: to buy more products such as snacks, soap, detergent, etc.

loans.name: Yang

texts.en:
Yang is a 34-year-old man. He is married with 2 children who both are in school. Yang’s father died at the hands of disease one year ago. Since then, his mother took ill and has lived with him.

Yang opened a China Unicom cell-phone shop 2 years ago. His shop sells and maintains mobile phones; he can also charge the call fee. Yang is a hardworking man and he uses the income from the shop to support his family. Yang is also a kindhearted man: he often helps his neighbors do maintenance jobs.

Yang requested ￥20,000 from MicroCred. As the Spring Festival is approaching, many people who work outside are coming back one by one. He will use the money to stock more new phones for the holidays. He believes the phones will sell very quickly.

He will use the income from the loan to buy some new clothes and festival food for his family. He hopes that they will have a happy Spring Festival.

loans.use: to stock more new mobile phones

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay academic fees for his children who are enrolled in higher education.

loans.name: Xanlar

texts.en:
Xanlar is 45 years old and lives with his wife and son in the Füzuli region of Azerbaijan. His daughter is married, and his son is a taxi driver in their same village. For 22 years, the family has been considered IDP from Füzuli city. (IDP, or Internally Displaced Persons, are people forced to flee their home, but who remain within their country's borders, essentially internal refugees.) 

Xanlar has been in the sheep-breeding business for many years. Today Xanlar needs 800 AZN (Azerbaijan New Manat), and for this reason he has applied to Komak for a loan. He planning to use the loan to buy vaccination for his lambs. He says he is thankful to both Kiva and Komak for their help. In the future he wants to help his son get married.

loans.use: to buy vaccination for his sheep.

loans.name: Ernesta

texts.en: Ernesta  is 54 years old, married and lives in Isabel, Leyte. She has earned a living for more than 20 years by fishing with her husband,  Marcelino. This is their main source of income, and Ernesta helps her husband by fixing their fishing nets. She would like to take out a loan to buy more fishing gear such as nets, lead weights, hooks and floaters. This loan will help her and her husband improve their catch thus giving them more fish to sell in the market. In the future, Ernesta hopes to make their fishing business a bigger success.

loans.use: to buy more fishing gear, such as nets, lead weights, hooks and floaters

loans.name: Agustin

texts.es:
Don Agustín de 44 años de edad es Auxiliar de Enfermería, soltero, no tiene hijos que mantener;  desde hace 26 años labora para el Hospital del Rama siendo esta su única fuente de ingresos; en la zona donde el habita la gente es comerciante y trabaja para ir mejorando su nivel de vida tal es el caso de don Agustín que con su salario ha pagado los crédito que le ha emitido Afodenic y Kiva con ellos pudo realizar mejoras a su vivienda,  pero aún le quedan otras mejoras por hacer y no descansará hasta ver su vivienda bonita y terminada 100%.

En su localidad la gente carece de agua potable es limitada, la mayoría de la gente tiene sus posos y otros se abastasen de sus amistades y vecinos así garantizan el vital liquido, ante esta necesidad solicita crédito a Kiva para comprar un Tanque plástico y elaborar pila Séptica e  instalar servicio Higiénico, obra que le permitirá tener un mejor ambiente e higiene en su hogar para bien de él y su Familiares y vecinos.

Su próximo proyecto es poner cerámica en su Vivienda si Dios le da Salud y trabajo para continuar con su meta de mejorar su Vivienda y por ende su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Don Agustín is 44 years old. He is a nursing assistant. He is single and doesn't have children to support. He has worked for the hospital of El Rama for 26 years, this being his only source of income. In the zone where he lives, the people are businesspeople and work in order to continue improving their standard of living. Such is the case for Don Agustín, who, with his salary, has paid the loans that AFODENIC and Kiva have given him. With them, he was able to make improvements in his house, but there are still other improvements to make, and he will not rest until he sees his house beautiful and 100% finished.

In his area, the people lack potable water. It is limited. The majority of the people have their wells, and others stock up from their friends and neighbors, thus guaranteeing this vital liquid. In the face of this necessity, he is applying to Kiva for a loan to buy a plastic tank. make a septic tank, and install a toilet, work that will allow him to have a better environment and hygiene in his household for his well-being and that of his relatives and neighbors.

His next project is to put ceramic tile in his home, if God gives him health, and to work to continue with his goal of improving his home and in the end, his quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a plastic tank and its base (iron) to store clean water, since this vital service is lacking in the zone.

loans.name: Surxay

texts.en:
Surxay is a 44 years old man with a lovely family.  He has two daughters. His wife helps with Surxay's business.  He is an IDP (Internally displaced Persons) from Fuzuli city.  He now lives in the Fuzuli region.

Surxay has been in animal breeding business about seven years. He buys little calf, raising them and sells them in the bazaar for earn money. 

Today he wants to increase his business and requesting for a loan amount of 900 AZN for buy hay and straw for his cows. 

Surxay is thankful to Komak and Kiva for their help. In the future he wants to start producing and selling dairy products.

loans.use: to buy hay and straw.

loans.name: Dúo Fatima Group

texts.es:
DUO FATIMA 
El cual esta integrado por la señora Ileana Guadalupe de quien es madre de 2 niños y propietaria de una librería ubicada en la misma comunidad ella aparte de tener su propio negocio también es ama de casa y ella esta muy interesada en que su negoció pueda crecer para que con ello ella pueda brindar un bien estilo de vida a su familia y es por ello que ella toca las puertas de FAPE para que se le otorgué un crédito para la inversión de útiles escolares aprovechando que aun es una buena época para poder invertir en el mismo esperando en DIOS  que le tome en cuenta dicha solicitud…
texts.en:
DUO FATIMA

Ileana Guadalupe is a member of the Duo Fatima group.  She has two children, and she has a bookstore in her community.  Besides having her own business, she is also a housewife.  She is very interested in having her business grow so that she is able to provide her family with a good lifestyle.

That is why she knocks on FAPE’s doors to get a loan to buy school supplies.  She will be taking advantage of the fact that it is still a good season to be able to invest in them.  She is hoping to God that her request is considered.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her bookstore.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy bracelets, rings, necklaces, earrings and other costume jewelry so to expand her accessory selection and have satisfied customers

loans.name: Concepcion Magdalena

texts.es:
Concepción, utilizo el préstamo anterior para incrementar su inventario, ventas y ganancias, su grupo familiar se mantiene y la situación financiera ha mejorado, hasta la fecha no representa dificultades en su negocio ni en su salud personal.
Las demandas son mayores y tiene que tener su inventario muy surtido, esto hace q se decida por un nuevo crédito que usara para comprar variedad de ropa, sandalias, chancletas y lácteos, para continuar mejorando.
texts.en: Concepción used her previous loan to increase her inventory and thus her sales and income. Her family depends on her and their financial situation has improved. Up to now she is not having any business or personal health difficulties. However, the demand has gone up and she requires a well stocked inventory. Therefore, Concepción has decided to ask for a new loan, which she will use to buy a variety of clothing, sandals, flip-flops and dairy products, so as to continue growing.

loans.use: to buy a variety of clothing, sandals, flip-flops and dairy products.

loans.name: Omar Antonio

texts.es:
Omar, manifiesta que el crédito anterior le ha dado oportunidad de continuar trabajando en la agricultura, ofrece a su familia mejor alimentación vestuario y ha cancelado su deuda con buena calificación crediticia.
Como ya se acerca la época adecuada para sembrar solicita un préstamo para comprar insumos agrícolas y pagar obreros que le ayuden a preparar el terreno para cultivar maíz.
texts.en:
Omar states that the previous loan gave him the opportunity to continue working in agriculture.  He gives his family better food and clothing, and he has repaid his debt with a good credit rating.

As the season for planting is approaching, he is requesting a loan to buy agricultural supplies and to pay the workers who help him prepare the land to plant corn.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies and to pay the workers who help him prepare the land to plant corn.

loans.name: Sobina

texts.en:
Sobina is a student of third year at the Slavonic University of Tajikistan. She learns Law and Politics. She lives and studies in the capital of Tajikistan. The members of her family are her mother, father and two sisters. Sobina is happy with her family. 

Sobina’s parents have not enough money to pay for her education at the university and that’s why she is asking for a loan to pay for tuition. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to pay for education.

loans.name: Anibal

texts.es: ANIBAL: Es originario de Waspam Río Coco, pertenece a la etnia miskita, tiene 43 años, casado con cinco hijos: Dos son mayores de edad y tres  adolescentes que estudian su secundaria. Trabaja como enfermero. Está solicitando un préstamo para poder reparar las paredes de madera de su casa donde habita con sus hijos y esposa. Con el préstamo podrá comprar madera cepillada, clavos y cubrir costos de mano de obra. Su sueño es  brindarle a su familia una vivienda más segura y en buenas condiciones
texts.en:
Anibal is originally from Waspam Río Coco and belongs to the Miskita ethnicity.
He is 43 years old, married and has five children: Two are of age and three are teenagers currently attending high school.
Anibal works as a nurse practitioner.

He is asking for a loan to be able to repair the wooden walls of his house where he lives with his children and wife.
With the loan he be able to buy planed timber and nails and he will be able to cover the labor costs.
He dreams of offering his family a more secure home in a better condition.

loans.use: to buy planed timber and nails and to cover labor costs.

loans.name: Kuleza Mtima Group

texts.en:
Loveness is a single mother with three children and she also looks after three orphans. She owns a hair dressing salon, which she relies on for the provision of her family’s needs. Loveness buys her materials from the Game shop in Lilongwe. She will use the loan to expand her business by buying cosmetics and other needed materials. 

Her plan is to diversify her business into selling cooking oil, and she will be purchasing the cooking oil from the neighboring countries. She hopes to be self-sufficient and to construct her own house. As a single mother, accessing loans has had a positive impact on her life, as she is now able to pay for school for her children and provide them with food.

loans.use: To buy hair oil, mesh, and other salon materials

loans.name: Ruzimo

texts.en:
Ruzimo was born in 1961. She is a careful mother of 2 children. Her husband is a teacher. Ruzimo has had her own business for 20 years. She grows and sells agriculture products. 

Ruzimo has a small portion of land where she grows onion, carrots, and other vegetables. She sows and harvests twice a year and usually gets a good harvest. 

She is going to grow other kinds of vegetables and offer them to local people. She is asking for a loan of 15,000 Somoni to buy seeds and mineral fertilizers for sowing these additional vegetable varieties. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to buy seeds and mineral fertilizers for sowing new varieties of vegetables

loans.name: Huor

texts.en:
Huor, who is 38 years old, is living in a community of Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. She has two children who are currently in school. To support the family, she is working very hard on her own rice farmland by growing and selling the crop to the local dealers and customers in market.  The net profit that she can generate is USD 5.00 a day, on average. 

As a supplementary earning, she has come up with a new business idea.  She wants to raise pigs to sell. However, her insufficient capital investment doesn't allow her to do so. Therefore, she is applying for a Kiva loan to buy pigs. She hopes that this new trade will help to improve her living standard. She would like to thank to all the lenders for their financial support. She is awaiting your kindness.

loans.use: to buy pigs.

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites is a 35-year-old married woman with three children, one of whom is currently in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Marites has a general store business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 10 years. Marites requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

Marites would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Visitacion

texts.en:
Visitacion works hard to support her family. She is married and has an abaca weaving business in the Philippines.

Visitacion has requested a 22,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more materials like abaca fiber, etc. for her business.

She has been in this business for 7 years now.

Visitacion has successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more materials like abaca fiber, etc. for her business

loans.name: Ana

texts.en:
In the photograph are Ana and her husband, Rifat, an Egyptian Albanian couple who live in a little town in northern Albania. Rifat has been diagnosed with a head tumor and has been scheduled for a surgery soon and chemotherapy sessions to follow. 

Ana is seeking lenders' compassion to help her financially so that she can pay for her husband's medical expenses.

They are parents of two; the youngest is married and lives with them, working for a pay of approximately $200. Ana receives a pay of $120 and her husband's disability income is $300.

loans.use: to pay for her husband's chemotherapy sessions

loans.name: Gaudencia

texts.en:
Gaudencia works hard to support her family. She is currently separated. Gaudenciaand owns a general store in the Philippines.

Gaudencia requested a PHP 29000 loan through NWTF to purchase groceries to sell.S he has been in this business for six years.

In the future, Gaudencia would like to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase groceries to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Sunema

texts.en:
Sunema is a 51 year old mother of 6 children. She runs and operates a small business selling taro and bananas in her community to earn a living. She hopes to use her profit to expand her business in the near future.

Sunema has requested a loan to buy taro roots, banana tubers, a wheelbarrow, rake, shovel, and chemicals to assist her in running the business. She became a member of SPBD in 2013.

loans.use: to buy taro roots, banana tubers, a wheelbarrow, rake, shovel, and chemicals.

loans.name: Pedro Pablo

texts.es:
Pedro de 52 años de edad es auxiliar de Enfermería, es casado, su tres hijo en edades 18, 22 y 25 los dos mayores ya son independiente y el menor estudia.   Don Pedro desde hace 20 años labora para el Hospital del Rama como Auxiliar de enfermería siendo ésta su principal fuente de ingresos, en tiempos libres realiza trabajos componiéndolos Difuntos cuando lo solicitan permitiéndole obtener otra fuente de ingresos beneficioso para su familia,  su esposa se dedica a los quehaceres del hogar,  en su localidad el servicio de agua potable es restringido y le urge comprar un recipiente más grande para almacenar agua y abastecer su familia del vital liquido,  espera aplicar a este crédito con los Fondos Kivas para poder hacer su proyecto realidad.

Don Pedro ha invertido sus créditos en mejorar su vivienda la que ahora presenta mejor fachada, anteriormente realizó un dormitorio para su hija que le había prometido que cuando cumpliera sus 18 años le daría mayor privacidad creando su propia habitación, si bien es cierto ha mejorado grandemente su hogar, le falta poner cerámica, acondicionar baños, hacer porche  y otras mejoras que con el tiempo se hacen necesarias en una vivienda.

Su próximo proyecto si Dios se lo permite es poner tapia alrededor de su vivienda para dar mayor seguridad a su familia.
texts.en: Pedro is 52 years old, married, and works as a medical assistant. He has three children ages 18, 22, and 25, the two oldest are now independent and the youngest is in school. For 20 years Pedro has worked in Hospital del Rama as a medical assistant and this is his main source of income. In his free time he does odd jobs when asked in order to obtain a source of income beneficial for your family. His spouse is a housewife. Where their home is located the water service is very restricted and he is urged to buy a larger water container in order to store water and supply his family with this vital liquid. He hopes to use the Kiva funds to be able to make his project reality. Pedro has invested his loans in improving his home so that now it has a better front façade, he previously added a bedroom for his daughter that he had promised her when she turned 18 years old to give her greater privacy with her own room. It is true he has greatly improved his home, he still needs to install ceramic tile, remodel bathrooms, build a porch and other improvements that with time will be necessary on his home. His next project, if God permits, is to put a wall around his home to give his family greater security.

loans.use: to make a battery septic system for hygienic sanitation and a plastic tank to store sufficient water which will enable him to have good hygiene in his home.

loans.name: Lesina

texts.en:
Lesina is a 44 year old mother of 6 children. She runs a business selling taro and bananas in her village. She has been doing this for more than a year to earn a living.

Lesina has requested a loan to buy taro roots, banana tubers, a wheelbarrow, rake, shovel, water tank and gloves to assist the business . She will expand her business in the future using her profit. She became a member of SPBD in 2013.

loans.use: to buy taro roots, banana tubers, a wheelbarrow, rake, shovel, water tank and gloves.

loans.name: Wedian

texts.en:
Wedian is a 26-year-old married mother of two children who has worked as a beauty specialist for the past year, to help her husband meet the family's needs and living expenses.

Wedian is an ambitious lady and a hard worker who is trying her best to develop her business. Today, she is acquiring a YOUTH loan from Kiva's field partner AL Majmoua to increase her business merchandise (new collection of cosmetics and new colors of nail polish) to provide her customers with better service.

Wedian hopes to expand her business more in the future through opening her own beauty salon, thus increasing her income and improving her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to offer her customers new collections of cosmetics and new colors of nail polish.

loans.name: Jumagul

texts.en:
Jumagul is married and has four children. She wants to provide them with a good education.  But since her husband’s income is not enough to provide the family with a good quality of life, Jumagul decided to start new animal husbandry business.

Jumagul studied a course, ‘To Get Ahead’ from women to gain business skills. 

Her children will help her with her business. Jumagul should be very successful business woman because she is hardworking and smart.  

Jumagul is asking for a loan of 500 Somoni to buy cattle. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy cattle.

loans.name: Nodira

texts.en: Nodira was born in 1984. She is hard-working woman from North Tajikistan. Nodira is married and has 3 children. She has 2 boys and a girl, and all of them are in school. Nodira always tries for the well-being of her children. She does not have any higher education, and that’s why she wants to help her children to get higher education. Nodira is a businesswoman. She has been busy with knitting for 8 years. She knits different kinds of children's and women's clothes. Nodira has much experience in this field and does her job well. Thanks to the high quality of her products, she has regular customers. She is going to enlarge her business and in this way find success. She is asking for a loan of 3,000 Somoni to buy fiber and thread. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: To buy fiber and thread to make more clothes

loans.name: Mahbuba

texts.en:
Mahbuba is widowed and has two children. Mahbuba, who was born in 1959, is very hardworking woman.  Six months ago she began new business. 

Mahbuba buys cattle, feeds them for some months and sells them in a local market. She manages with business alone. 

Mahbuba wants to improve her business. She is asking for a loan of 500 Somoni to buy cattle to increase her working capital. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to buy cattle.

loans.name: Khursheda

texts.en:
Khursheda was born in 1988. She is married and has 2 young children. She lives with her family in a village, and her husband is a day laborer. She is going to start new business because her husband’s income is small is not enough to improve their living condition. 

Khursheda plans to start business in animal husbandry. She took part in a course called ‘To Get Ahead’ given by a women's organization and earned a certificate. She is asking for a loan of 700 Somoni to buy cattle for establishing her new business. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to buy cattle to start her own animal husbandry business.

loans.name: Sifatbony

texts.en:
Sifatbony was born in 1964. She lives with her husband and four children and is a caring mother. Sifatbony's husband is a builder. 

For the past twenty-five years, Sifatbony has been busy with animal husbandry. She has a lot of experience in this field. Over time, Sifatbony has developed her business. She mainly feeds cows and sells the milk and milk products in the local area. 

Sifatbony would like to enlarge her herd and increase her sales. She is asking for a loan of 2,000 Somoni to buy a cow and awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to buy a cow

loans.name: Zaynab

texts.en:
Zaynab was born in 1962. She is married and has a large family of 4 children. 

Zaynab’s husband works as a casual labourer. Her family's standard of living is low which is why she has found an additional source of income for the family. 

Zaynab is starting a new business with animal husbandry. Zaynab took part in a ‘To Get Ahead’ course offered by a women's organization, and she now has her certificate. 

Zaynab is requesting a loan of 1,000 TJS so she can buy cattle and start her new business. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to purchase cattle so she can start her new business.

loans.name: Amelita

texts.en:
Amelita is a 45-year-old married mother of 3 children. All of her children are in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Amelita has a direct-sales products business in the Philippines, which she has been running for 19 years. Amelita has requested a 20,000 PHP loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation in order to buy more direct-sales products to sell to her customers.

In the future, Amelita would like to save enough money to be able to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more direct-sales products to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Ardita

texts.en:
Ardita is 47 years old, married, and has three children, one of whom is still in school.

Ardita is in the agricultural business, farming sugarcane in the Philippines. Ardita requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Ardita has been farming sugarcane for 11 years now, and has borrowed 17 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Ardita would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Baltazara

texts.en:
Baltazara works hard to support her family. Baltazara is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

Baltazara requested a PHP 19,500 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Baltazara has been in this business for 15 years now.

In the future, Baltazara would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Enver

texts.en:
Enver thanks all of his previous lenders. He used his prior loan to purchase guano and seeds to ensure a successful harvest. He was satisfied with the loan process and the results, as his loan helped him reap a better harvest and earn more income. 

Now, Enver is asking for another loan in order to purchase tomatoes and potatoes to sell. The loan will increase his family's income and help provide for their basic needs. He works hard to save for his family's future and believes that this loan will help him even more. He wants to thank all of the lenders for their continued support.

loans.use: to purchase additional tomatoes and potatoes to sell

loans.name: Jani

texts.en:
A loan of 160,000 Albanian Lek will help Jani repair his home.  He is a 35-year-old Egyptian Albanian and married father of two young children, ages 10 and nine.  Together they live with his elderly parents. 

Jani and his family live in Korca.  He receives disability income and works as a painter too; whereas his wife works in a bakery. Jani’s father work for a wood cutting and logging company.

loans.use: to make basic repairs to his home.

loans.name: Majida

texts.en:
Majida is a 52-year-old, married and mother of five children.  She has been her family's sole breadwinner for 18 years. 

In 2003, Majida established her business, which specialized in plastic and cardboard bags. She is a hard-working and ambitious woman who is always trying hard to develop her business.  Today Majida is acquiring a loan from Kiva partner, Al Majmoua Lebanese Association for Development, to buy a piston and other printing machines to facilitate her work and satisfy her customers needs.

Majida hopes to expand her business in the future to increase her income and improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a piston and other printing machines to facilitate her work and satisfy her customers' needs

loans.name: Panha

texts.en:
Panha is an 18-year-old freshman who is pursuing an associate’s degree, majoring in management. He is from the Kampong Chhnang province in Cambodia. 

He also works as chef assistant, making approximately USD 2.66 per day. His father is a civil servant and his mother is a grocer. 

Panha does not have enough money to pay his university fees, so he has decided to secure a loan. With the loan, he will be able to earn an associate’s degree successfully. 

For Panha’s dream, he wants a proper job with a good salary.

loans.use: to pay his university fees

loans.name: Tuydy

texts.en:
Tuydy is married and has four children. Her husband is a rental worker and earns a small income. Tuydy began an animal husbandry six months ago. She feeds cows and sells them in a local market. 

Tuydy's goal is to increase her family's standard of living.

Tuydy is asking for a loan of 2000 Somoni to buy cows to increase her working capital. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to buy cows.

loans.name: Jose Antonio

texts.es:
Jose es un hombre de 27 años de edad, soltero, sin hijos y estudia la carrera de nutrición.
Él es inteligente, emprendedor, independiente, generoso, amable, responsable y trabajador. Su trabajo lo realiza en la zona central, , un área caracterizada por el comercio en todas las áreas, y que alberga a universidades, oficinas públicas y empresas privadas que conviven lado a lado, de clima templado durante todo el año, con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 14-24 grados centígrados.
Jose es de tez morena, cabello negro corto, baja estatura, ojos obscuros, su lengua materna es Quechua y habla español por cultura general y por el trabajo que realiza. Vive con su abuela; en una casa propia construida de ladrillo, que cuenta con electricidad y agua de pozo. Una vez a la semana pasa por el lugar el camión cisterna que vende agua por litros, los pobladores del lugar la compran algunos en sus tanques de agua otros en bidones y botellas. El trabaja como jefe de personal en un restaurante nocturno para pagar los gastos universitarios que realiza en la carrera de nutrición de la universidad pública. “durante el día me dedico a mi carrera universitaria y por las noches trabajo, ya son 4 años que vengo viviendo de esa manera…” comenta. Su sueño es terminar sus estudios y trabajar en su profesión, el desea realizar la compra de una computadora portátil para continuar con sus estudios. Esta es la 3 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 4 años que viene estudiando y trabajando.
Es por esos motivos que Jose solicita un préstamo para la compra de una computadora portátil para finalizar su carrera profesional.
texts.en:
José, 27, is single and has no children.  He is studying for a degree in nutrition.  He is intelligent, enterprising, independent, generous, friendly, responsible, and hardworking.  He does his work in the central zone, an area characterized by trade in all areas, and that houses universities, public offices, and private businesses that coexist side by side.  The area has a temperate climate all year, and a temperature ranging between 14 and 24 degrees centigrade during the day.

José is of dark complexion and short stature with dark eyes and short black hair.  His native language is Quechua and he speaks Spanish with the general population and for his work.  He lives with his grandmother.   She owns her own home which is made of brick, and has electricity and well water.  Once a week, the tanker that sells water by the liter passes through the area.  Some of the locals buy it for their water tanks, and others buy it in drums and bottles.  He works as personnel manager at a restaurant in the evenings to pay for college expenses that he incurs for his degree in nutrition at the public university.  “During the day, I dedicate myself to my university degree, and I work at night; I have been living this way for four years already”, he says.  His dream is to complete his studies and work in his profession.  He wishes to purchase a laptop to continue with his studies.  This is his third loan cycle with the institution in the four years that he has been working and studying.  For these reasons, José is requesting a loan to purchase a laptop to complete his professional degree.

loans.use: to purchase a laptop to complete his professional degree.

loans.name: Carolina

texts.en:
Carolina is 54 years old and married with five children. Carolina works very hard to provide for them.

Carolina runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items to sell in her general store.

Carolina has been in this business for 20 years and sells a variety of items such as shampoo, fabric conditioner, detergent soap, canned goods, coffee, etc. 

Carolina would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell in her general store

loans.name: Crisanta

texts.en:
Crisanta is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Crisanta is 36 years old and has one child who is currently in school.

Crisanta has a general store business in the Philippines. Crisanta requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

Crisanta has been in this business for 7 years. Crisanta would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Crisanta

texts.en:
Crisanta works hard to support her family. She is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

Crisanta requested a PHP 19,500 loan through NWTF to purchase ingredients like sugar, bananas, cooking oil, etc. for her food vending business, which she has had for 15 years now.

Crisanta would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients like sugar, bananas, cooking oil, etc. for her food vending business.

loans.name: Jose Israel

texts.es:
José, está necesitando capital para comprar de manera inmediata insumos agrícolas para cultivar maíz, abastecerá a sus clientes y tendrá alimento para su familia, también invertirá en bolsas, cal y leña para que su compañera de vida continúe evolucionando en su negocio de venta de tortillas.
Con el crédito anterior se ha mantenido trabajando en la agricultura y apoyando a su pareja con su negocio, además aún cuenta con su empleo de promotor social, su familia tiene un mejor nivel de vida y sus ingresos son más estables.
texts.en: José needs capital to immediately buy farming supplies in order to grow corn, supply his customers, and have food to feed his family. He will also invest in bags, lime and wood so that his wife continues evolving in his business selling tortillas. With the previous loan he has been able to continue working in agriculture and supporting his wife with her business. In addition he still has his work as a social promoter. His family has a better quality of life and his income is more stable.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies to grow corn, supply his customers and be able to feed his family.

loans.name: Dulcisima

texts.en:
Dulcisima works hard to support her family. She is married and has a vegetables vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 30 years now.

Dulcisima requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more vegetables to sell to her customers. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Maria Del Trancito

texts.es:
María de 47 años de edad, no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar, pero siempre quiso aprender y aprovecho unos programas de alfabetización en su comunidad y aprendió a leer y escribir, es soltera y tiene 5 hijos todos estudiando y la mayor de 20 años de edad en la universidad; además de sus hijos vive en su madre en la casa de ella pero solo sus hijos dependen de ella.

María es comerciante y tiene un chalet en el que vende golosinas y comida rápida en un centro educativo, tiene 20 años de experiencia. Todos los días se levanta a las 4:00 am  a preparar le venta, luego camina un kilómetro antes de que lleguen los estudiantes hasta las 2:00 pm que cierra.
Solicita el préstamo para comprar mobiliario para su chalet, de manera que sus clientes estén más cómodos a la hora que degusten sus productos. María sueña con ampliar su local y hacerlo un comedor, emplear personal que le apoye con fin de mejorar los ingresos familiares y dar estabilidad a sus hijos.
texts.en: María is 47 years old, didn't have the opportunity to go to school, but always wanted to learn and she took advantage of some literacy of programs in her community and learned to read and write. She is single and has 5 children, all are in school. The oldest is 20 and she studies at the university. In addition to her children her mother lives with them but only her children are dependent upon her. Maria is a vendor and has a chalet where she sells candy and fast food in a school. She has had this business for 20 years. Every day she gets up at 4 AM to prepare her items to sell, then she walks a kilometer before the students arrive until 2 PM when school closes. She seeks a loan to buy furniture for her chalet, in this way her customers will be more comfortable at the moment of enjoying her products. Maria dreams of expanding her locale and making it a cafe, to employ help that support her with the goal of increasing her family's income and providing stability to her children.

loans.use: to buy furniture for her chalet.

loans.name: Cresilda

texts.en:
Cresilda is 40 years old and married with three children.

Cresilda is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

She has been in pig fattening for ten years now, and has borrowed eight times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Cresilda would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna is 59 years old and married with three children. She is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. 

She has been involved in pig fattening for 15 years now, and has borrowed 16 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Edna requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Maria Vicenta

texts.es:
María, está teniendo un mejor desarrollo económico con el buen uso de los créditos, su vida familiar es más confortable, en la tienda ofrece nuevos productos y la granja de pollos es más rentable.
Requiere de un préstamo por la facilidad de pago que le ofrece la institución y buenos resultados que estos le dan, lo invertirá en papel higiénico, especias, pastas, cereales, bebidas, pan, etc., esta compra le permitirá cubrir las demandas diarias de sus clientes.
texts.en:
María is doing much better economically, having used the loans well.  Her family has a more comfortable life, she is offering new products in the store, and the chicken farm is more profitable.

She is requesting a loan because of the simple payment plan that the institution offers, and the excellent results that she obtains.  She will invest it in toilet paper, spices, pasta, cereal, beverages, bread, etc. 

This purchase will allow her to meet her customers’ daily requests.

loans.use: to invest in toilet paper, spices, pasta, cereal, beverages, bread, etc., which will allow her to meet her customers' daily requests.

loans.name: Shabana

texts.en:
Shabana is a 37 years old and married woman. She has sold bangles sales for many years. 

Shabana buys bangles from the wholesale markets at lower prices and sells them to the people of her community at a profit. 

Her husband’s income is not enough to fulfill the family's needs.

Shabana has requested a loan of 40000 PKR  to buy the latest variety of bangles in different colors and designs to increase her sales to generate an healthier source of income. She has a good repayment history. 

Shabana wants to expand her business to provide a better living for her family.

loans.use: to buy bangles in different colors and designs to increase her sales.

loans.name: Zahida

texts.en:
Zahida is a 37-year-old, married woman and very dedicated mother of five children. She makes and sells woolen products such as hand-made sweaters, caps etc. 

She has supported her family with the help of income from this business. 

Zahida has requested for a loan of 45000 PKR to purchase spools of wool and yarns along with the packs of needles.  She will be able to meet the demands of her customers consistently and fulfill her dream of giving her children the best education and health facilities she can afford.

loans.use: to purchase spools of wool and yarns along with the packs of needles.

loans.name: Abida

texts.en:
Abida is a 49-year-old married woman. She has 4 children. She is a vigorous lady and for the past many years, she has been running a cloth/fabric purchase and sale business. 

She buys cloth in various colors and designs from the market at wholesale rates and then sells them to the people of her community. 

She has a varied customer base and is able to earn enough through her business. Now, she has requested a loan of 45,000 PKR  to buy a wide variety of cloth/fabric in different colors and designs to attract more customers and expand her business. 

She hopes to have a good experience with this new loan. Abida expects a boost in her earnings with the loan and she plans to spend part of her profits for the betterment of her family members.

loans.use: to buy a wide variety of cloth in different colors and designs to attract more customers and expand her business.

loans.name: Shehnaz

texts.en:
Shehnaz is 44, a married woman and a mother of 4 children. The income generated by her husband is insufficient to cover all household expenses, so she initiated her business of milk sales. She has been doing this for many years and has become famous for providing good quality milk in her locality. 

With the support of Kashf Foundation, she has gradually improved her business. Currently she is requesting a loan of 45,000 PKR  to purchase another buffalo to increase her sales and profits in order to provide her family with the basic necessities of life.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo to increase her sales and profits in order to provide her family with the basic necessities of life.

loans.name: Tomas

texts.es:
Tomas de 56 años de edad no estudió, está acompañado y tiene un hijo que ya es independiente y con hogar aparte. Su pareja es ama de casa y además de ella vive con una sobrina que apoya con las tareas del hogar.

Tomas es agricultor de granos básicos, pero en la temporada anterior tuvo un mal resultado por lo que decidió comprar dos vacas productoras de leche, inversión que le dio muy buenos resultados ya que la leche la vende a un comprador todos los días.

Solicita el préstamo para comprar una pareja de bueyes para sacar el cultivo de jícama que está próximo a sacar. Espera cosechar sin ningún problema y trasportar su producto hasta la plaza para venderlo, además tiene planeado comprar más vacas para aumentar la producción y venta de leche.
texts.en:
Tomás is 56 years old, and didn’t attend school.  He is in a common-law relationship, and has a son that is already independent, living in a separate home.  His partner is a housewife, and a niece also lives with him and helps with the housework.

Tomás is a farmer of basic grains, but in the previous season he had a poor yield, and this is why he decided to purchase two dairy cows, an investment that gave him good results because he sells the milk to a buyer every day.  

He is requesting the loan to purchase a pair of oxen to pull out the crop of jicama that is next for harvesting.  He hopes to harvest without any problem and transport his product to the plaza to sell it.  In addition, he has plans to purchase more cows to increase production and milk sales.

loans.use: to purchase a pair of oxen.

loans.name: Rasheeda

texts.en: Rasheeda is 43 years old, married, and a mother of three children. She is a hardworking mother who is helping her family by providing tailoring services in her community. She has been doing this for many years. She knows very well the techniques of stitching. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns enough to lead a decent life. To help her continue operating her business, she requested a loan of 35,000 PKR to buy materials such as spools of thread in different colors and packs of zippers and buttons to sew more dresses on time. In addition to repaying the loan, she will use part of the revenues to deal with personal expenses.

loans.use: to buy spools of threads in different colors and packs of zippers and buttons

loans.name: Safia

texts.en:
Safia is a 49 years old married woman and mother of six children. In order to support her family she began selling milk. 

She is known in her town for providing good quality milk. Safia owns buffaloes for milking. She is happily supporting her family with the income generated. 

Safia has requested a loan of 50000 PKR  to purchase another buffalo to inflate her sales, to help generate more income to cover her daily expenses.

loans.use: to purchase a buffalo.

loans.name: Danis Esau

texts.es:
Danis, está acompañado y tiene un hijo de 7 años, vive junto a sus padres y sus hermanos, todos colaboran en cubrir los gastos de su hogar, no tiene ayuda económica del extranjero, él se dedica a vender y a reparar electrodomésticos, el oficio lo aprendió dentro de su familia, tiene un horario de seis de la mañana a cuatro de la tarde, por el momento no representa dificultades en su negocio.
Invertirá en cables, juego de desatornilladores, tenazas, etc., para poder realizar un buen trabajo, espera aumentar su clientela y tener mejores ganancias que utilizara para ir cancelando sus cuotas y aportar en los gastos familiares.
Sus sueños son seguir adquiriendo experiencia en su negocio para tener clientes satisfechos, casarse para formalizar su núcleo familiar y construir su casa propia.
texts.en:
Danis is in a common-law relationship and he has a seven-year-old son. He lives with his parents and his brothers, who all contribute to paying for the household expenses. He does not have financial help from abroad. He makes a living selling and repairing appliances, which he learned from within his family. His schedule is from 6:00 in the morning until 4:00 in the afternoon. There are currently no difficulties with his business.

He will buy wires, a set of screwdrivers, pliers, etc to be able to provide good work. He hopes to increase his customer base and make a larger profit, which he will use to pay off his debts and to contribute to the household expenses.

His dreams are to continue gaining experience in his business, to have satisfied customers, to get married to form his nuclear family and to build his own home.

loans.use: to buy wires, a set of screwdrivers, pliers, etc to be able to provide good work.

loans.name: Ruben

texts.es:
Ruben es un hombre joven de 22 años de edad, soltero, sin hijos, trabaja como constructor y estudia en un instituto técnico.
Él es inteligente, emprendedor, independiente, generoso, amable, responsable y trabajador. Su trabajo lo desarrolla en la localidad de ‘Sacaba’ una comunidad campesina que agrupa a restaurantes que se especializan en comida típica y donde se elabora la ‘chicha’ (bebida fermentada de maíz), de clima cálido semitropical.
Ruben es de tez morena, cabello negro corto, baja estatura, ojos obscuros, su lengua materna es Quechua que se habla en el lugar y habla español por cultura general y por los estudios que realiza. Vive en casa de sus padres que es propia construida de ladrillo, que cuenta con electricidad y agua de pozo. Su trabajo es la construcción; el se encarga de realizar muros, paredes, vaciado  de pisos, techos, realiza pilares y todo lo que el rubro exige. “estudio en un instituo técnico para dejar de trabajar en construcción, quiero tener mi propio negocio y trabajar para mí…” comenta. Su sueño es terminar sus estudios y encontrar un buen trabajo en su profesión, el desea realizar la compra de una computadora portátil para continuar con sus estudios. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 2 años que viene estudiando y trabajando.
Es por esos motivos que Ruben solicita un préstamo para la compra de una computadora portátil para finalizar su carrera profesional.
texts.en:
Ruben is a 22-year-old young man. He is single, doesn't have children, works as a builder and studies in a technical institute. He is smart, entrepreneurial, independent, generous, friendly, responsible and hard-working. He works in the town of Sacaba, a rural community in a warm, semitropical climate formed around restaurants that specialize in traditional food and where they make 'chicha' (a drink fermented from corn).

Ruben is dark-skinned, has short black hair, is of short stature and has dark eyes. His mother tongue is Quechua, the language spoken in the area, and he speaks Spanish because of the general culture and for his studies. He lives in his parents' house, made of bricks and equipped with electricity and well water.

His work is in construction; he makes interior and exterior walls, digs out floors, makes roofs and pillars and everything that construction demands. "I study in a technical institute so that I can stop working in construction. I want to have my own business and work for myself," he says. His dream is to finish his studies and find a good job in his field.

He wants to buy a laptop computer to continue with his studies. This is the first series of loans with the institution in the two years that he has been studying and working. It is for these reasons that Ruben asks for a loan to buy a laptop computer to finish his professional degree.

loans.use: to buy a laptop computer to finish his professional degree.

loans.name: Ameyo

texts.fr: Améyo âgée de 40ans vit à Lomé.  Elle est revendeuse de prêt à porter depuis 2012. Son premier crédit qu'elle demande lui servira d'acheter des marchandises.  Elle souhaite devenir grossiste et mieux se prendre en charge.
texts.en:
Améyo is 40 years old and lives in Lomé. She has been selling ready-to-wear clothing since 2012. This first loan that she is seeking will serve to buy merchandise. 

She wishes to become a wholesaler and better support herself.

loans.use: to buy ready-to-wear clothing

loans.name: Islam

texts.en:
Islam is a 43-year-old man. He lives with his lovely family, which includes his daughter and son, who help Islam with his business. His wife is a tailor. Islam’s daughter, 18, is in tenth class and his son, 15, is in seventh class. His family are IDPs (internally displaced persons) from Fuzuli city and now live in the Fuzuli region.

For the past ten years, Islam has been in the animal breeding business. He buys small calves, raises them, and sells them at the bazaar. Today, he wants to increase his business and is requesting a loan of 1,000 AZN (Azerbaijan New Manat) to buy small calves. Islam is thankful to Kiva and the lenders for their help. In the future, Islam wants to help his children get a university education.

loans.use: to buy calves to increase his business

loans.name: Rufus

texts.en:
Lenders! Meet Rufus, 32 years of age and one of the most dedicated farmers in his rural town of Kerugoya. He is happily married and blessed with 2 lovely school-going children. He is the bread winner in his family since his wife has no formal job. Through milk, eggs, maize, and a variety of food crops, he has been able to earn a decent income. 

Of all the activities he is involved in, dairy farming is close to his heart. He passionately loves dairy farming and to prove this he has even nicknamed one of his cows. Feeding his cows is his hobby. Waking up every day in the morning to milk his cows makes him feel fulfilled. To increase the productivity of his dairy cows from the current 5-10 litres a day to 15-25 litres a day he needs to properly feed his cows, and this is the only secret to success. 

He is requesting a loan to buy a chaff cutter. The importance of a chaff cutter is to cut hay and straw into small pieces before mixing it with forage to feed the cows. Through the loan his cows will never have digestion complications and also the cows will never reject food and hence he will have increasing milk productivity. With your loan his cows will increase milk productivity, and through increased income and profit margins he will meet the basic needs of his family. His family will enjoy an improved diet, and apart from that he will secure the future of his children by paying tuition fees for them since they depend on him.

Support Rufus with a loan today!

loans.use: To buy a chaff cutter

loans.name: Manizha

texts.en:
Manizha is a repeat client. She lives in South Tajikistan. Manizha is a careful mother of 4 children. 

She has her own business deal and runs this deal well. Manizha retails clothes. She has been busy with this business more than 7 years. 

Manizha sells clothes in a local market. She works hard every day in cold weather and that’s why she is ill now. 

She is asking for a loan of 5000 Somoni to buy medicines for her treatment. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: To buy medicines for her treatment

loans.name: Rosalita

texts.en:
Her name is Rosalita. She is 46, a resident of Tanza, Cavite, Philippines and married with two children. She manages her household while operating the business. She works hard to augment their income to support and meet their daily personal and household needs and to send her children to school.

Rosalita operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a general store is basically a small convenience store which sells fresh, dry, and packaged commodities directly to consumers. Almost all products are essential household items and food. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by buying supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum net income of Php 900 a day.

To help her continue operations of her general store business she is requesting a Php 10,000 loan which she will use to buy grocery items such as fresh meat, sacks of rice, charcoal, soda and other grocery stuff. She expects a higher demand of groceries this holiday season. Her earnings are their source to meet their daily expenses and to send her children to school. She thanks God and you in advance for the financial help that will be given her. She wishes everyone a Blessed Christmas!

Rosalita hopes to sustain and grow her business to improve their quality of life. She strives very hard to send her children to school and prays for a quiet and happy life. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, beverages and toiletries to sell.

loans.name: Bich

texts.en: Bich, who is 36 years old, is married and has three children, one son and two daughters. She and her husband earn a living by running a food stall where they sell steamed sticky rice. They live in Ho Chi Minh City, and Bich has requested a loan to increase her working capital and buy good-quality rice and other ingredients to make food to sell. This additional capital will allow her to increase her income from her business and improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy sticky rice and ingredients to make steamed sticky rice to sell.

loans.name: Landilina

texts.en:
Landilina is 62 years old, married, and has two children. She works very hard to provide for them. Landilina runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 14,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more inventory to sell in her general store.

Landilina has been in this business for 10 years and sells a variety of items such as soft drinks, canned goods, snack foods, coffee, juice, noodles, etc. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more inventory to sell in her general store

loans.name: Nelson Antonio

texts.es:
Nelson, de 40 años de edad, se dedica a la agricultura y a la ganadería, sus estudios culminaron hasta noveno grado, está casada y tiene 3 hijos.


Nelson, se levanta a las 5:00 a.m. para ir a trabajar durante la mañana junto a su esposa en la parcela que alquila y durante el resto del día trabaja cuidando animales de un vecino y los que el tiene. 
 
Nelson, necesita el crédito para comprar una novilla, con esta compra él espera generar en un futuro una buena producción de leche, para que su esposa empiece a elaborar productos lácteos para vender entre los vecinos.

Nelson, planea en un futuro comprar un terreno donde poder construir una vivienda digna para su familia y donde tener sus animales, ya que actualmente no tiene un lugar propio donde vivir con su familia.
texts.en:
Nelson, of 40 years old, makes a living working in agriculture and animal breeding.  He studied until 9th grade; he is married and has 3 children.  

Nelson wakes up at 5:00 am to go to work in the morning with his wife in their rented plot of land and then the rest of the day he works taking care of his and his neighbors’ animals. 

Nelson needs the credit to buy a heifer.  With this purchase he hopes to generate a high production of milk so that his wife can start making lactose products to sell to their neighbors.  

Nelson plans to buy land in the future where he can build a decent house for his family and where he can keep his animals, as he currently doesn't have his own home for his family.

loans.use: to buy a heifer

loans.name: Amen Lom Group

texts.en:
Lamneihat is a young and energetic mother of a little girl. She is 21 years old and has engaged herself in a red meat business to earn her income. The profiled borrower of the group, Lamneihat is pictured with her hand raised among the group members.

Mostly, a butcher is considered as a men’s job in the area, but Lamneihat does not hesitate to work as a butcher. It is one good quality she had as a person to strive forward to her financial goal and not to bother about what others think about her occupation.

She lives with her baby daughter and husband, who is a daily wage earner. They work hard in their own capability for survival. Their income is hardly enough to maintain the household requirements with an infant in the house. She aspires to have sufficient amount of capital so that she could buy a large quantity of fresh red beef and pork to sell to customers. She is in the initial stage of this business, so she is in need of capital to develop her business.

The Kiva loan will be used to buy red beef and pork to sell. It will help her financial insecurities, and she hopes to make good use of the loan. She is very happy and gives her best wishes to all the lenders.

The rest of the group members are engaged in different businesses to support themselves. They are all very hardworking and believe they will achieve their financial goals in the near future. The Kiva loan will help them to improve their business undertakings.

loans.use: to buy beef and pork for selling.

loans.name: Elmira Lyn

texts.en:
Elmira Lyn is 22 years old and married. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell, like canned goods, shampoo, detergent soap, fabric conditioners, bath soap, toothpaste, etc. 

In the future, Elmira Lyn would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell, like canned goods, shampoo, detergent soap, fabric conditioners, bath soap, toothpaste, etc.

loans.name: Lamhil Group

texts.en:
The featured group member, Thenkholhing, is 32 years old. Lamhil Group consists of five hardworking women who have common business interests. Their group leader was selected for good discipline and the one with strong investment spirit.

Thenkholhing is pictured with her hand raised. The group members share a common geographical area called Thinkangphai village, which is about one and a half hour’s drive from Imphal town. Thenkholhing owns a mini variety store in her village. Most villagers buy their household groceries from her store, and her mini variety store is quite popular in her village.

Due to unavoidable circumstances in her family, she had to pay for a certain fee, which was out of her expenditure. After this happened, she had to face certain financial insufficiency regarding her business and other maintenance. Now that she cannot run her business like the way she did before, her store became less popular. She aspires to revive her store once again and start over by selling more items in her mini variety store. For this, she is in dire need of capital.

With the Kiva loan, she will buy more goods to sell in her shop. The income she gets will be used in her household expenses. She is very happy and sends her thanks to the lenders.

The other group members are all very hardworking and strive to be self-reliant in their finances. They send their gratitude to the lenders.

loans.use: to buy inventory of edible oil, sugar, detergent powder, soap, grains, etc. to sell in her variety shop to generate income.

loans.name: Thanh

texts.en:
Thanh is 34 years old and married with three children, two sons and one daughter. She lives with her family in a small house in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband earns income as a a driver for hire. Thanh runs a shop selling beverages and coffee to earn a living.

She started her business five years ago. She intends to take a loan to gradually expand her business by buying many kinds of beverages and coffee to sell to her customers.

She hopes her business runs smoothly and will help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy beverages and coffee to sell in her shop.

loans.name: Sreymuch's Group

texts.en:
Living in a rural area in Siem Reap province, Sreymuch is 40 years old and a mother of four children. 

She earns income to improve her family condition via rice cropping and cassava. She has been involved in this business for ages and it earns her about 30,000 KHR per day. 

For Sreymuch, this is her first time with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She leads a group of three to get a new loan. As the group leader, she will spend her loan portion to pay for labor fees. She hopes that she can get more income to update her lifestyle.

loans.use: To pay for labor fees.

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Srey Snom district

loans.name: Guillerma

texts.en:
Guillerma is a married woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 53 years old and has one child who is still in school.
