She has a food vending business in the Philippines and has been in this business for 19 years.

Guillerma requested a PHP 9,500 loan amount through NWTF to purchase ingredients for her food production business. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Kousar

texts.en: Kousar is a 46-year-old married woman. She runs a business selling milk with her husband. She has buffaloes and cows for milk production. Her husband sells the milk in nearby areas.  Kousar’s job is to look after the buffalos and collect the milk from them. Together, both husband and wife are supporting their family. However, they need to earn more income for their everyday expenses. Therefore, Kousar has requested 45,000 PKR to buy one more buffalo. This will enable her to cater to more customers and provide a better standard of living to her family members.

loans.use: to buy one more buffalo

loans.name: Lani

texts.en:
Lani works hard to support her family. She is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Lani requested a PHP 29500 loan through NWTF to purchase more items to sell.  She has been in this business for 20 years.

Lani would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase items to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Ana Rosa

texts.es: ANA ROSA: Es una joven cordial de 26 años de edad, madre soltera de dos hijos menores de edad. Trabaja como enfermera en Waspam. Con gran esfuerzo poco a poco ha iniciado la construcción de su vivienda de madera, sin embargo con su salario no le cubre para realizarle algunas mejoras como Instalación de energía eléctrica y divisiones internas que serán utilizados como cocina y cuartos.  Es por eso que solicitan un préstamo para poder hacer estas mejoras. Con el préstamo va comprar madera cepillada, clavos, cables, panel eléctrico, braker, tomas corriente y pagar la mano de obra. Ella sueña con tener una casa bonita, con mejores condiciones de seguridad y mejor ambiente para  sus hijos.
texts.en:
Ana Rosa is a kind young woman. She is 26 years old and a single mother of two small children. She works as a nurse in Waspam.

She is making great efforts, little by little, to build a wooden house. However, with her wages, she cannot afford to make some basic improvements to the house, such as installing the electrical system and building internal walls to separate the kitchen and the bedrooms.

That is why she requests this loan, to be able to make these improvements. She will use the loan to buy planed timber, nails, wires, an electrical panel, breakers and wall sockets, and to pay the workers.

She dreams of having a beautiful and safer home and a better environment for her children.

loans.use: to install the electrical system in her wooden house and to build internal walls to separate the kitchen and the bedrooms.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita works hard to support her family. Lolita is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Lolita requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

Lolita has been in this business for 15 years now.

In the future, Lolita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Azra

texts.en:
Azra is a 41-year-old, hardworking woman. She has been providing the service of stitching clothes in her locality. She is quite popular for her skills in stitching. 

Her work brought the family out of a financial crisis that they were facing when she started working. Over the years, she has established a good clientele. 

Azra has requested a loan of 50,000 PKR. She intends to use this loan to purchase a new stitching machine with some spools of threads and laces for consistently meeting the demands of her customers. 

She aspires to save money for their prosperous future.

loans.use: to purchase a new stitching machine with some spools of threads and laces for consistently meeting the demands of her customers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy 5 cases of tomatoes, a sack of cabbage, cucumbers and other items.

loans.name: Pari Lom Group

texts.en:
Lalrinmawi, the one pictured with her hand raised, is the profiled member of the group “Pari.” She is 24 years old and happily married. She lives with her husband, 11-month-old baby girl, and her in-laws. Her husband, a policeman, is the main source of income in the household, and all the members are mutually dependent on his income. With many dependent members in the house, the occurrence of financial shortage never leaves them.

Lalrinmawi, with a strong determination, took the initiative to start a business in order to solve their financial problems. She started a clothing business by selling clothes from door to door. It slightly helps in improving her financial condition, even though she is at her initial stage of business. With an infant child, it was difficult to run her business regularly, and most of her business days failed since she had to look after the baby.

To stabilize her business, she opened a clothing store at her own house so that she could sell her products comfortably without any disturbances. She aspires to stock up her store with many varieties of items to meet the taste of customers and to attract more customers. But due to lack of capital, she had to wait for external help.

She considers herself fortunate to get the Kiva loan, which will help to improve her business. She will buy stock of clothing to sell in her store with the Kiva loan. She is very joyful to get the loan. The income derived from the store will help her household financial maintenance.

The remaining group members are all very happy with the Kiva loan. They are very determined to achieve financial independence and strive forward to achieve their goals through the Kiva loan.

loans.use: to buy inventory of clothing (tops, pants, sweaters, jackets) to sell in her store.

loans.name: Kakule

texts.fr: Kakule est un fonctionnaire dans une organisation évangélique baptiste. Il est parent de 2 étudiants à l’université, tous en deuxième année de graduat respectivement dans les facultés d’économie et de sante publique. Il a été informé des nouvelles opportunités de financement de frais académiques par l’IMF Hekima. Ainsi, ce nouveau prêt lui servira de payer les frais académiques pour ces 2 étudiants (fille et garçon) en fin qu’ils ne soient plus exclus de cours durant toute l’année académique 2014-2015. Ce parent fonctionnaire, rêve voir sa fille et son fils devenir hauts cadres en santé publique et chef d’entreprise. Il remercie l’IMF Hekima pour son nouveau produit innovant dédiés à l’éducation de leurs enfant en leur donnant de crédit d’impact social.
texts.en: Kakule is a civil servant in a baptist evangelical organization. He is the father of two children studying at university, both in their second year of graduate school studying economics and public health. He was informed by Hekima MFI about new financial opportunities to cover the academic costs. He is asking for a loan in order to cover the costs of the 2014-2015 academic year. He dreams of seeing his daughter and son become a high level executive in public health and a company manager. He is grateful to the MFI Hekima for their innovative new product dedicated to providing an education for children by providing families with a loan that has a social impact.

loans.use: cover the academic costs for his two children (girl and boy)

loans.name: Khalida

texts.en:
Khalida is a 49 year old, married woman. She has successfully run a small general store in the corner of her house. Khalida is keen to provide her family with better living conditions.  

Over time Khalida has become famous on her street for providing good quality products.  

Khalida requested a loan of 40000 PKR to purchase grocery items including grains, peas, flour, sugar and tea, to cater to her customers.  She hopes to generate a healthier source of income. 

Khalida is positive about her future earnings and will spend part of her income to buy more items for her store.

loans.use: to purchase more grocery items to sell.

loans.name: Shakeel

texts.en: Shakeel is a 37-year-old married man. He has been successfully running a primary school in his community for the last three years. Today, there are over 100 students in his school. A motivated and hard worker, he wants to grow his business. He requested a loan of PKR 75,000 to provide better facilities for his students, such as chairs and benches, and to increase his business capital. Shakeel believes that in growing his business, he can also help the children of his community have access to good quality education.

loans.use: to provide better facilities for his students, such as chairs and benches, and to increase his business capital.

loans.name: Neris Del Socorro

texts.es: Neris es una señora de profesión maestra de educación primaria del cual tiene 27 años de laborar, soltera, con dos hijos a su cargo, a los que apoya en su desarrollo académico, actualmente tiene la necesidad de mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda, atravez de un financiamiento, el que solicito atravez de Ceprodel para utilizarlo en  Compra de cemento, arena, bloques y de esa manera construir pared y repello, las que le dará mejores condiciones y nivel de vida
texts.en: Neris is a woman of the teaching profession of primary school, of which she has 27 years of working. She is single, with two dependent children, whom she supports in their academic development. Currently, she has the need of improving the conditions of her home, by means of a loan, which she applied for through Ceprodel. She will use it for the purchase of cement, sand, cinderblock and, in this manner, construct a wall and surface coat it. This will give her better conditions and level of life.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, cinderblocks.

loans.name: Tural

texts.en:
Tural  is 29 years old. He was single but decided to marry. There are four members in the family. He always tries to help his family. He is a hardworking man and his monthly income 300 manat. Tural lives in Imishli.

He couldn’t get a higher education and, because of that, he decided to start his own business. For that, he choose farming. He is growing fruits and vegetables in his own yard. Tural has five years of experience in this field, thanks to his family, but his situation is very hard. He needs to raise fruits and care for them, but the lack of water in the region makes it a problem for him.

Because of this problem, his productivity has fallen, and he can’t cover the family’s needs. He applied for a 1,200 AZN loan in order to be able to supply water to his garden weekly. This will increase his productivity again and the family’s income will rise. He hopes lenders will help him.

loans.use: to supply water to his garden.

loans.name: Irma Leonor

texts.es: Irma tiene 44 años de edad y se gana la vida por medio de sus pequeños negocios de venta de leche y por medio de la crianza y venta de cerdos. De esta forma se gana la vida y lleva el sustento a su hogar. Con el deseo de dar a su familia mejores condiciones habitacionales solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la mejora de su vivienda dado que actualmente el piso de la mima es de tierra y las paredes no están repelladas por lo que están propensas a que los insectos aniden en ella. Con el monto solicitado comprará cemento, arena, grava, etc. para repellar las paredes y para encementar el piso de la vivienda.
texts.en: Irma is 44 years old and makes a living with her small businesses of selling milk  and raising and selling pigs. That is how she makes a living and supports her household. With the desire of giving her family better living conditions, she is asking for a loan from FUSAI to invest in improving her home, since the floor is currently dirt and the walls aren't plastered, making them prone to insects nesting in them. With the amount that she is asking for she will buy cement, sand, gravel, etc. to plaster the walls and cement the floors of her home.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, gravel, etc. to plaster the walls and cement the floors of her home.

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie is a married woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 35 years old, and all of her children are in school.

Rosemarie has a pig fattening business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for four years. She requested a PHP 13,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs.

In the future, Rosemarie would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Herminia

texts.en:
Herminia works hard to support her family. Herminia is married and has a buy and sell herbal medicines business in the Philippines.

Herminia requested a 30,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of herbal medicines to sell.

Herminia has been in this business for 15 years now.

In the future, Herminia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of herbal medicines to sell

loans.name: Arlinda

texts.en:
Arlinda is 43 years old and married with three children. With two children currently in school, Arlinda works very hard to provide for them.

Arlinda runs a general store in the Philippines and requested an 11,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks to sell in her general store.

Arlinda has been in this business for three years and sells a variety of items such as sanitary pads, diapers, cereals, noodles, juice, milk, canned goods, bath soap, etc. 

In the future, Arlinda would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks to sell in her general store

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna is 60 years old and married with one child. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Lorna has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Lorna requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional boxes of fish to sell to her customers.

Lorna has been in this business for 45 years. Lorna would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional boxes of fish to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Maylynda

texts.en:
Maylynda is a married woman with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Maylynda is 29 years old and has two children who are in school.

Maylynda has a general store business in the Philippines. Maylynda requested a PHP 16,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell in her general store.

Maylynda has been in this business for four years. In the future, Maylynda would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell in her general store

loans.name: Jeanette

texts.en:
Jeanette is 52 years old and married with two children. She earns a living through her pig fattening business in the Philippines. 

She has been pig fattening for 4 years and also earns additional income from photo copying.

Jeanette is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy vaccines, feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy vaccines, feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Luisa

texts.en:
Luisa is a married woman with seven children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Luisa is 51 years old and two of her children are currently in school.

Luisa has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Luisa requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more fish to sell to her customers.

Luisa has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Luisa would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell to her customers

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Marilyn is 39 years old and both of her children are in school.

Marilyn has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Marilyn requested a PHP 19,500 loan through NWTF to buy more fish to sell.

Marilyn has been in this business for three years. In the future, Marilyn would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell

loans.name: Astrit

texts.en:
Astrit is a 40-year-old married father of two teenage children. The loan he is requesting will be used to buy potato seeds for planting. To earn a living, Astrit does agriculture (mostly he plants and sells lima beans and in smaller quantities potatoes). His region is known for the best quality of such produce. At the same time, he works for pay at a marble company located in the vicinity of his village. His wife owns a little hair salon where she practices her profession. 

Even though the soil is very prolific, under the communist era it was not used properly; however, since the collapse of the previous regime, villagers have been trying to take full advantage of the soil, planting all sorts of veggies. The results have been very positive, according to villagers.

loans.use: to buy potato seeds for planting

loans.name: Tanzeela

texts.en: Tanzeela is a 30-year-old married woman. She has been successfully running a school for two years. Starting a school required a lot of hard work, but that is something Tanzeela has never shied away from. Today, there are nearly 100 students in her school, and more than half of her students are girls. Tanzeela is a motivated individual and wants to improve and expand her school. She has requested a loan of PKR 80,000 to provide better facilities for her students, such as chairs and desks. Tanzeela is committed to her school and wants to contribute towards providing quality education for the children in her community.

loans.use: to provide better facilities for her students, such as chairs and desks.

loans.name: Gurazi

texts.en:
Gurazi wants to add a dairy cow to his existing herd of three, and he is requesting your financial help. Currently, he’s got some cows and he sells the raw milk from them to a nearby dairy farm. 
Gurazi, a 40-year-old villager and a married man, has been photographed with Rinushe, his wife, and their two children who are 10 and 8 years old. They live in a village in southeastern Albania.  To earn an income, he and his wife have been pursuing livestock for some time now. In addition to this, he receives disability income, and his mother who lives with them receives a retirement pension. They are indeed poor.

loans.use: to add another dairy cow to the existing herd of three

loans.name: Farzana

texts.en:
Farzana is a happily married woman. Some years ago, she decided to support her family by starting a business of tailoring at her home as her husband's income was barely enough to meet their day-to-day expenses. 

Farzana is popularly known in her area for her skill in stitching. However, due to a shortage of raw material, she is facing difficulty in meeting daily expenses related to her business. 

Therefore, she has requested a loan of PKR 35,000. With the requested loan, she wants to purchase stitching supplies, such as threads of different colors, laces, zippers and fabrics to stitch up more dresses on time to generate a healthy income for her family.

loans.use: to purchase stitching supplies, such as threads of different colors, laces, zippers and fabrics to stitch up more dresses on time to generate a healthy income for her family.

loans.name: Muneer  Fatima

texts.en: Muneer Fatima always had a desire to educate the children of her community and decided to open her own school after completing her education. In the school's first year, she had 20 students. Today, there are almost 100 students at the school. She is an efficient school manager and focuses on providing an inclusive learning environment for her students and teachers. Muneer Fatima feels her school has the potential to grow more and needs help to improve the infrastructure and facilities of the school to accommodate more students and to provide a comfortable learning environment. For this, she requires a loan of PKR 75,000.

loans.use: to improve the infrastructure and facilities of her school to accommodate more students and to provide a comfortable learning environment.

loans.name: Sajida

texts.en:
Sajida is a 35-year-old married woman. She is a very talented lady and excels in her work of stitching. She has gotten a lot of appreciation from her community. 

Some years ago she started her business of tailoring for running her household activities. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses. 

She has now requested a loan of 45,000 PKR  to purchase more spools of threads, ribbons, fabrics, needles and scissors for stitching up more dresses on time to get a boost in her earnings. 

Sajida wishes to spend her earnings on providing a quality life for her family members.

loans.use: to purchase more spools of threads, ribbons, fabrics, needles and scissors for stitching up more dresses on time to get a boost in her earnings.

loans.name: Shamim

texts.en: Shamim is a 44-year-old married woman. She has been involved in the business of cloth trade. She purchases a variety of cloth at low prices from the city market and sells it in her own town. She has a strong customer base and makes a good amount of income to contribute to the family income. Shamim  has requested a loan of 50,000 PKR. She wants to buy a greater variety of cloth in different colors for her business, to get a boost in her earnings with her loan.

loans.use: to buy a greater variety of cloth in different colors for her business, to get a boost in her earnings with her loan

loans.name: Diana Lorena

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Nuestra Señora De la Luz se reúne cada 15 días en la ciudad de Manta,  ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año y por ser una ciudad con una belleza sin igual con muchos atractivos turísticos.
En este lugar vive la señora Diana, tiene 41 años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión  libre y de esta relación tiene dos hijos de 20 y 14 años de edad, el menor estudia en colegio, pero ambos aun viven con ellos. Su esposo es comerciante.
Doña Diana es una gran ama de casa y buena esposa que le gusta trabajar para ayudarle a su esposo con los gastos del hogar, ella vende ropa de todo tipo así como también productos de Avon y Yanbal (artículos de belleza, cosméticos perfumería y accesorios para damas), trabaja todos los  días y su forma de venta es puerta a puerta, deja a crédito y cobra cada 8 días, lleva 2 años en esta actividad con la cual se gana algo por su cuenta para el bienestar de su familia .
Este crédito es para comprar cremas, perfumes, bisutería entre otros productos. Esta desde el inicio en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque los créditos le son de mucha ayuda. Sus sueños son que a sus hijos nunca les falte nada.
texts.en:
The credit group “Nuestra Señora De la Luz” (Our Lady of the Light) meets every 15 days in the city of Manta, a city known for its beautiful beaches which are very popular to visit throughout the whole year.  Also, it is a city known for its incomparable beauty with many tourist attractions. This is where Mrs. Diana lives.  

She is 41 years old, is in a common law relationship and has 2 children with this partner, one of 14 and one of 20 years old.  The youngest one is studying in high school and both still live with them.  Her husband is a salesman. 

Mrs. Diana is a hardworking homemaker and a good wife who enjoys working to help her husband with the household expenses. She sells all types of different clothing, as well as Avon and Yanbal products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfume and accessories for women).  She works every day and she sells her products door to door.  She allows her clients to pay with credit and she collects payments every 8 days.  She's been doing this work for 2 years which is how she earns herself a bit of money to help with the well-being of her family.
 
This loan is to buy creams, perfumes, jewelry as well as other products.  She has been with the credit group since the beginning and she likes it as the loans are very helpful. Her dream is that her children are never lacking anything.

loans.use: to buy creams, perfumes, jewelry, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for a Medical Technology degree.

loans.name: Rukia

texts.en:
Rukia is a married woman with two children, neither of whom attend school because they are young. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past six years, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge of customers taking too long to pay for goods taken on credit. 

With the loan of 20,000 she is requesting, she wants to purchase more stock of sugar, rice, maize flour, and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of sugar, rice, maize flour, and wheat flour

loans.name: Oanh

texts.en:
Oanh, 34, is married and has one daughter and one son. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband is a brick layer.

Oanh has been running a food stall for selling beverages and coffee in front of her house for seven years. She is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying more different beverages and coffee to better satisfy her customers.

She hopes her business runs smoothly and will generate a higher income to assist her in improving her family's living conditions and sending her children to school.

loans.use: To buy soft drinks and coffee for selling.

loans.name: Riziki

texts.en:
Riziki is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her monthly expenses are school fees and food.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past three years, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge of debtors staying too long to pay for goods taken on credit.

With the loan of 50,000 KES she is requesting, she wants to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour, and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour, and wheat flour.

loans.name: Huong

texts.en:
Huong, 33, is married and has two children. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband is a driver for hire. She earns an income running a shop selling milk tea in front of her house.

She started this business two years ago. She is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying a greater variety of milk tea and some other household items for her family.

She hopes her business runs smoothly and will generate a higher income to assist her in improving her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy milk tea, and some household items for her family.

loans.name: Van

texts.en:
Van is 39 years old, and is married with a son. Her husband is a security guard for a local company. She has been running a food stall for selling bread and meat in front of her door for eight years. She started this business to cover her expenses and raise her children. They live in Ho Chi Minh City.

Van is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying a larger quantity of bread and meat products so that she will be able to increase the turnover of her business.

She hopes that through the loan, she will be able to expand her business activities, and have money to reinvest in her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy bread and meat products for selling at her food stall.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita works hard to support her family. She is married and has a pig fattening business in the Philippines. Teresita has been in this business for five years now.

Teresita requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Teresita would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is 60 years old and married with five children. Victoria works very hard to provide for them.

Victoria runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a loan of 40,000 PHP through NWTF to buy additional stocks to sell, such as bread, soft drinks, canned goods, sanitary pads, toothpaste, noodles, juice, cereals, etc.

Victoria has been in this business for 30 years and sells a variety of items, such as bread, soft drinks, canned goods, sanitary pads, toothpaste, noodles, juice, cereals, etc. 

Victoria would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks to sell, such as bread, soft drinks, canned goods, sanitary pads, toothpaste, noodles, juice, cereals, etc.

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline is 46 years old and married with three children.

Evangeline works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 14,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell in her general store.

Evangeline has borrowed and repaid five loans from NWTF prior to this loan. She has been running the general store for two years and also earns an income from food vending.

Evangeline aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Narcisa

texts.en:
Narcisa is 44 years old and married.  

Narcisa is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Narcisa requested a 16,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Narcisa has been in pig fattening for 10 years now, and has borrowed 20 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Narcisa would like to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Jenefer

texts.en:
Jenefer is 19 years old and married with one child. Jenefer works very hard to provide for them.

Jenefer runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more items like biscuits, candies, snack foods, beers, canned goods, detergent soap, shampoo, etc. to sell.

Jenefer has been in this business for four years and sells a variety of items such as biscuits, candies, snack foods, beers, canned goods, detergent soap, shampoo, etc. 

Jenefer would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more items like biscuits, candies, snack foods, beers, canned goods, detergent soap, shampoo, etc. to sell

loans.name: Maricar

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Maricar works hard to support her family.

She has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from her general store. 

Maricar is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to purchase spare parts and gasoline for her motorcycle.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her past 3 loans from NWTF. 

Maricar hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts and gasoline for her motorcycle.

loans.name: Charito

texts.en:
Charito works hard to support her family. She is married and has an herbal medicines business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 20 years now.

She requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of herbal medicines to sell. Charito would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of herbal medicines to sell.

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
Wilma is 48 years old and married with six children. With two children currently in school, Wilma works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock to sell in her general store.

She has been in this business for 3 years and sells a variety of items, such as rope, canned goods, soft-drinks, seasonings, coffee, salt, vinegar, diapers, etc. 

In the future, Wilma would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Zeenat

texts.en: Zeenat is a 59-year-old married woman. She has been doing a business of cattle purchase and sales with the help of her husband for many years. Their business is good enough for the family to lead a decent life. Zeenat is a mother of six children. She is very motivated to provide them a beautiful life with good food, health and clothing. She has improved the business to meet the day-to-day expenses of her family. It’s her sixth loan cycle with Kashf Foundation. They are happily running their business through Kashf's support. Now she requested a loan of 50,000 PKR to buy more cattle including baby goats, calves etc. to increase their sales and profits.

loans.use: to buy more cattle including baby goats, calves etc. to increase her sales and profits

loans.name: Khalida

texts.en: Khalida is a 48-year-old married woman. She is involved in the business of selling animals, with the help of her husband from many years. Her business is good enough to give her family a decent life and she has improved her business to meet their everyday expenses. Now she has applied for a loan of PKR 40,000 to purchase more calves and baby goats. This will enable her to increase their sales, which ultimately helps in generating more earnings.

loans.use: to purchase more calves and baby goats to increase their sales, which ultimately helps to generate more earnings.

loans.name: Shakran

texts.en: Shakran is a 45-year-old married woman. She is in the business of animal purchase and sale with the help of her husband. They started their business with the support of Kashf Foundation. Her husband buys animals, i.e., buffaloes, goats and cows, at low prices, raises them, and sells them at higher prices in the market. They are running a successful business to provide their family, including four children, with a decent life. Now Shakran is requesting a loan of 40,000 PKR to purchase two more goats in order to increase their revenue. She hopes to grow their business, and dreams of giving a good and quality education to their children through all her hard work in their business.

loans.use: to purchase two more goats in order to increase their revenue

loans.name: Gema

texts.en:
Gema is a married woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Gema is 30 years old and has two children who are currently in school.

She has a buy and sell dry goods business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 1,7000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more stock of dry goods, like shoes, slippers, etc. to sell to her customers.

Gema has been in this business for 5 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more stock of dry goods, like shoes, slippers, etc. to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn works hard to support her family. Jocelyn is married and has a general store business in the Philippines. She has requested a 30,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional groceries to sell in her general store. Jocelyn has been in this business for 15 years now.

In the future, Jocelyn would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Xazar

texts.en:
Xazar is a 22-year-old single man. Xazar lives with his family. He has been working on a water project for two years. He has good experience in this sector. His monthly income is 150 AZN. Xazar knows everything about water channels. He knows how to prepare projects for different regions, how to build them, and how to keep them in control. Additionally, he takes part in the building of such channels. His team is building a new irrigation canal for all neighbor regions in order to improve living conditions and fruit, vegetable, and crop fields’ productivity.

Xazar requested a loan of 1,100 AZN, which he will use to buy new, quality tools for his job and coveralls for his team. This loan will increase the quality of his team’s work and their income.

loans.use: to buy new, quality tools

loans.name: Romina

texts.es:
Romina está estudiando para ser una buena profesional y para poder ayudarles a los miembros de su familia.
Le gusta mucho la carrera de trabajo social que está estudiando y espero que cuando termine pueda trabajar en su profesión y poder ayudar a las personas. 
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar sus cuotas y seguir estudiando como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
Romina is studying to become a good professional so that she can help the members of her family. She enjoys her studies toward a degree in Social Work. Romina hopes to work in this profession when she finishes her degree so that she can help people.

She is requesting this loan so that she can pay her fees and continue her studies just as before.

loans.use: to pay her university fees.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy bricks, cement, zinc, iron and labor.

loans.name: La Familia Group

texts.es:
Las 19 integrantes de este comité se esfuerzan por ir superándose cada día. Este grupo se llama “La Familia”, ya que cada una de ellas, está luchando por sus familias, para poder darles lo que ellas no pudieron tener.
Dora integra este grupo, ella es una mujer muy trabajadora y sacrificada, que quiere dar a sus seres queridos todo lo que necesitan para una vida digna y sin privaciones. Ella se dedica a vender comidas, que hace ella misma, y que después sale a vender de forma ambulante.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertir en la compra de insumos para poder seguir haciendo sus comidas, como ser verduras, condimentos, carne, y demás, de manera a poder seguir con su trabajo como lo viene haciendo. Ella es una mujer muy trabajadora y emprendedora que esta luchando y creciendo.
texts.en:
The 19 members of this village bank strive to go outdoing themselves every day. This group is called "La Familia," since each one of them is fighting for their families, to be able to give them what they couldn't have.

Dora belongs to this group. She is a very hardworking and sacrificing woman, who wants to give to her dear ones all that they need for a dignified life and without deprivation. She works selling food, that she herself makes, and later she leaves to sell as a street vendor.

She is applying for this loan to be able to invest in the purchase of supplies to be able to continue making her food, like vegetables, condiments, beef and more. In this manner be able to continue with her work as she's doing. She is a very hardworking and enterprising woman who is fighting and growing.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, condiments, beef and more.

loans.name: Susana

texts.en:
Susana is a married woman with six children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Susana is 59 years old and has one child who is still in school.

Susana has a general store business in the Philippines. Susana requested a 14,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell in her general store.

Susana has been in this business for two years. Susana would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Marivil

texts.en:
Marivil is 35 years old and has six children. Marivil is married and five of her children are currently in school.

Marivil is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Marivil requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to buy vaccines, feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Marivil has been raising pigs for four years now and has borrowed six times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Marivil would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy vaccines, feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Vergie

texts.en:
Vergie is a married woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Vergie is 31 years old and has two children who are currently in school.

Vergie has a buy and sell ready to wear business in the Philippines. Vergie requested a PHP 25,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more stock of ready to wear to sell.

Vergie has been in this business for eight years. In the future, Vergie would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of ready to wear to sell

loans.name: Maia

texts.en:
Maia, who is a 34-year-old single woman, lives in Tbilisi city. She has only a father, who is involved in a small trading business and generates insignificant income. Up until now, before Maia started her own activity, her father's income was their only source of income. Maia has just started her own business, specifically she opened a beauty salon, where she serves clients herself. 

In order to make her work more effective, Maia asked for financial support from local financial institutions. Maia has been approved for a loan within the framework of a joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. She will purchase all needed tools and continue providing her lovely service. The loan will greatly assist Maia and she will be able to improve her economic situation and give her family a better lifestyle.

loans.use: To supply her beauty salon with good tools and get many customers
